Reviews.Title: “You want to thoroughly enjoy Istanbul? Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Screenname1967
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights and it was very well worth the money. It is not one of the budget hotels. However, after a day of sight-seeing in the exciting but also noisy and very crowded city it was a pleasure to get back to this nicely decorated and quiet hotel. The rooftop terrace offered wonderful views of the sea and the Blue Mosque. The location - just around the corner from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia - could not be beat. The breakfast, on the rooftop terrace, was the perfect mix of regular continental and Turkish items. The room (503) was very clean and also offered a view of the sea. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I can only recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience EVER!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: southy6
Reviews.Content: This is just a fabulous property. Not only is it charming...but it is located close to ALL of the best sights...within walking distance to everything. The rooms are beautifully detailed with luxurious fabrics and furniture....and the bathrooms have recently been redone and are amazing. BUT... BY FAR.....THE BEST THING ABOUT THIS HOTEL.....is the STAFF. The service is incredible and you really feel like their only goal is to make sure that your every need is taken care of with the utmost of care and charm. Exceptional employees...truly wonderful people...you want them to be your best friends! Trust me...you'll love this place and want to return! Aimee Southworth

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Giovanni S
Reviews.Content: Hotel has only 17 rooms.Therefore they take VERY GOOD CARE OF YOU! Very good and generous BUFFET BREAKFAST. Hotel has terrace overlooking sea where you can have breakfast in good weater.Rooms are small but location is only a few minutes walking to most of the historical monuments (hotel is located in old part of the city which is very clean.Plenty of tulips in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: DaveHLA
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right in the heart of Sultanahmet, Blue Mosque, old city. Lovely, clean rooms. Ours had a view over the city and of the Marmara Sea. Staff was friendly and helpful. Only problem was confusion over pick-up at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Charmingly Old Fashioned”
Reviews.Author: sselhorst
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my boyfriend in the Corner Suite, which was enormous by American hotel standards. The staff was amazingly hospitable and kind as well (and VERY quick to respond to emails). All in all, however, this was one of the strangest hotels that I have ever stayed in. The decor and ambiance was fairly reminiscent of my grandmother's house, so that while the four-poster bed was very romantic, the faded, damask wallpaper, heavy antique furniture and general silence cast a particular gothic/ghostly aura over our stay. The jacuzzi was great to have, but it did take some time to fill up, as there was not enough hot water to fill it up in one turn. Instead, I was able to fill it about half way, went to breakfast and managed to complete the job upon return to the room. The breakfast was very good and the view from the terrace was stellar. My only real complaint with this hotel was with the location, which of course is beyond their control. The street was very quiet (dead, really) and the neighborhood in general rather deserted at night, yet heavy with tourists by day, and there was a lack of quality restaurants and cafes in the area. I didn't feel like I really began to acquaint myself with Istanbul until I left Dersaadet, and my boyfriend and I found ourselves much more at home in vibrant Beyoglu and urban Nisantasi. The prices were very reasonable, I felt, until we were able to relocate to somewhere much more posh and even larger (another corner suite) for a little less per night.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful and friendly hotel with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Kristina_8486
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely little Turkish hotel in the beginning of April during four nights and couldn't be more pleased with our booking. As the flight was delayed we were very tired and were really pleased to be welcomed with a nice cup of tee in the beautifully decorated reception. The reason for our trip was to celebrate my husband's birthday and they were so concerned to help me with the arrangement I have made for him. The room was not so big, but we were fond of the Turkish style and it was clean and cosy. The restaurant on the top was excellent with a nice view over the Bosporous and the Blue mosque. The chef of the restaurant is a very symphatetic man and is worth a special thanks for his treatment of the guest! They serve a home-made breakfast and you have the choice to sit either outside or inside. Then you can go up and sit there during the day to take a beer or a glass of wine until 23.30 if you like. The hotel is perfectly situated in the old part of Istanbul, in Sulthanamet. Walking distance to all the monuments like the Blue Mosqe, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazar and Hagia Sophia. There is nothing but good things to say about this hotel and if we come back we would definitely choose it again. Well, maybe - we are from the north and like to sleep when it is a bit chilly in the bedroom. There was no good air condition in the room and it was a bit warm I have to say. But when we told them so they brought us a big fan in a minute. And so this problem was solved. They were so anxious to solve all our little wishes we could have and this hotel was a bargain!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, highly recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanne A
Reviews.Content: Amazing, highly knowledgeable and friendly staff. Lovely breakfast terrace overlooking the Blue Mosque and a delicious breakfast. Beautiful Ottoman style rooms. Ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel - Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: JB283
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel literally a 30 second walk from the Blue Mosque. In fact, when you're having breakfast on the rooftop terrace, it feels like the Blue Mosque is right next to you. Pros: Location is perfect for exploring Sultanahmet Informational cards & brochures at reception for exploring Istanbul Good breakfast Beautiful views well decorated interior wifi Amazing staff - will literally help you with anything Provided airport transport if you stay 4 nights Cons: Hot water can sometimes go out I was struggling with wifi dependability (on 2 devices) rooms were a little too hot - and A/C was off for the season Breakfast was good, but the selection was the same each day Near Mosques, so its loud during prayer calls when you're sleeping We would definitely stay there again on our next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “This is an excellently run boutique hotel, right in the center of attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Jan G
Reviews.Content: This gem of a small boutique hotel is excellently run. It is in the Sultanahmet (old Istanbul)district and is in walking distance of most of all the fascinating places this city has to offer. And there is a simple straightforward tram line that will take you further afield, to the ferries for a lovely ride up the Bosphorus, to the Galata Bridge (one end in Europe and other in Asia), and several palaces. We were here for 10 days, most of it spent in the old district where we could walk to the Blue Mosque, (which is viewable from the delightful Terrace room at the top of the Dersaadet), the Topkapi Palace, the grand bazaar, (now that is an experience), the Turkish Baths, the Mosaic Museum, amongst other places. There are minarets, with muezzins calling the faithful to prayer that ring out across the city. It is like delving back thousands of years to the Roman, Byzantine and Ottoman eras. Mind boggling at times. There are some very good restaurants, (the local wine is very acceptable) and there is a very useful shopping street. There is a beautiful water front where on a Sunday you can observe almost all the inhabitants of the city taking a stroll, having picnics and just relaxing. The people are friendly, energetic, often funny. There was a real mix of people and all in all it there was a wonderfully tolerant air about the place. The Dersaadet is a welcoming place to come home to at the end of a hard walking day. Our room felt very Arabian Nights with a beautiful view of the Bosphorus. The hotel was clean, and all the staff unfailingly helpful. We would go back again at the drop of a hat. This is one unique place.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, small and good”
Reviews.Author: bean10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, very close to the Blue Mosque (10 minutes walk) and in the middle of Sultanahamet. Rooms very clean and ample size, could see the Bosphorous from our window. Breakfast on the roof top with great views all round. Staff very helpful and answered the many questions we kept asking. Would recommend to those looking for a central location but at the same time in a quite location (other than the call to prayer)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mashaman
Reviews.Content: This place is lovely. A small Ottoman style mansion close to all the main attractions. The hotel is very clean, the staff is helpful and there are views of the sea from the upper floors -- not to mention the great breakfast. The Sultan's Suite is luxurious and for what you get, not very expensive. The hotel is on the back side of the blue mosque -- a plus if you ask me, as you are not in the middle of all the restaurants -- but some may feel they are not in the heart of the action. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjmack08
Reviews.Content: Dersaadet Hotel Istanbul is a lovely small hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet (Old Istanbul). Situated just below the Blue Mosque, its sea-view rooms and Terrace Garden overlook the Bosphorus, where it joins the Sea of Marmara. Clean and well-managed (its owner received his MBA in the U.S.), the staff is unfailingly gracious and helpful. A real find.

Reviews.Title: “Gentle help for tthe Grandmothers”
Reviews.Author: islasunshine9
Reviews.Content: My sister and I celebrated our 80th birthdays by an Istanbul and Cappadoccia trip, staying at the Dersaadet in Istanbul. We could not have been more delighted. The roof top view, whether for breakfast or a nightcap is spectacular. The service is beyond excellent. The staff, patient and insiteful for the small problems of the "older traveler". Late Sept. is such a lovely time in Istanbul, this amazing staff made our arrivals departures and re arrivals feel like we had departed, arrived and departed from our own home.Not an easy task. Thank you so much. Dr.June Blewett, Nova Scotia, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Hope to return soon”
Reviews.Author: Janerikjelle
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at dersaadet. Very helpful and kind staff. Good breakfast with a very nice view. We were upgraded to the penthouse suite, and felt a bit like prince & princess....thank you very much! The hotel is located in a small and calm street, but near restaurants and shops... And just a few minutes walk from many tourist attractions. We also went to turk Telecom and saw galatasaray beat Besiktas 3-2! Thanks a lot to all at dersaadet hotel for making our stay perfect.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Amazing Location, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hdbrill
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and everyone loved it. First off, the staff is super friendly and very helpful. They gave us some of the best recommendations for meals and what to see. The hotel itself is absolutely charming. It has that boutique hotel charm, while still in the middle of historic Istanbul. When there, you feel like you get a lot of personal attention which is great. The breakfasts were to die for (Sitting on the beautiful rooftop terrace was also nice -- it had great views of the Marmara Sea and the Blue Mosque). The rooms were large and well equipped. I had the ocean view room which was delightful. My room was very well cleaned and the bedding and etc was very high quality. But I think the main benefit of this hotel is the location. It's located right in the middle of historic Istanbul. Everything one wants to see is a short walk away (ie the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace) Also note, there is a great bazaar near the hotel, where you can get the best deals. We really enjoyed our trip and definitely recommend this hotel. Choose this hotel over others like the Pera or the Four Seasons because you get the same service/attention, and the same amazing rooms. This hotel is just superior.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Travellingsisters35
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 day break in Istanbul. This hotel was just perfect. It was lovely and warm and very cosy during a very cold and damp spell. After a very substantial breakfast on the roof terrace, overlooking the Bospherous, it was very easy to step out and be in the centre of things. It was only a few minutes walk to the main square and the Blue Mosque, with the tram there if it was needed. The hotel was spotlessly clean and every member of staff was friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much for them. I can't think there would be a better place to stay in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jatin S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Dersaadet Hotel for 4 nights and it was wonderful. THey picked us up from the airport and helped us with the room before the check in time- the staff was great and really concerned to make sure our stay at the hotel was fantastic. Will definitely stay there if we go back to istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service - go there.”
Reviews.Author: aussietraveller7777
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a couple of weeks ago - great central location near the Blue Mosque, really clean and a great atmosphere and ambience. But the best part was the service. I hurt by back on the way to Istanbul and the team could not have been more accommodating and helpful. From the Front desk staff to the breakfast team to the cleaners nothing was too much effort. I had trouble accessing the shower in my room so they found another one for me use, I had trouble walking up the stairs to the beautiful rooftop breakfast area one day so they brought me a tray to my room and they helped carry my bag to and from my room. Thank you to the team at Hotel Dersaadet I will be returning to stay with you again and would suggests others do also!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rob E
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dersaadet in January 2012 and were amazed at how clean, comfortable and inviting it was. It is just a street away from the blue mosque which you can see from the roof top terrace. All the staff were friendly and helpful, and the bedroom was wonderfully furnished. Breakfast included a great range of cereals, dried fruit and yoghurt as well meats, olives, cheese and cakes! We fully recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Ottoman Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jwalsh830
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Dersaadet Hotel for the second time, having stayed there six years ago on our first trip to Istanbul. We were every bit as happy with our second stay as our first. Our daughter and her husband arrived a day before us and had made arrangements to stay at the Dersaadet based on our recommendation. They too said that they couldn't have chosen a better hotel. The location is great because it is within walking distance of major sights and restaurants in the old town. The service is outstanding and the staff went out of their way to be helpful to all of us. The breakfast buffet is wonderful with a terrific view from the rooftop terrace. For us, the Dersaadet is the only place to stay in Istanbul. Joyce W

Reviews.Title: “Attentive and genuinely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Los_Evans
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul for the holidays and had a grand time in no small part due to the Hotel Dersaadet. In fact, our only hesitation in writing this review is that it may make it harder for us to get a reservation next time! The hotel itself is located within walking distance of many of the major sights, including the Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. We had a deluxe sea-view room, which was lovely and a bit more spacious than the standard rooms. Each morning, on a rooftop terrace overlooking the Bosphorus, the hotel provides a bountiful breakfast including breads, jams, fresh fruit, yogurt, cured meats, cheeses and some unique items such as olives, cucumbers and pomegranates. This is included in the price of the room, and was a relaxing way to start each day. The best thing about the Dersaadet, though, is the attentive and genuinely friendly staff. We got to know several of the staff members, most of whom speak English, and we were consistently impressed by how much they seemed to care that we enjoyed the hotel and our visit to the city. On our last day, we had to leave very early for the airport, and the front desk manager Umitâ€”without any promptingâ€”graciously saw to it that we had coffee and breakfast before our taxi arrived. It was this kind of thoughtful gesture that will make us repeat guests of the Hotel Dersaadet at our earliest opportunity. Bravo! Daniel and Corinne Evans Washington, DC

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful hideaway in the heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: Holly S
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 spent a lovely 4 days in the Dersaadet over Christmas and it was a gift to us all. The staff was friendly, the breakfast on the rooftop was charming, and the location was amazing. We were able to walk easily to all the major sites, and to retire at night to our lush suite and feel like we were away from the crowds. When it was time to leave our rental car company dropped off our car with 0 gas- not even enough to start the car. The Dersaadet Staff came to the rescue & got us gas in a flash so we made it to our ferry in time. They saved the day and sealed our decision to send all of our friends to Dersaadet, completely trust that they will be taken care of by the lovely staff. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “A jewell box of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: MWitz
Reviews.Content: As a preliminary matter, I find Istanbul to be one of the planet's truly outstanding cities. That said, the Dersaadet is an altogether remarkable place. All the amenities one expects at a large, anonymous chain hotel, lovely decor, a friendly dedicated staff, a rooftop cafe with views across the Sea of Marmara to the Princes Isles in one direction and the dome of the Blue Mosque in another. Breakfast is a sumptuous buffet, with the scenery just an added delight...and location, just a few steps from Sultan Ahmet Square and the tram stop, but a world away on a quiet side street of this ancient capital city. Stayed in the Corner Suite, room 304, a perfect size for a two week stay. There is even a small storefront laundry nearby, where one can leave clothes in the morning and pick them up in the evening...A truly grand hotel housed in a small, exquisite setting.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: This small but special hotel with most helpful front desk staff, gave us a perfect Christmas break with views every morning through the glass walls rooftop restaurant, and every modern facility in an authentically ottoman design bedroom with sofa overlooking the Bosporus, in an area of older wooden houses a block away from quiet attractive shops with no pressure from the sales staff, and choice of local restaurants. Walking another block through mediaeval lanes takes one to the restored jewel of the S Sergius and S Bacchus church in one direction; and in the other direction, to the riverfront railway for a scenic ride to the magnificent Golden Gate at the massive original Byzantine entry into Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible, authentic Istanbul experience”
Reviews.Author: Canadian T
Reviews.Content: This beautiful boutique hotel takes you back in time and makes you feel like an aristocrat during Ottoman times. The staff is so friendly and helpful, the room cleanliness is impeccable, and the design of the rooms is enchanting.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Ariel N
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dersaadet Hotel at the beginning of Dec 2011. The location of the hotel is excellent with quick walking access to the Blue Mosque and Sofia Hagia. It's very central to everything (including tram) yet offers a very quiet setting. The staff were amazingly friendly and helpful. The staff, including the owner, took a stake in our happiness while in Istanbul. The free breakfast and view from the top floor was great. The hotel itself is very charming with lots of wood flooring and accents. And it's great that their lobby has a good book selection including travel books like Frommers and Lonely Planet which you can borrow. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice time at Dersaadet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alex S
Reviews.Content: My friend and me had a very nice trip to Istanbul on December 2011 (Dec, 16-19). One of pleasant moment was to stay in Dersaadet Hotel Istanbul. Room was very nice, terrace view was wonderful, breakfest is good, personnel were very helpful and polite. I'll reccommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: bibbo1
Reviews.Content: Traditional hotel right behind the Blue Mosque and Haggia Sophia. Upgraded on arrival with a sea view without needing to ask nor pay for the upgrade. Lovely bedroom/ensuite bathroom. Traditional Turkish breakfast served on rooftop with fantastic views of Eastern Istanbul and the Sea of Marmara. Great Service. Would highly recommend. They even placed a birthday card, bottle of wine, fruit, nuts and of course, turkish delight in our room for my husband's birthday.

Reviews.Title: “A cute little hotel in the Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine S
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in Istanbul, on our first (but surely not our last) trip to Turkey. Our stay in the Dersaadet Hotel (found thru Tripadvisor) was wonderful. The staff was friendly & helpful & always made us feel like welcomed guests. Our suite was comfortable, and just a few minutes walk from all the old town sights, and there was appealing sense of "neighborhood" about the place. Breakfast every morning with a view of the Bosporus was a wonderful start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent week-end in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: korabel
Reviews.Content: For me and my wife it was our first trip to Istanbul. We stayed for two days in corner suit. We were very impressed by the quality of personnel and their approach (very friendly, competent and helpfull). We really feel like valuable guests. The breakfast is just good with very beautiful sea view terrace. Great location: top tourist spots in 5-10 min distance by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: holidaytragic
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Istanbul, chose this hotel from Trip Advisor. Staff friendly and helpful in particular Umit who worked in the rooftop terrace. Located in the old town close to many attractions. Room was small but clean with nice view .

Reviews.Title: “You couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: Todd D
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect. Near the main attractions but off the beaten path. Staff are a joy. The ambiance is top drawer. We stayed for a week in the "Corner Suite" and were very pleased. Although the hotel is situated near the tourist sites the feeling of the area is very "local". Check out the small bazaar nearby. Expensive but some top quality items. For example, a French-Canadian woman runs a textile shop that keeps traditional techniques going in the hinterland which she then sells through this shop. Superb. WiFi could be improved. Somewhat spotty coverage.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: PennyP1269
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from four days at the Dersaadet Hotel. It was a wonderful change from big, impersonal, chain hotels. The hotel is situated in the Sultanahmet area of the old city and near to many of the main sights. It is family run and the staff go out of their way to be helpful and make you feel very welcome. The rooms are comfortable and well-appointed and the Turkish style decor adds to the charm. A nice touch was finding bathrobes and slippers provided -something you wouldn't normally expect in a moderately priced hotel. The breakfast on the roof terrace, with it's view of the Bosphorus, offered plenty of choice both hot and cold.The coffee and the yoghurt were particulalry good!All in all highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit - still a charm!”
Reviews.Author: DrFred63
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Hotel Dersaadet in less than one year, and it still remains an impressive place. On this visit I was with my two brothers and their partners, so a total of five guests in three rooms. The hotel is small and intimate, located in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul, allowing easy walks to all of the major tourist sites. Sitting on its rooftop terrace overlooking the Blue Mosque either by day over breakfast or by night sipping a cocktail is truly magical. The hotel's staff, though, is what really shines here. You never see a sour face on any one, and there is nothing that can not or will not be done for you as a guest. From the front desk staff Umit, Sameet, and Mehmet, to the Concierage Gozde with her "killer" shoes, to the waiters Umit and Mehmet, to the cleaning staff, to the owner, all exude warmth and graciousness, and a real passion and pleasure to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Because we had to leave early for the airport on our return home and the breakfast service had not yet opened, they arranged tea, coffee, and sandwiches for us in the lobby. By accident one of my brothers left a set of tea glasses he had bought in his room, and the next day the hotel sent them on to him, arriving in perfect condition. I can not recommend a better hotel to stay in when visiting Istanbul than the Dersaadet. If you want a sterile, anonymous, cookie-cutter chain hotel this is not the place for you. But, if you want to feel as if you are staying with a family that cares for you, then the Dersaadet is the place to be. I greatly look forward to my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't have picked a more perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JulieGBaltimore
Reviews.Content: We were more than thrilled with our choice of Dersaadet Hotel... the location couldn't have been better, just a short walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, small shopping bazaar and loads of restaurants. The staff was attentive and knowledgable and helped with all our touring and transportation needs. What a treat to have a view of the Blue Mosque from the roof top terrace, where they served a lovely breakfast. The standard room is quite small, as is the bathroom, but the beds are quite comfortable. (Next time we'll request a Deluxe room). Ask for a sea view for just a few extra Turkish Lira. We really appreciated their complimentary airport pick up (offered for bookings of 4 nights or more), especially after arriving exhausted and groggy after our long overseas flight. We aren't extravagant travelers... we feel this hotel offers excellent value. I rate the sleep quality only as Good / Very Good because of the early morning call to prayer, which is broadcast quite loud from a nearby mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Sharon082507
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Dersaadet. We stayed for 5 nights and could not find any flaws with this great hotel. The breakfast was delicious, the staff was warm and welcoming, and the room was comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to staff of Dersaadet Hotel Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: VPcloster
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul in last week of October 2011,l had booked in Dersaadet Hotel.As i had requested the hotel, my cab was waiting at the airport,Hotel location could not have been better, thanks to trip advisor for that.You do not need to spend on cab as everything is walking distance from the hotel except the airport, excellent location.Hotel staff was extremely pleasant, friendly and helpful and made reservations for our trips. Gozde Ozer outlined Istanbul on the map for us and how we could best see everything efficiently, I thank her for that advise.Breakfast buffet was on the terrace overlooking the sea with the ships sailing by, you cannot beat that view.Room was clean, take sea view room which are on 3rd floor which I had Just step out of the hotel and you have so many nice places to eat .Overall a very good hotel to stay , highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and friendly experience”
Reviews.Author: Francesca A
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 5 days trip to Istanbul. We booked at the Dersaadet Hotel as recommended by the Lonely planet, so we were confident to aspect what we read about it. Surely or not everything they say about this hotel was true. The location is great in a calm side street of the historical center, with the roof top offering a beautiful view of the Bosphorus and the blue mosque. The room we chose was very cozy and clean featuring a beautiful turkish bath. The Hotel staff is outstanding, everyone is extremely pleasant and helpful, from the manager to the front office all the way up to the restaurant employee. I think our city experience would have not being the same if we had to lodge in a less accommodating place. Prices are also fare compare to the surrounding competitors. This was for us a great experience and a wonderful choice.

Reviews.Title: “first class”
Reviews.Author: Gill0528
Reviews.Content: just returned from 4 nights at Dersaadet hotel. we found the hotel on trip advisor and were influenced by the good reviews, we were not disappointed, the room was a good size, the bathroom was lovely. we started the day with an ample breakfast taken on the rooftop,the best scrambled eggs! this hotel is very convenient for all the main sites and it really does tick all the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Josh257
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dersaadet is a lovely little hotel in the old city portion of Istanbul. The rooms are not large, but quite comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful making reservations, arranging transportation, etc. Breakfast buffet is ample and fresh. The location is great - close to major sites in the old city - easy walking distance - , but just far enough away to escape the crowds. We would not hesitate to stay there again if we were to return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a lovely location”
Reviews.Author: RaqsSharqi
Reviews.Content: I stayed 7 nights on a ground floor room with a turkish bath - although it had only a street level view, I was not in the room long enough at any one time to mind. Perhaps the only thing perturbing at times is the privacy due to the close proximity of pavement right outside the windows. The room was commfortable and reasonably large. Even the bathroom was larger than I expected and the turkish bath with a rain shower made a welcome difference to other hotels. The amenities provided in the bathroom and room was comparable to many 5-star hotels. All the staff were unfailingly friendly and helpful, and even though there was a city-wide power cut on my third day, the front-desk staff was remarkably patient and polite dealing with a few irate (and unreasonable) guests. The hotel wrote to me a week prior to my travel and provided addtional information on weather, various activities of interest in the city and availability of a museum card, which I purchased - this was extremely useful to visit several major museums at a great price and allowing unlimited access over 3 days. The gorgeous view from the terrace every morning during breakfast made getting up early a real pleasure - I'm a yoghurt, fresh fruit, cheese, bread and honey person so the breakfast spread was more than adequate. I loved the excellent location of this hotel - just 5-10 minutes walk from all the major attractions in Sultanahmet and tram station, yet located in a quiet neighbourhood. Even walking back late at night to the hotel did not pose any problems - I felt safe all the time. Although the wi-fi did not work for the first couple of days, it was fixed by day 3 and workd fine. I'm happy that the hotel delivered more than what was on their website and made efforts to improve some areas based on quests' feedback - I will definitely come back to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Savy and welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: Maria D
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dersaadet provided us with a great staff and beautiful property. 2 days before our arrival, we got an email from the concierege not only confirming our reservation but also giving us a listing of what was happening about town in Istanbul. We arrived knowing how to make the most of our stay in Istanbul. No other hotel has ever been so "heads up". As part of the check in process, you are invited to spend time with the concierege to plan your your stay. Gozde was professional yet friendly, and pulled out her lap top to book tickets to a jazz club the following night. Much easier for her to do than for us. What a pleasure she was! The hotel is excellently located to see the major attactions. The breakfast terrace has a view of the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara, the food above average. The room a bit small , but well appointed. The notice in the room encourages you to call if you would like harder or softer matress or pillows,. The beds had embroidered linens, the bathroom had great soaps, and alot of hot water with good pressure. WiFi worked fast in the room. We enjoyed our stay and would choose this place again..

Reviews.Title: “Dersaadet Hotel, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: johnb123_11
Reviews.Content: A very reasonably-priced hotel with excellent service. We found that having somebody waiting for you at the airport and not having to negotiate taxis at the airport was a real plus on arrival (late evening). I would like to add my praises for this Hotel. GÃ¶zde (assistant manager) couldn't do enough for us. All the staff were unfailingly friendly and actively tried to improve our stay. There was the use of a laptop in the lobby (useful for pre-booking museum tickets). All rooms are wi-fi equipped. The hotel is very centrally located in Sultanahmet but just off the main drag and we found it surprisingly quiet. 5 mins walk to the centre. Breakfast room on the terrace converts to a quiet bar in the evening. The hotel really contributed to what was a very pleasant stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hbarif
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night and had a good experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful, hotel was renovated in ottoman style which made it look more beautiful. We got gorgeous sea view from our room window. Room and bathroom were small but good enough for our needs. The location was central and hence a major advantage. Breakfast was also quite decent with very nice views of Bosphorus sea. I read on TripAdvisor about noise for many hotels in sultanahmet but in this particular hotel, we didn't come across any such issue.

Reviews.Title: “Dersaadet Hotel, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Christopher C
Reviews.Content: Charming traditional hotel close to the historic centre. Very friendly and efficient service.

Reviews.Title: “Dersaadet hotel in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: debys h
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in this hotel. Excellent location of the hotel near the blue mosque in a quiet street of south Sultanahmet. Service was very good and staff helpfull, Taxi hotel service from the airport is efficient and very valuable when you are tired coming out from the plane (is complimentary when stay exceeds 3 nights) Bathroom was very clean and we recommend the breakfast on the terrace with a superb view on Marmara sea.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel with an excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: jonathan k
Reviews.Content: We are a family of three adults and stayed seven nights in the hotel. All that we have to say in praise of the hotel has been well said by other reviewers. They have rightly emphasized the hotel's many winning qualities: its closeness to key Istanbul sites, the pleasures of its rooftop dining area, the unstinting help of the staff, and the reasonableness of its room costs. There are innumerable hotels in Istanbul in every price range. You cannot go wrong in choosing the Dersaadet.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Diane S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very close to the Blue Mosque, Haya Sophia, Topkapi Palace and tons of other places that you will want to see in Instanbul. The staff is very friendly and the rooftop has a great view of the Blue Mosque and the nicest bartender you will ever meet. That is also where breakfast is served which is excellent and a great place to start each day. We were there for a week and could not have been more pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience at the Dersaadet”
Reviews.Author: Britami
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Dersaadet. The staff members were extremely helpful and attentive, the location is excellent, and the price is right -- and it includes a big breakfast on the rooftop terrace. I also appreciated the attention to detail evident in the room decoration. The bathroom even included a Turkish bath. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hasnayn E
Reviews.Content: The staff at Dersaadet provided for a very welcoming and warm stay. The rooms were well furnished (though the bathroom in the double room was a bit tiny). Breakfast on the roof terrace was a lovely experience as it had breathtaking views of the ocean and the blue mosque. The rates for the hotel were very reasonable and I would definitely recommend to anyone wanting to stay in the historic Sultanahmet region of Istanbul to give this hotel a look in...

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Iris S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really nice...staff was VERY friendly and helpful and room are clean and very nice...I completly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: _C_964
Reviews.Content: The staff is really friendly and makes sure you have what you need! Our room was very nice and very clean. The terrace where people have their breakfast is beautiful. If you want to stay in Sultanahmet, this is a great place to go to. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family run hotel in wonderful position.”
Reviews.Author: Tom M
Reviews.Content: We and a group of friends stayed here in the heart of Sultanamet for 3 nights. We were greeted by Gozde who instantly made us feel at home. Whilst we had a welcoming cup of apple tea, she gave us tips and advice on what to see and do in Istanbul. Our rooms were traditionally decorated. Bathrooms clean and modern. Breakfast on the roof terrace was good, with stunning views of the sea and Blue Mosque. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly - nothing seemed too much trouble. It felt like our home for 3 days. The location of the hotel could not be bettered for our trip to this historic city. We will most definitely use this hotel if we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The best place in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: lionme
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been going to Dersaadet since 2008 after a friend read about it and recommend it to us. Now the Hotel staff are less like staff and more like our family friends. This is a wonderful hotel. The best or the very best in the area. 5 star hospitality at cheerful prices. It is quite popular with the Americans as I keep running into Americans each time I have been there. A beautifully (manicured and very elegant) kept hotel with perfectly mannered staff and a very homey place. The Managers Umit, Deniz and Goezde are absolutely fabulous in their hospitality. The terrace staff Umit and Mehmet are most wonderful and make the morning breakfast buffet (included) very welcoming. The terrace itself is like looking down from a Helicopter window. Very panoramic! The blue Bosphorus and the strikingly blue Marmara is in front of you. Most enchanting location. It is very Ottoman in its construction and makes the place all the more romantic. The Blue Mosque looms large behind the terrace and is a majestic introduction to the start of an Istanbul adventure. Don't miss the towns of Bebek, Arnavutkoy and Ortakoy. Ask Umit for instructions. These towns have the most charming views of the Bosphorus and some of the most excellent seafood restaurants are in Arnavutkoy. If you get a chance, have a night out at the Pera Palas (where Agatha Christie wrote her Orient Express book and her rooms are still preserved), Bebek hotel and Sofyali restaurant in Tuenel. But three cheers for Hotel Dersaadet as the quality is outstanding. Raghu&Tara

Reviews.Title: “A Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: Bob G
Reviews.Content: The Dersaadet Hotel turned out to be the delight we truted (Trust trip advisor we say) it would be based on the reviews here on Trip Advisor. We booked the Sultan's Suite for three nights and the extra cost was well worth it...the room was very large by any standard, the bathroom modern and convienient, the bed large and comfortable and the furnishings made us feel that we were in someones lage home hot a cookie cutter hotel room...We truly felt like we were not in Kansas any more but in exotic Turkey. The staff was professionaly helpful,courteous and more than that, interested in our having a wonderful visit to their amazing city. In fact as we checked in a young lady concierage (sorry I forgt her name) spent almost 45 minutes with us going over maps and offering suggestions to make our stay more meaningful. The guys at the front desk acted as much as our friend and advisors as staff... we felt like we were coming home everytime we went back to the hotel ...nice touch. Location couldn't have been more perfect for a first visit to Istanbul...just minutes away from the major attractions and around the corner from an upscale bazarr located just a street below the Blue Mosque, it was a magnitude less frenetic and more manageable than the (not so) Grand Bazarr...and after just a few hours Sultanahmet felt like a familiar neighboorhood. Breakfast on the roof garden was a delight as well, the food and selection were terriffic and the staff wonderful.. the views unbeatable and as a late night buffer allowed us to relax and discuss the days adventures under the brilliantly lit Blue Mosque. We needed to use a taxi only once because of a mistimed downpour. Going to Istanbul for the first time - dis is da place!

Reviews.Title: “Dersaadet hotel in a nutshell”
Reviews.Author: Malik B
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at Dersaadet hotel for a couple of nights. The best feature among many of this hotel was its location. Most of the Istanbul's "must-see" sights are in the walking distance and the rooftop terrace provides a great view of the blue mosque day and night. Breakfast is also served at this terrace with a great almost 360 view from bosphorus to the blue mosque. Its a small hotel but the staff is very friendly and the owner Mr. Deniz was most helpful of them all. Has a very "botique and royal" look to it. Enjoyed my stay there with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Ryan X 3”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: The location is very convenient for Haghia Sofia, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi all of which are within a short walk. We stayed in the Sultan's Suite which was huge and very beautifully furnished. The all round windows gave a wonderful view of the Sea of Marmara with its plentiful shipping and fishing boat traffic. Breakfast was on the top-floor terrace from which we could see the nearby Blue Mosque

Reviews.Title: “The Dersaadet does not deserve its high rating.”
Reviews.Author: jlcira
Reviews.Content: We booked our room 8 months in advance. When we arrived we had to leave our luggage before we could check into the room. By the time we came back and checked in at 3pm, we got a room that was so small we could not get both suitcases open at the same time. The air conditioner was not on and did not work well. The bed was hard and uncomfortable. We asked to change rooms, they wanted to charge more. This room was $230.00 a night as it was! There were very few amenities. The concierge was very nice, but not as knowledgeable about restaurants as we needed. For example, he helped us choose a fish restaurant on the Bosporus that was supposed to be about 25 min from the hotel. It took us 2.5 hrs to get there and was the most expensive place we ate at - fish costing about $60 per serving. The location is very nice and the terrace at the top of the hotel does have a lovely view. However they charged 4 euros for a small glass of wine. No complimentary cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel and a wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Paula C
Reviews.Content: Deersaadet Hotel in Istanbul is a lovely place to stay. We were welcomed with tea, Turkish Delight and charming people. The staff is lovely and always eager to be of assistance with plans. The rooftop terrace is a wonderful place to enjoy an amazing breakfast buffet and a great view of the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara. The hotel is small and as others have said, very clean and well kept. The lobby is charming. We chose a standard room, which was small and not inspiring. Reading other reviews I would recommend a Deluxe room if your budget can support it. The location of this hotel is fabulous, under a five minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Hippodrome and the tram stop and less then ten minutes to Topkapi and Grand Bazaar. We stayed for three nights and returned for our last light after traveling through Turkey for 10 days. Our return felt like we were coming home, we were greeted by name and felt very welcome. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who like to soak up a local feel and who enjoys interacting with wonderful people.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful experience in Dersadeet”
Reviews.Author: maurizio d
Reviews.Content: A really nice and relaxing experience. The hotel is small, warm, clean (very clean) and friendly. A very good welcome, a perfect support and a perfect housekeeping. The locanion is good, without trafic and noice but very closed to all the interesting sites. The lack of a restaurant is not important because you can have good opportunities for a meal in a few meters out of the hotel. About the rooms, our suggestion for a perfect stay is the choice of a Deluxe room (more confortable than a standard), if available. Strongly suggested for a lonf week end. A very good balance between cost and benefits (also the taxi service is very good)

Reviews.Title: “a gem”
Reviews.Author: PR345
Reviews.Content: Charming small hotel. Terrific staff. Room had an authentic turkish bath which was gorgeous. Best of all the rooftop restaurant for breakfast and a glass of wine in the late afternoon. Beautiful views of Sea of marmara and the Blue Mosque. Magical!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: karenk59
Reviews.Content: Great sweet boutique hotel close to blue mosque and all other attractions. Service was great. Memhmet in restaurant was wonderful and very sweet

Reviews.Title: “Excellent,great place”
Reviews.Author: lando r
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay here,restaurants recommended by the hotel were exceptional,especially the restaurant Amedros my family also loved,great location,rooms,cleanliness and service,thank you for all.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: soncek1997
Reviews.Content: Very good location, services,... Everything perfect - also for families with children!!! We recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Facility; Fantatic Staff; and Superb Venue”
Reviews.Author: akhakoo
Reviews.Content: Our holiday in Istanbul was one that we will never forget. The highlights, of course, were all about the grand architecture that is over 3,000 years old and the culture, music and food; but, we would be amiss if we didn't mention how superb the Dersaadet hotel was and its staff, including its owner who came-by one morning during breakfast to say hello. He must have spent over half-hour with us or more just discussing sights to see and the best possible route of travel; the staff including Umit at front desk were fully customer focused - as an example, our 4.5 year daughter had seen candy one morning at front desk but that particular morning, the candy had run out. Without even showing that they were going to do it, the staff at front desk promptly went and bought a whole bag of candy for her, although, we made sure that she only had one! In addition, Deniz Duyar (who is the owner), helped us contact the carpet merchant whom we had lost contact, with respect to our carpets that were to be delivered. This was almost a month after we had stayed at the hotel! Certainly, the service was above and beyond our expectation. For these reasons, we would absolutely stay at Dersaadet hotel again, and recommend it to anyone who is interested in travelling to the Sultanahmet area in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel in great location with wonderful breakfast terrace”
Reviews.Author: StefanMarco
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is at a great location - less than 10 walking minutes to Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque, Hippodrome. Easy to reach from Trams stop (10-15 minutes, but bumpy sidewalks) so you can take the dependable tram/ metro from and to the airport for a mere 4 TL. If you walk downhill, you reach the seaside in 10 minutes walking through a neighbourhood where few tourists ever show up. For railroad buffs: Don't miss the funky underpath (max hight 1.85 meters!) half way between the hotel and the seaside. Hotel has a wonderful breakfast terrace with splendid views over the Sea of Marmara. The food is fresh with good variety. Staff is very helpful and friendly. The room is rather small, but there is so much to see and to do in Istanbul, so who spends lots of time in the room! The bed is very comfortable; air conditioning works well and is not too loud; the bathroom is brand new and spick and spank.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful. quiet, and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: davidh092
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Dersaadet Hotel was one of the best travel decisions we've ever made. Great, friendly staff, a rooftop breakfast with an amazing view, lovely old-world decor and exquisite Turkish-style bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom G
Reviews.Content: When you come away from a hotel and your only complaints are that the shower leaked slightly and there was no fresh orange juice included in the breakfast it is a sign that the hotel has been brilliant. Lovely little roof terrace (view over the Bosphorous), clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff located in the heart of the old part of Istanbul within easy walking distance of sights such as the Blue Mosque, Sofya Haga. Reasonably priced and definitely worth a visit if you are looking for somewhere to stay in istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The worst for the price”
Reviews.Author: voyageur34227
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a delapided street.I We were planing to stay one week, we stayed only one night. We had a room downstairs ( more like a basement) that was humid, damp and smells like mold. I was coughing the whole night. In fact, I got sick, with a cold for 5 days, from breathing mold all night long. In addition, you could be seen in the room from the street. In the morning, we had to go. We were charged the full amount for 2 days. The owner was a decent guy . But this place, by no means, should be called a hotel. It is more like a guesthouse. The comments reported above don't remotely relate to this hotel! The prices are outrageous considering what you get.. There are numerous hotels, centrally located, (walk to the grand bazaar, the spice bazaar mosques etc..) that cost less, a lot less than this hotel. Do your homework! Don't get taken by fallacious comments!

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: abbyLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my honeymoon. Stayed for 4 nights great staff, nice little hotel 10 min walk from main attractions including Grand bazaar, topkapi palace, blue mosque. Breakfast was included which was great. Would recommend this clean hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: noddee
Reviews.Content: Very well situated within easy reach of the sights of the old town, this hotel is charming and comfortable and the staff friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Hope to come back soon!”
Reviews.Author: BermudaCbear
Reviews.Content: Great hotel; excellent location - walking distance to major sights, close to shopping, restaurants and bars. Wonderful English-speaking staff. Hotel breakfast/bar with awesome views.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: french-plane
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came for our friends' wedding and stayed at this wonderful hotel for 5 nights. Enjoyed every moment of it! Staff was professional, kind, knowledgeable, polite and just always there for you. Hotel is very clean, comfortable and cozy. We stayed at Sultan's penthouse suite, which was absolutely phenomenal =- spacious, beautiful, with an amazing view! We highly recommend this place! The location is exactly what we wanted - walking distance to everything - restaurants, bazaars, mosque, museums, shops. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “central location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ezra54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for four days in the corner suite which was comfortable, clean and spacious. The staff were all very helpful and friendly, the breakfasts on the roof terrace were delicious, particularly the fruit and yoghourt and home made cakes. The hotel is situated in a quit street, so is very quiet for such a central location. We really enjoyed istanbul which was busy and vibrant, and would have liked to have stayed longer. We had the corner suite as the other rooms were booked but appreciated the extra space, however it was more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Ramunas070
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really cozy and well-situated (3-10 mins walk to the main attractions of Sultanahmet); roof terrace with beautiful sea views. Strange, but it is also a calm place with a pair of geese living in the neighborhood. Staff is extremely helpful. In one word: highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Luxtraveller66
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for 1 night at the end of a Black Sea cruise, but wished we could have stayed longer. The rooms are spacious and decorated traditionally, with large comfortable beds and a bath/shower combo with great water pressure as well as that all important air conditioning if you stay in the hotter months. The en-suite toiletries included a body buffer as well as a pumice stone, as well as the usual range of goodies, which was a nice touch, and at breakfast, the bread rolls were so soft you could tell that they had just been baked somewhere that morning! Location-wise, there is a lovely bazaar just 5mins walk from the hotel, or you can walk to the Grand Bazaar, the Spice Bazaar and the two key mosques - so a great location to access everything on foot. There are also lots of restaurants just a short walk away. Whilst the hotel is so close to everything, it is also very quiet at night - so the perfect mix for a busy city. Staff are welcoming and friendly and the extra touches are the reasonably priced transfers if you need them. I am sure we will return to Istanbul and would not hesitate in staying here again. We particularly liked sitting on the rooftop terrace for a drink in the evening, with wonderful views of the sea in front of you! Highly recommended.... We also loved the friendliness in general of the Istanbul people. The free wifi is also a great extra.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: trevor_optivite
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay in a small but well appointed hotel. Staff extremely helpful, good clean comfortable accommodation and very well situated within easy walking distance of all the central sites, restaurants etc. Would really recommend this for a stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Soon to return!”
Reviews.Author: Rosesal
Reviews.Content: The Dersaadet is on a cobbled street, off the main drag in a very quiet part of old Istanbul and as you walk down towards it you feel you might be in another age, with the lack of traffic and people. This friendly hotel is like being in someone's home, Turkish style. The old Ottoman hotel is beautifully, simply furnished in lovely dark reds and golds. The lift is a real treat with its own little Turkish carpet! The roof garden is delightful - breakfast there is a very peaceful start to the day looking over the rooftops of Istanbul over the sea, the ships with the nesting seagulls to keep you amused! Breakfast is simple and good with freshly cooked delicious bread and home-made jams, including rose jam. It would be nice if freshly squeezed orange juice was included, and maybe freshly cooked egg dishes. Our room with the Turkish Bath was very cosy and comfortable - the large open shower was like being caught in the monsoon rain! We loved the little dish of Turkish Delight left on the bed the first night. Softer pillows and mattresses are available on request. Nothing was too much trouble for the friendly staff - even packing up a breakfast for us for an early departure to the airport, and the occasional delivery to our room of extra Turkish Delight.... The short walk to the Blue Mosque and tourist places is very interesting and includes a china shop with prices lower than even the Grand Bazaar. We loved the little restaurant with the colourful low seats against the wall of the Mosque garden. Get to know the laundry owner next door to the hotel and let him introduce you to his unusual pets! Thank you Deniz and staff for our wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “A little treat for yourself!”
Reviews.Author: shihoyoshida
Reviews.Content: This hotel I found through internet was very nice and pleasant. The location is good to access a center of historical sites and fabulous view from roof top terrace!

Reviews.Title: “It was the perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: rachellea1950
Reviews.Content: The Dersaadet Hotel in Istanbul, Turkey was wonderful on many levels. The location was superb as we wanted to walk to many locations in the district and were easily able to do this. The Dersaadet Hotel Staff we're all incredibly warm and friendly and very helpful to us. They helped us arrange a trip on the Bosphorous. They have staff available 24- 7. If possible stay in the top floor penthouse the views are superb as was our view in the beginning of our stay when we were in another room facing the water. The top floor where breakfast is available has a breathtaking view!

Reviews.Title: “Truly lovely in great part of the old town”
Reviews.Author: dkseattle
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all of the charm and quirks of a bed and breakfast. If you are looking for something of the Four Seasons experience, then please look elsewhere. If you would like to feel welcome, appreciated and addressed by name as well as have a glorious breakfast listening to the seagulls while trying to decide where to focus your attention... The Blue Mosque or the the Bosphorous, then this may be the exact place you've been looking for. The service is impeccable and the owner, Deniz, is will go the extra mile to make sure to give you off the beaten path restaurants, shops, etc... The location is ridiculous, in that you can walk to the Grand Bazaar, The Blue Mosque, The Hagia Sofia... watch a whirling dervish at nearby cafe... Overall, it was a wonderful experience and one that I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, Excellent Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AnnaSl
Reviews.Content: Dersaadet is in the old city where most of the sites are and a quick walk to all of them. The hotel is decorated in an antique style that is very quaint and charming. The bathroom is modern with excellent pressure showers. Friendly staff and breakfast on the roof is spectacular. Remember, you get 10% off if you pay for your room in cash!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: harriszena
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Istanbul and had a great stay in the Dersaadet hotel. The staff made us feel extremly welcome from the moment we arrived, giving us maps and a useful orientation to the city and continued to be very helpful throughout the stay. The rooftop terrace with a view of the sea and the Blue Mosque was a great place for an evening drink and for breakfast. We spent 2 nights in the old town, then took a cab to the new town for 2 nights. My dopey sister left her blackberry in the cab and we called the Dersaadet (as originally thought she had left it in the room) and they were super helpful, checking the hotel and then getting in touch with the taxi. They located it there and organised the taxi to return the blackberry to our New Town hotel. We were really grateful for all the effort they went to both during our stay and once we had left!

Reviews.Title: “recommended”
Reviews.Author: fringillae
Reviews.Content: I appreciated the friendly staff and the numerous small details that give this place a soul as compared to standardized hotels. In addition, the location is convenient, right to the sultanahmet district.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: juergfalk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet place, in the neighourhood of the Blue Moschee, the Hagia Sophia and the Big Basar. The staff is very friendly and the room cosy and clean. In my room there was a "Turquish Bath" with oriental ornaments, the shower there was an unique pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars for Staff, Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisTravel4Fun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Dersaadet based on reviews on Tripadvisor. A major draw is the airport pickup. We arrived in Istanbul after a trip of almost 24 hours, waited in line at immigration and customs, and were worried no one would be standing outside with a sign holding our name. Not to worry, a driver was waiting for us! It made our arrival so stress-free. The hotel itself was a bit smaller than I expected--I'm not sure why. We booked a corner suite that was furnished with a mix of old and newer pieces. The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was updated and spotless. The roof terrace is charming and a nice place for a drink late in the day, as well as breakfast. The breakfast, included in the tariff, had a lot of hot and cold options. One note: bring earplugs if the call to prayer is likely to disturb your early morning sleep. The staff is wonderful. In advance of the trip I requested suggestions for tour groups for a day in Gallipoli. I received recommendations from the Dersaadet for several companies, and the one we chose was excellent. One night the computer available in the lobby for guests wasn't working properly, and the very friendly front desk attendant let me use the hotel's computer to check my email. Staff helped us arrange taxis and gave us some very good tips for restaurants and sightseeing. When I started to write my review, it had four stars. The hotel is not a high end luxury hotel--for that, try the Four Seasons, just down the road. However, thinking about the wonderful staff, our comfortable, charming room, value for money and the fantastic location, I upped my review to five stars. The Dersaadet deserves them all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would recommend it to others”
Reviews.Author: Nic047
Reviews.Content: The breakfast on top floor was delicious and what a view...Personalized service was greatly appreciated - i.e. help booking a Bosphorus tour.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Afrina14
Reviews.Content: We were very lucky to discover this hotel after disappointing night in the first one we booked just before the arrival as it was a last minute choice. Me and my friend liked it from the minute we walked in. The atmosphere of the hotel is very cozy and welcoming. What i liked the most was the view from the window to the Marmour Sea and the breakfast area on the terrace with the same breathtaking view...so you definitely won't regret...Really feel like going back....

Reviews.Title: “good location for sights, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: sdmcsue
Reviews.Content: Easy walk to all historic sites, restaurants, tram. Nice rooftop area for breakfast, evening drinks. Larger suite very nice for 3 people. Large bathroom. Very clean. Staff friendly and helpful for sightseeing. Spoke English well.

Reviews.Title: “A very good, very friendly, very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: vampirabell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here four nights, and it was terrific. Comfortable room PLUS air con, which is so important there, and a lovely breakfast on the rooftop terrace. Free wifi plus laptop in the lobby, good towels, minibar/fridge reasonably priced, pickup from and to the airport (DO THIS), and overall a super deal. The location can't be beaten, and the staff is tremendous. STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeisaJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Turkey to celebrate our anniversary and chose the Dersaadet Hotel for the first 5 days in Istanbul based on the Trip Advisor reviews. We wanted to stay in a small boutique hotel in the Sultanahmet district so we could easily visit the historic sites there. The location was perfect for walking to the Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, and Topkapi Palace and the tram station was also within easy walking distance. As with the prior reviews, the best thing about this hotel is the staff. The owner was very gracious and called us upon our arrival to welcome us and met us on another morning in the lobby. Umit, the front desk manager, was very professional, courteous, and helpful, as was Samet, one of the receptionists.The service staff was also very courteous and made us feel welcome. We wanted a sea view room, but did not book early enough to be able to get one. However, our room was very clean and comfortable. The bathroom looked to be brand new and the shower was great. There was plenty of hot water. The rooftop terrace has an awesome view of the Sea of Marmara and a good view of the Blue Mosque. What a lovely place for breakfast each morning! The breakfast was very good with fresh fruit, cheeses, breads, eggs, meat and the traditional olives, tomatoes and cucumbers. We also came back to the terrace a couple of evenings after dinner for a glass of wine to recap our fabulous day of sightseeing. We could see the lights of the ships waiting in the night for their turn to go through the Golden Horn on to their destination and the Blue Mosque lit up for all to see. Staying in a former Ottoman mansion in the heart of the Old Town and hearing the evocative call to prayer from the nearby mosques made us feel we were transported to another time and place. If you want a hotel with character and ambiance, the Dersaadat is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but some concerns...”
Reviews.Author: TravelTheWorld_048
Reviews.Content: My nephew came from the States to visit me in the UK. And while he was here, we decided to take a three day trip to Istanbul. We stayed at the Dursaadet Hotel, and the hotel itself is lovely. The majority of the staff were cordial, helpful and went out of their way to assist in any way they could. We booked two rooms - both on a single basis, but in a double room, and paid for this facility. When we arrived, one person was asked to 'volunteer' to take the Sultan's suite for the night! Well - we flipped a coin and one of us had such a lovely room! It is quite a fantastic room. The downside of this upgrade what that the person who stayed in the suite had to move to another room for the second night. This room was also nice, albeit much smaller, as you would expect. Minibar, coffee & tea and safe in the room, all as promised. The other room however, was a disappointment. There was no coffee or tea, and the shower was extremely small. But there was a mini-bar and small television. The big problem was that the airconditioning did not work on the first night. The management was able to have it fixed by the second night - just before bed time! We were also disappointed when we asked to be recommended to a 'good' fish restaurant for our second evening. The hotel organised transportation to a restaurant named 'Fener Fish Restaurant'. The transportation was a nice bonus - but the restaurant was awful! They started with showing us the appetisers on a tray - all soggy and un-appetising! And made a point of telling us that they would certainly bring us 'fresh' portions!!! We decided not to eat there - and we were really glad we did! This restaurant is in the 'fish area' - which is a collection of restaurants near the fish market. They are highly commercial and although some may have good fish, the overwhelming of 'old fish' was everywhere; so if you go there, be careful where you eat! The Dersaadet is a nice hotel. They try hard to please their guests and it is spotlessly clean. The breakfast is quite nice and the views from the roof top verandah / breakfast room are lovely. Some of the staff need a reminder of the term 'customer service'! But this was really only one person, and the front desk wanted to know all about our experiences so they could make improvements. All in all, a good place to stay in a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful and charming hotel a few minutes from the Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: DCNorm
Reviews.Content: The service and responsiveness of the staff was terrific. For example, when my wife banged her head hard on an unforgiving Istanbul sidewalk, the staff quickly provided an ice pack. The hotel itself is very charming, a well done renovation (probably about 15 years ago) of a wooden building in the Ottoman style. The room was fine, if a tad small. We asked for and got a view of thr Sea or Marmara. Simply wonderful. An added benefit was watching the seagull females caring on the rooftops for their young chicks. Two suggestions: - book well in advance. the hotel is popular - the roof terrace is open not only for a (fine) breakfast but sloe for drinks later in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Good value for price”
Reviews.Author: Mike49
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights just before Easter. Taxi from airport cost 35TL compared to 20TL (for 2) on shuttle when you have to wait at the airport until one leaves. If you want a day out to Gallipoli or Troy join a trip or hire a car for the day. Check in faultless. Overall staff could not have been more helpful and provided good advice and able to answer many questions. So pleasant and nothing was too much trouble a real gem from that aspect. In the foyer there was a laptop providing free internet access for those without there own. Foyer had free wifi as well. Breakfast on the top floor with views of the Blue Mosque and Sea of Mamara, even saw a pod of dolphins from the terrace. Breakfast self service with some hot food and continental with everything you might wish. Freshly squeezed orange juice to order at an extra cost (I noted someone says it wasnâ€™t available, maybe they meant for free) Location is brilliant, about 4 minute walk to Blue Mosque and all central sights in Istanbul. Only very tiny comment is that the rooms are quite small and yes the curtains did not completely close but did meet in the middle but adequate for a city break. Bathroom was also small but clean, modern and very good shower. Our room had a view over the Sea of Marmara but I can see there were some with a side or back view. You do not need a hire car, everything can be accessed by walking and use the trams at a standard fare of 1.75TL. We went to Gallipoli for the day and it was expensive, a major trek, left at 0630, got back at 10.30pm. Our guide was not particularly good, we went with New Deal and I would choose someone else. They use TJs in Gallipoli who is highly recommended but our battlefield guide was not as good as the others we overheard. This hotel deserves its rating on trip advisor, it is a shown as a four star but I am not sure the hotel would claim that, good three star but do not be put off, you really good do worse. Like all cities there are cheaper hotels further out of the city centre but it is in a prime position and no doubt there are many more expensive hotels which are more modern and with better luxury. I have travelled a lot on business and stayed in some smart hotels at a price! Obviously we ate out every night and what was interesting was the price difference for the same dishes from restaurant to restaurant for the same quality and quantity, look carefully.. Interestingly while we stayed there the hotel was full, about of just about every European nationality and from USA so that must say something. Do not expect absolute luxury, but I reckon for a city break you could do a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel you'd deffinitely want to return to”
Reviews.Author: Joe186478
Reviews.Content: The Management onviously spends much time and effort at selecting employees and they succede in having a helpful, interested and able staff. The actual hotel is built in the old Turkish style and is comfortable clean and enjoyable in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Could do much better, apart from location!”
Reviews.Author: puschka01
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed 2 nights with the hotel,having had 2 nights with friends living nearby..thank goodness was not here for 4 nights!! We were allocated room 403, with a poor view of back streets, what felt like a much used double bed, dingy lighting and old fashioned, worn furniture. I'm afriad that instead of being charmingly turkish in style, I found it cramped and dowdy, with the dark/old free standing furniture ready for the scrap and nasty velour curtains with stapled together tie-backs, which didnt close or overlap enough to keep out the light.Bathroom was just about acceptable, and was clean with good power to the shower - unfortunately the drain couldn't keep up with the flow and the tray became so full it overflowed into bathroom where no other option but to mop up by hand. Brakfast was Ok but no freshly squeezed juice in a city overflowing with the stuff!! best thing I can say is very convenient location AND pretty terrace for breakfast. Needs some investment I'm afraid before I would even rate it against the many functional international chains!!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: hlreds
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Dersaadet from the moment we entered our lovely suite furnished with beautiful Turkish furniture. The staff was more than kind and helpful. We enjoyed our daily breakfast on the roof top terrace with the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus Sea as back drops. The terrace was flowerfilled and the food delicious. At times it was hard to leave to do the daily sight seeing, all within walking distance. Best of all, the hotel is situated on a quiet street away from "the other tourists". What a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome, very efficient, a really lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: SallyTauranga_NZ
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night here, our first night in Istanbul and wished we couldve stayed longer.We were picked up from the airport very early one morning and even though our room was not ready, we had a light breakfast on the roof terrace and received a very warm welcome.The room was lovely, no complaints at all, the breakfast was buffet, delicious and plenty to choose from.The location was awesome, only five minutes to the Blue Mosque and mini market and cafes close by.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place !!!”
Reviews.Author: Goatuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one week and loved it. Myself, my wife and one year old had an amazing room and the staff were wonderfull. They couldn't be more helpfull particularly Umit. This place is in a great location, just round the corner from the blue mosque and I can't rate it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: YasirHamed
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Dersaadet, in the penthouse suite, from the 1st to the 6th of April. We were there for our honeymoon (we got married on the 31st of March) and wanted something cozy, personal and very romantic. We were not disappointed. It's a very nice hotel with AWESOME staff, especially Samet & Umit from the front desk. On the second day of our stay, Deniz (the owner) called us and asked whether we need anything or whether we would like anything to be changed in the room. They have free pickup from the airport but no drop off... which doesn't make sense when you've just handed them $1,700. The location is perfect, it's very close to the blue mosque and a little further along are the Hagia Sofia and Topkapi palace. I found their breakfast to be a bit plain so we would go down to this brilliant place called the Marmara Cafe which is just a 2 minute walk from the hotel. On the fourth morning, Umit asked me what I liked at the Cafe and offered to have it made and sent up to my room. And although their menemen wasn't as great as Marmara Cafe's, it was still pretty good. At any rate, it's all a matter of personal taste so I can't hold it against them. On the suite front, it isn't actually a suite. It's a room. And although largely nicely done, it still needs some attention, especially as it's their most expensive room. The lighting could have been better, the curtains aren't very good and didn't roll all the way up and the shower door rubber seal had broken so unless you're careful, you can easily flood the bathroom. I'm sure they would have fixed them had i asked them to but why should I? This is why I've given them 4 stars instead of 5. Had they taken care of all these very, very minor things before I came, I would definitely have given them a 5. I did tell them though that it was very dark in the room so they sent up three extra lamps which helped... a bit. The view from the room was excellent though. The furniture was good, sheets clean and the toiletries excellent. Would I recommend it? Definitely.

Reviews.Title: “As perfect as ever!”
Reviews.Author: Droopydrawrs52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stated at the hotel again for 3 nights.Nothing I can say would give you a true view of the hotel,the staff or the owner Deniz. Its a perect little hotel that treats customers like they are very special people. The staff look after you in every way possible and will go to great lengthts to make your staff an amazing event in this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: DrMSuleiman
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel too highly. The rooms are cosy, clean and welcoming.
