The location is close to Haghia Sofia and the Topkapi Palace, and so close to the Sultan Ahmet ('Blue') Mosque that you get a clear view of its minarets and dome when having breakfast on the terrace, which also has a wonderful view of the sea and the distant Price's Islands. The staff are friendly and invariably helpful, going out of their way to help the guests. We also had the pleasure of having a room with its own Turkish Bath. Since the hotel is not really on a main street the noise levels don't keep you awake all night. Very good value for money, and I would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “we need more realistic reviews”
Reviews.Author: cobraa
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for more than a week The hotel looks nice from the outside But from the inside itâ€™s below average The reception is very simple more like a table with a computer. The doors' handles were loose and needed to be fixed. The breakfast was very simple and lacking varieties Very simple things that make you enjoy your food werenâ€™t there such as omelet or fresh juice. If you want a fresh orange juice you have to pay 3 euro, and they have a pre-cooked eggs they call omelet. And in case you wanted to leave the hotel and go to another one as I tried after my third day you have to pay a one night charge. In my room which was a suite room there was no a/c Which was no problem in winter, but I doubt anyone can sleep in the room in summer. And if you open the windows noises from the street will come to your room. I had a queen size bed in my room but for some reason it felt so small I couldnâ€™t sleep comfortably in it with my wife , as i move a lot during sleeping i had another single bed in my room It became useful after I connected the two. And the thing that disturbed my sleep the most was the sunrays in my room. I had 5 small windows in my room with curtains that were made for decoration more than blocking, so the sun was coming from all directions making it hard to sleep in the room in the morning One time I called to get an adapter for my laptop Receptionist told me to come down to the reception and see which adapter I can use. They were three types and I believe he should come up to my room and show me which one I can take. the price of the hotel is too much considering what you get or can get in other 5 star hotels in Istanbul the only good things I like about the hotel is the location of it in sultanahmet, hotel staff speak English , the Jacuzzi in my room and the free shuttle service you get if you booked many nights to Ataturk airport but you can get it anywhere for 35 TL.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: WeLiveforVacation
Reviews.Content: The entire staff is extremely friendly. They arranged reasonable transfers to and from the airport. The breakfast is delicious, and what a view! They give a 10% discount off the already low price, and use standard exchange rates with no markup. The neighborhood is quiet, but there are stray cats (as there are all over Istanbul) that get noisy at night. We stayed in March, and the rooms were a little too warm, so we opened the windows at night. Being three blocks away from the Blue Mosque, you couldn't ask for a better location. The rooms aren't fancy, but they're very clean, spacious, and the shower was terrific. A great value!

Reviews.Title: “Not for light sleepers, otherwise marvellous”
Reviews.Author: Tebessa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights during March 2011. As it was verrrry cold outside, we were happy that rooms were well heated. Breakfast is typical Mediterranean and roof terrace has a nice view to Bosphorus. The area where hotel is situated is close to major attractions which is good if you're visiting the city for the first time. Even though this hotel offers great value, I would myself book a room closer to Tahir Square next time. If there are guests arriving late, don't expect to sleep before thay are happily settled. This beautiful old building wasn't constructed to be sound proof.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: DrFred63
Reviews.Content: My parents, aunt, and I stayed here for six nights and all of us had a truly memorable experience. From the moment we arrived the staff could not do enough for us, from making Turkish coffee while the rooms were prepared, to having breakfast sent to the lobby on an early departure day, to answering all of our many questions, nothing was too much for any of them. We felt as if we were staying in a private home as opposed to a hotel. The rooms all were spotless and comfortable with views of the Sea of Marmara ( one corner suite and two doubles for single use). The hotel's location could not be better, with a few minutes walk to all the major sights in the old city, as well as local restaurants, shops, and Turkish baths/Hamams. The breakfast served on the rooftop terrace had more than enough choice for anyone's tastes. We all look forward to returning to Istanbul and the Hotel Dersaadet and have no hesitation recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Would be happy to stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: curious1111
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul for a 4-day city-break. Not knowing what to expect, we read the reviews of the hotel and were suitably impressed. All the staff were very friendly and welcoming, the hotel was clean and comfortable and the location was quiet, too, whilst also within easy walking distance to the main sites and the Sultanahmed tram stop (solid footwear helps to manage the cobbled streets in Istanbul). For us one of the highlights was the amazing rooftop breakfast room which made this visit very special. The quality of the breakfast was also excellent and we would certainly want to stay here again for another time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, service and ambience”
Reviews.Author: Tassie48
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Dersaadet's location in the Sultanahmet neighborhood of Istanbul makes touring the old city very easy. Almost everything we wanted to do or see was within walking distance. The hotel staff was available whenever we needed them and they made sure we knew where we were going and also gave us good restaurant recommnedations. Each and every one was welcoming, friendly and very helpful. The hotel is lovely and there is an astonishing view of the Blue Mosque from the roof-top terrace. Dersaadet has just been redone, so everything is newly decorated with style and a sense of comfort. Best of all, the staff really cares about each guest. And, Deniz Duyar, the owner, answered all our pre-trip e-mails full of quesitons with lightning speed. It was a delight to stay in this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous rooftop view of Sea of Marmara”
Reviews.Author: MountainFamily303
Reviews.Content: The hotel has tastefully decorated lobby and rooms. You get a little plate of Turkish Delight to welcome you! The Turkish breakfast is all you could wish for, served on the amazing rooftop terrace. You can see the many boats sailing around the Sea of Marmara and also a nice view of the Blue Mosque. The hotel is close to the Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, etc. The staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel at the heart of the old city to satisfy all requirements”
Reviews.Author: MASCH85
Reviews.Content: Dersaadet was exactly as reviewed. It was extremely clean (a priority for me), with a friendly staff and excellent service. It's location was ideal as it's in Sultanahmet and walking distance from the major sites (Blue Mosque, Ayia Sophia, Topkapi, Grand Bazaar). I would highly recommend this hotel to all those visiting Istanbul and looking for the charm of the old city; the setting and decor of the hotel makes you feel you just got home from an exhausting day of touring.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous, helpful staff; well located; evocative with outstanding roof top terrace”
Reviews.Author: Wostah
Reviews.Content: Visiting Istanbul for the first time, my wife and I stayed, for five days, at the Dersaadet Hotel in Sultanhamut. The hotel's staff, in a quiet but friendly way, were helpful fom the first moment. Like many moderately priced priced small European hotels, Dersaardet's sinple but well appointed rooms are not large, so the efficient way in which the front desk taff offered and then replaced an extra bed with a table and chairs made an enormous difference iin our overall comfort. The hotel is well situated in a quiet neighborhood a just over a block to the southwest of the Blue Mosque and the upmarket Arasta Bazaar and Murcel Cafe which gfeatures evening "folk" music And it is not much further from the Hippodrome, Agya Sofia and tramway. I would imagine during the busy tourist season this location, a bit away from the crowds, would be even more appreciated. The Dersaadet, in the Ottoman style is attractivre both inside and out, but the roof top terrace deserves special mention, beginning again with its courteous staff and comfortable amenities at breakfast and then throughout the day and evening. However what makes it not to be mssed are it's incredible vistas. One the one side there is a broad panorama of the busy Marmack Sea as it nears the Bosphoros Straits. On the other the sensously beautiful minarets of the Blue Mosque appear close enough to touch, especially when spot lit at night. For me these views alone would be enough to stay at the Dersaadet, but the hotel itself is also is a near perfect example of its kind. Kevin Kane kevinrkane@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE the Dersaadet Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: icrown
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully kind staff. I was struck by the fact that they would standup and greet us whenever we entred the lobby; ready to answer any question. Clean and comfortable room. Very easy walk to Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Tram, Topaki Palace, Hagia Sophia and Hippodrome. Shops and small bazaar near by. Quiet street. Love hearing the call to prayer being called from Blue Mosque near by.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, location, and terrace with a view of the Marmara Sea”
Reviews.Author: urbaneexplorer
Reviews.Content: My friend and I loved the Hotel Dersaadet. We had a view of the Marmara Sea from our little window, but the best part about this hotel is the terrace, from which you can see the Marmara Sea stretching below, as well as the Blue Mosque. We were only a few blocks from the Mosque. The service was wonderful--very helpful people at the desk. I do wish the room had been larger, a little wider--we had to walk sideways around our suitcases, so I recommend, if you can afford it, reserving one of the larger "suites," but we always had the lovely terrace to retreat to after a long day, and it was a charming place to have breakfast. The breakfasts were great, too.

Reviews.Title: “A real treasure in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: toniaMoscow
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dersaadet is perfect -- charming small hotel with attentive, friendly staff, excellent breakfast on rooftop terrace with view of the Sea of Marmara and Blue Mosque. The interior is plush, with old Ottoman woodworking and oriental carpets. Staff is terrific. It's located within walking distance of all the historical sights that a first-timer to Istanbul should see -- Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Grand Bazaar. Tram and taxi are easily accessible as well. It's also within walking distance of great restaurants. hotel and rooms are spotlessly clean, with all the amenities (modern bathrooms) in a cozy old-style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeb8
Reviews.Content: The Dersaadet Hotel is an excellent hotel sitauted within walking distance of the major attractions in Sultanahmet (Old CIty). The hotel has an authentic Ottoman feel to it, the staff could not have been more helpful and all of our needs were catered for. The buffet breakfast is continental in style and served on the roof terrace which had lovely views over the Bosphorous and of the Blue Mosque. Drinks were served on the roof terrace at a reasonable price until 11pm. I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to visit Istanbul. I struggle to think of any negative points to mention.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice of small hotel in the heart of historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Cake_yum
Reviews.Content: A great small hotel, walking distance to all the attractions in Sultanahmet. The staff were very friendly and helpful and provided a map, gave restaurant recommendations and helped with our coach booking to Izmir. There is also a free internet station available 24/7. Our ground floor room had a fantastic Turkish bath and shower room. Half the room was a wet room with a ceiling shower which was wonderful - a real treat. The decor throughout was authentic and stylish and the whole place felt confortable and quiet. There were also slippers and robes in the room and plenty of pillows and blankets as required. Breakfast was served on the roof terrace which has great views across the Bosphorus and onto the Blue Mosque. Breakfast was traditional and simple with a choice of cereals, breads, meats, cheese, olives, scrambled egg with juice, tea and coffee. Drinks and snacks were available on the terrace until 11pm. This is a great choice if you want a smaller hotel with a Turkish feel but still good quality surrounds.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute delight”
Reviews.Author: 2000B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dersaadet Hotel in October 2010 with some friends on our first trip to Turkey, and so were not absolutely sure what to expect, and where in the city we would be located. We were delighted by this hotel, the charm of the staff, the quiet location, the imaginative decor, and the proximity to all the main tourist sights in this part of the city. Please dont expect huge rooms, with 42inch flat screen TVs.... you will be disappointed. But if you want a comfortable hotel, which is a credit to its owner, a credit to its staff, and credit to its City, I dont think you will find better.

Reviews.Title: “This is a first-class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Woodleas
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel in every sense of the word. We appreciated the hotelâ€™s location in the heart of the Sultanahmet district. The unique buildings and treasures of the old city were within easy walking distance. The hotelâ€™s Ottoman style of building in wood has been faithfully captured, and the furniture, fittings, and decoration are equally authentic and impressive. The bedrooms are very comfortable, with all the necessary fittings and amenities. At the end of the day, the hotel provided a place of repose after the hurly-burly of the big city. The hotel fully lives up to its name : Dersaadet, â€˜the place of happinessâ€™. The staff make sure that every guest is welcome, and throughout our stay, every request for service or information received immediate and effective attention. Last, but not least, we really enjoyed the marvellous breakfasts in the restaurant at the very top of the building. The restaurant has superb views of the sea, and, across the nearby rooftops, Istanbulâ€™s most famous landmark, the Blue Mosque. Our sincere thanks to the Dersaadet for looking after us so well !

Reviews.Title: “Happiness and beauty - the name of the hotel says it all”
Reviews.Author: meriah
Reviews.Content: As a Finnish Mother of two sons, I take each one of them to a trip abroad at least once a year to spend time together, but also to learn to appreciate different cultures. We choose hotels carefully trying to find a quality hotel that has local character. The Dersaadet hotel met our expectations very well, as it is very well kept, has a very friendly, reliable staff, had a perfect location (i.e. away from the very touristic Akbiyik Cad -street) close to the main sights and yet in very Turkish surroundings with local cafes and shops (try Doy Doy for lunch if you like local experiences, and Buhara 93 for lunch or dinner, both almost next to Dersaadet). Hotel is beautifully decorated, and has a very friendly and happy atmosphere. Neighbourhood is quiet and quaint. Breakfast buffet in the roof terrace was a delightful experience. One can see the Blue mosque (and hear calls to prayer five times a day). This is a perfect choice for those who want something different from the international chains. I would imagine that their new sister hotel would be great, too, as it is next to the amazing bazaar area, and has got a convenient tram connection (less than â‚¬1 per person) to the main sights if one does not walk the 10 minutes. Lastly, a hint for parents with teenagers, original tasty kebabs you will find from Sultanahmet KÃ¶ftecisi (Divanyolu number 12a, NOT number 2 - it is a copy cat).

Reviews.Title: “cozy atmospheric hotel in good location with great views”
Reviews.Author: ddubuque
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our recent stay at the Dersaadet. Very friendly staff especially the waiters at the breakfast buffet/ rooftop terrace bar. Rooms had character in style and design and ours had a lovely view of the Sea of Marmara. Hotel includs wifi which pleased my husband but also has a computer to use in the lobby which I took advantage of. Very close to Blue Mosque (views from terrace), Hagia Sophia and Topkapi and other old district sights. Good choice and if you pay cash you get a 10% discount. recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Walk to everything including the nice tram”
Reviews.Author: noroamingcharges
Reviews.Content: Yes it is a small hoter with small rooms (we got the conrner suite and that was worth the extra space). On the other hand the staff was wonderful and extremely helpful with anything you needed. The location can only be beaten by the Four Seasons. Thus you walk to attractions 1-3 (Blue mosque, Aghia Sophia, and Topkapi Palace/museum. It is also close to some famous Hammam and the tram which takes you to the ferry terminal in minutes. The rooms could be updated with better TVs and such but who is there to watch TV anyway! Good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, welcoming Ottoman-era hotel in Istanbul with great breakfast buffet & friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: luckyoregontraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week in February 2010. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a charming neighborhood & close to many restaurants. It's within easy walking distance from the tram and is very close to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and other historic attractions in that area of Istanbul. We ate breakfast on a cozy (partially enclosed terrace) overlooking the Marmara Sea. Breakfast buffet was generous--my husband looked foward to the sesame buns (simit) and sour cherry jam each morning. The downstairs lobby was spacious, warm, inviting and pleasant. Although there was an elevator, we chose to use the stairs to get to our third floor accomodation. Our room was tastefully wallpapered and decorated with antiques and Turkish kilims. The bathroom & room was larger than average size for a room in an older converted home. Bonus: our room had a modest sea view! For around 90 Euro/night, you can't beat a place like this.

Reviews.Title: “All around good”
Reviews.Author: Fish_Ness
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 days this August. Firstly, the location is excellent as the hotel is only about 500m away from Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome and Ayasophya, but also on a quiet side street so that we didn't have to suffer from the parade of diesel coaches full of visitors that treks up the hill every morning from 8am. Secondly, the staff who were all (with one exception) very friendly and professional and had a genuine desire to help in anyway that they could, including bookings, recommendations and checking travel details for us. We were upgraded to a sea-view from our room for free which was a nice touch. The roof-terrace is also a delight for breakfast or evening drinks, with wonderful views of the sea of Marmara, Sultanhamet and surrounding district, and views over to the Princes' Islands in the distance. The hotel also has a laundry next-door which is also very useful if you are staying for a few days and/or travelling light. Our room was quite small, but well equipped, clean and with a nice design, and there is free wi-fi throughout the hotel. The only disappointment for me was that there was no bath, only a shower, but I realise that this may not be a problem at all for a lot of people.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest small city hotels I have stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Annjane
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Arasta Bazaar, AyaSofia and the Topkapi Palace. We were made very welcome by the staff and showed to our room on the third floor. En route we had a peek in to the Sultan's suite which was decorated in a sumptuous Ottoman fashion! Our room had everything we needed and a view out over the Bosphorus, the local skyline and the neighbourhood mosque. The 5am call to prayer from the mosque was a bit of a surprise but didn't disturb us too much! Ear plugs help. The room could probably benefit from redecoration as the walls were marked by luggage in places but it was very comfortable with a great bathroom. The roof terrace was a great place to breakfast and to finish the day with a drink - spectacular views of the Bosphorus and the Blue Mosque. We weren't impressed with the general standard of eateries in Sultanahmet but did find a couple of good restaurants - Sarnic - which is located near the Topkapi palace and the Sera restaurant at the Armada Hotel. If you can avoid using the taxis, do so, as they are not a very pleasant experience. We had a journey that should have cost 9.70 TL on the meter and the driver wanted 15 TL and dropped us 10 minutes walk from the hotel. Pity the city authorities don't regulate taxis better as they don't give a good impression of Istanbul. The hotel staff were great throughout our stay and extremely hepful to us and other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with a family or best friend”
Reviews.Author: AJLCA
Reviews.Content: This hotel has now jumped to one of my favourites, right at the top of the list. The staff were super helpful and always there when you needed them. Sometimes it was like they appeared by magic just as you wanted something. The roof top terrace is perfect for views out to the sea or over the rooftops to the Blue Mosque. An ideal location for all the main sights and loads of great places to eat and shop all close by. We stayed in a room on the top floor and my only complaint would be that we heard the noise of chairs moving about in the roof top terrace in the morning when we had a late start while others were up early for breakfast. Overall though this was nothing much to worry about. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Visit to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: carolemcw
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Dersaadet in Istanbul was delightful. The rooms were pleasant and the roof top dining room for breakfast was enchanting. The staff was very helpful, giving us good directions to use the public transportation system, even supplying us with transportation tokens to get started. The hotel is located in a great spot to see the Blue Mosque and other historical sites and to access interesting shopping. We loved our stay and would return in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “It's just a standard hotel--nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: dooijp
Reviews.Content: When you read the reviews you think the place is smashing. It's not. It's a standard room, with a shower, a toilet, and a bed. I think more like a holiday inn/hilton level of quality. I think the starts people give it are just not commensurate with the type of hotel. It's a 3 star at best. The food in the morning was ordinary, the mattress had no comforter, just a rug thrown on top of it. about all that can be said is that the location is ok, but there must be better out there.

Reviews.Title: “Close to all major sights in Sultanahmet but in a farily quiet neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Sunmansyd
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in June and then 1 night in July. The location is great, walk to all major sights in Sultanahmet (e.g. Blue Mosque, Haghia Sofia, Hippodrome...) or you can just want up the street to catch the tram if you feel a little bit tired of walking. The building is very well maintained, kept the old charm but with modern amenities (e.g. there is a lift). Rooftop is a great place to have breakfast and some snacks/drinks, with great views of the Bosphorous and the surrounding neighourbood. Front desk guys are very very helpful and polite all the time. For the first stay, the room was directly opposite the lift with a sea view, it is fairly small and comfortable; for the second stay, the room was at the corner directly above the entrance side, this room is much bigger, in much better condition, and we are treated with Turkish Delights on a silver plate,placed on the bed, very very nice. The hotel slippers are very comfortable, they will last and they are not made of paper like the cheaper ones. One last thing to comment is the inconsistency sometimes we experience in the housekeeping e.g. blanket will be taken away after a night use, one room has shoe horn and sink plug and the other doesn't have both, these are just small issues, nothing to dampen our good feeling towards this hotel that we highly recommend you to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: CAH83CA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located for seeing the major sights of the Sultanahmet section of Istanbul (Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, Cistern, Topkapi, Archeological Museum, etc.) on foot. The best restaurant choices are not in that district, but easy enough to get to by cab. We had a "sea view" room, which offered a slice of the water over the roof-tops of the buildings between the hotel and the sea. Unfortunately, there is a minaret with a loudspeaker broadcasting the calls to prayer at 6 times of day and night about 20 yards from the windows on the sea view side, so leaving a window open (and even with the window shut) means a lot of noise. We stayed at the hotel for four nights which included transportation from the Airport, which was a nice plus. Apart from that, the room was fine, if a bit too small (you had to sidestep between the bed and the desk), clean and adequately furnished. Breakfast at the rooftop terrace was good, the staff was very helpful and accommodating, making dinner reservations for us, and giving good directions to the sights. I would recommend the hotel with the caveats mentioned above. If sightseeing is your primary purpose in Istanbul, being right in the heart of the main attractions is another definite plus.

Reviews.Title: “This small comfortable hotel, within walking distance of major attractions, is very good value.”
Reviews.Author: Bethany74
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It has a delightful terrace with views of the Blue Mosque and the sea on which a good breakfast is served, as well as refreshments in the evening. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “We would choose this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: salty72
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently returned from a very enjoyable week in Istanbul, not only because it's a fantastic city but also because we stayed at the Hotel Dersaadet. We had read the favourable comments on TripAdvisor and in several travel guides and we were not disappointed. The location, view from the breakfast terrace and the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, particularly on the front desk, were all wonderful. We would love to return to Istanbul one day and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast seeing Marmaris sea and Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: cida
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed 6 days at Dersaadet Hotel in Istanbul and we have a great time there. The hotel provides a free transfer from the airport to people that stay at the hotel for more the 3 nights. The hotel is a good surprise, the room is spacious, very clean, with a bathroom tipe turkish bath, with robes and slippers. There were sweets (Turkish delights) as welcome. The breakfast is very delicious , with many options, fruits, homemade jams, included roseÂ´s jam, is amazing, and the roof garden has a view from Blue Mosque and Marmaris sea that is awesome. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is very nice, we could walk to Haghia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topikapi, Archeological Museum, Hipodromo, Cistern, and near the tram stop that goes to Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar and Galata Bridge. If you pay in cash you have 10% of discount. I recomend this hotel for everyone that are going to Istambul. If we return to Istanbul weÂ´ll stay there, certainly. Cida

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: ChesapeakeDrive
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was excellent. Terrace restaurant was very nice and had great views. Located in easy walking distance to Blue Mosc, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palance.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, well placed, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Liz2858
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a well decorated and maintained hotel with a fantastic view from the breakfast terrace on the roof over the Bosphorus and the roof tops. Safe for single girl travellers although in a relatively quiet street with other hotels, little market etc. 2 minutes walk to The Blue Mosque and the main drag in SultanAhmet, the trams, Topkapi Palace, Haglia Sophia Mosque, Gulhane Park etc. The staff are really helpful and chatty, but also one doesn't get the impression that they are getting back handers for taxis which is often the case elsewhere - it is all genuine helpfulness. Excellent - will stay again, although I think their 17 rooms get booked up quickly. It comes well recommended. and value for money. Single room compact but well equipped and not an issue

Reviews.Title: “Not Sure What the Good Ratings Are All About”
Reviews.Author: villesobe
Reviews.Content: The Staff is genuinely friendly however, the overall hotel is not so great. Our room was small, the beds were not great, and the basement rooms have windows that have bared windows (think fire?). Finally, the noise between rooms is not good. We could hear our upstairs neighbors moving about and talking quite easily and hear snoring at night. The location is quite nice but overall the hotel does not seem to be a 5.0 - more like a 3.5. For the money I think you could do much better with some more research..

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly, cosy hotel with the perfect location for the major sights”
Reviews.Author: Cyclewalk
Reviews.Content: A small friendly hotel in a fantastic position for sightseeing Sitting on the roof terrace for breakfast, snacks and drinks you have fantastic views of the Bosphorus, the Blue Mosque and the City. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the rooms were of adequate size with comfy beds. All six of us were really happy at the hotel and it made our four day stay in Istanbul just right. Thoroughly recommended!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff. Okay rooms and breakfast. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: juddyray
Reviews.Content: Dersaadet offers complimentary airport pickup with I think a 3 night stay. Located by the Blue Mosque, it is more or less in the center of things as a short walk will get you to the key sites. Be prepared for the call to prayer though as this hotel is right next to loudspeakers for one, if not two, mosques. 5 times a day. And certainly loud enough.Great rooftop restaurant. View is terrific. Service was great. Be prepared for plenty of tauts -- especially for rugs!!!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Gabby79
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Istanbul. It's only a couple of streets away from the Blue Mosque and Ayasofya, but a world away from the hustle and bustle of central Sultanahmet. My husband and i were celebrating our anniversary, and it was a lovely surprise to find, upon entering our room, a complimentary bottle of wine, fruit platter, a selection of turkish delight to sample, as well as a personal note from the management. All members of staff were extremely friendly and helpful - they even obliged when I asked if they could gift wrap a couple of presents I had brought with me for our Turkish friends! The roof terrace is lovely, with a view of the blue mosque on one side and the bosphorus on the other. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT stay!”
Reviews.Author: cselliot
Reviews.Content: A wonderful stay. Great location, great staff and good value!!

Reviews.Title: “NIce little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Minerva88
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable, clean and ideal for all your sightseeing trips. Would have preferred a room that didn't back onto the street as this was a bit noisy, so don't take room 201 or 202. and it does say that rooms have sea view, but this is not the case. My daughter had the corner suite and even that didn't. But otherwise really lovely. The breakfast /bar look out over the city and you can eat out on the balcony and real treat. The staff friendly and welcoming. I would come back again, thanks Deniz.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: MandMRadlett
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and helpful, and spoke excellent English. We deliberately chose a 'traditional' style of hotel, and enjoyed its features along with an excellent modern en-suite shower room, and free internet access at all times. We had a good view of the Blue Mosque at breakfast, and we were within an easy walk of many top sites. The modern tram system is nearby too, and easy to use to reach other parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff,quiet and cozy”
Reviews.Author: traveladdict008
Reviews.Content: great location (you can see the Blue Mosque from the rooftop dining area), comfortable rooms, and a great staff.....I had stared a three week trek with a stopover in Istanbul, and discovered that I had forgotten to bring a watch or a clock. The receptionist at the Hotel Dersaadet not only found me a small clock...he gave it to me!! What a wonderful way to start a trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff in a lovely hotel in the old city”
Reviews.Author: HertfordPeter
Reviews.Content: The Dersaadet is a small hotel and this might account for the good deal and quality of service we received. Even before we got there, the staff were going the extra mile, always quick to answer e-mailed questions about the accommodation and transport. This high level of service continued from the moment we arrived, with friendly, multilingual staff always on hand to answer questions, 'phone a restaurant to make a booking or simply get a taxi. The hotel itself is in a great location for walking to the Topkapi Palace, the Bazaar and the Hagia Sophia within only a few minutes. Nearest, though, is the Blue Mosque, which you can see clearly from the rooftop terrace where breakfast is served. We can recommend this place really highly, for what we paid, we got exceptional value: it was spotlessly clean, our room was large, tastefully decorated and the bathroom even had a jacuzzi. The nightlife nearby isn't on the same scale as on the Galata (north) side, but there are still plenty of good restaurants two or three streets away and places within 5 minutes for late drinks. That suited us, as it allowed us to have a good night out, without having to listen to it once we'd gone back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with a staff that aims to please”
Reviews.Author: stilltravellingSC
Reviews.Content: Clearly, the staff here is determined to meet and exceed every need of their clientele. After traveling from the US to Istanbul, we appreciated the Hotel Dersaadet providing pickup service from the airport to the hotel (free of charge for those who stay more than 3 nights). The next morning, we were pleased to find a incredibly varied breakfast offering ready for us (included in the price of the stay). That evening we came back to find a lovely basket of fruit, nuts, wine and Turkish delights in our room. These touches make it so much easier to get settled into a new locale. In buying a home, the goal is "location, location, location" and again Dersaadet gets an A. You can easily walk to the most popular tourist spots-Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sophia, the Underground Cistern, Istanbul Archaelogical Museum, Turkish and Islamic Arts Museum--there are more archaelogical relics than you can imagine could exist in one area. Public transportation is close at hand and easy to use. The hotel itself has charming and comfortable rooms with wonderful bedding (you can request a Marmara Sea view) and a wonderful glass surround rooftop terrace (with indoor or outdoor dining) where breakfast, snacks and incredible views of the sea and historical sites abound. If all this isn't enough, inside the room is a greeting to the guests asking them to please let the staff know if there is anything more that can be done. Visit their website to see photos.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: CityCaroline
Reviews.Content: I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Istanbul. The service is excellent: very friendly and efficient. If you email in advance, they will arrange to pick you up from the airport which is really lovely. The location is excellent in the old town, very close to all the essential sites of the city and the roof top terrace is lovely for breakfast and a drink last thing at night with a lovely view of the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorous. We had a twin room so it was quite spacious and my friend and I thought the amenities were good, particularly the shower, although the bathroom was a little shabby. Very clean hotel and if you get the chance, have dinner or lunch in the no frills restaurant Doy Doy close by as it is very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly delightful hotel in the heart of the old city.”
Reviews.Author: BKandE
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed at the Dersaadet Hotel for a week in mid-February. Booking on-line was easy, the staff was responsive, and when I gave the wrong arrival time for our airport pick-up, I sent a hasty email the day of our flight -- to which they immediately responded, assuring me that I would be picked up on time. It was a relief to see the driver there as soon as we entered the arrivals hall. The entire staff was terrific, and we especially enjoyed dealing with Umit, the front office manager. He greeted us each morning with a sunny smile and was always willing to offer advice on sites, restaurants, and anything else we cared to ask. The Dersaadet is perfectly located -- about five minutes from the Blue Mosque and in a pleasant and fairly quiet neighborhood with several good restaurants (I'd recommend Doy Doy, Tamara, Buhara 93, and a restaurant across from Buhara with a fountain courtyard where Turkish men were smoking fragrant apple nargiles and playing backgammon.) We booked a corner suite, which was spacious and charmingly decorated, with a big four poster for me and a (slightly less comfortable) day-bed for my daughter. The nicely-appointed bathroom was roomy, with a jacuzzi and shower. The room had five windows, letting in lots of sunshine and fresh air. Free wireless internet was a big plus. I would suggest spending the extra money for a corner suite because the neighboring room looked quite small. A substantial buffet breakfast is served in a sunny room and terrace at the top of the hotel, with chirping parakeets to accompany your morning coffee. The fare includes various breads, cereal, scrambled and boiled eggs, sausage, (cold) french fries, cheeses, cold cuts, fresh fruit, yoghurt, olives, cucumbers, tomatoes, juices and hot drinks -- something for every taste. I would suggest that they also offer fresh-squeezed seasonal fruit juices -- something you can get on nearly every block. The breakfast attendant was friendly and efficient. One morning when a couple arrived 10 minutes before breakfast was over and the scrambled eggs had just been finished off (by me), the attendant made sure they got freshly cooked omlettes. All in all, we have a terrific time in Istanbul, and much credit goes to the Dersaadet and its staff for making our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, but overrated on TripAdvisor reviews”
Reviews.Author: Mary014
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on reviews on Tripadvisor and were disappointed with the room we had. It was a triple and very small - even though we had booked a double - so had no table/lounge area we are used to in other hotels. It also looked like it needed some redecoration - particularly in the bath area - although it was warm all the time. The bed was very hard and we mentioned this to the friendly receptionist and they put some padding so it was more comfortable. We booked a transfer from Sabiha Gocken @ 50 euros - really thats average price - all on time. If you haven't booked your flight yet, don't bother booking easyjet unless you are happy to pay this each way with an hour's transfer. The other airport is very close. The weird thing though is that the hotel would let you put the pick up on the bill but not the return if you are paying by credit card - very strange and they couldn't seem to explain it very well. The hotel has an amazing location just a stones throw from all the good sights, the palace, blue mosque and haghia sophia not forgetting the grand bazaar which is so much fun. At night it was very safe. If you are looking for good nightlife - go out to Tunel on the other side of the river - you'll pay somewhere between 12-18 Turkish Lira in a taxi. Great fun though. The staff in the hotel were friendly though and the breakfast was good with a nice view. Having said all this - dont not book this hotel - depends on your expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Cold and wet in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: KSSandSGS
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on reviews on Trip Advisor, but were very disappointed. We paid extra for a sea-view room, which was dark with a tiny window where you had to crouch to see the view. However, the worst thing was that for our 4-night stay in November, with temperatures near freezing, there was no heat. We were told it was broken and being fixed, and each day a different person gave us a different story. It was not fixed for our entire stay. We were given dirty blankets to help us, but we could not relax in the hotel, or sleep properly due to the cold. Our clothes never dried out from the rain. In addition, we paid in cash, in order to receive a discount, but still paid significantly over the posted rates at reception. When we queried this we were told the posted rates were out of date. Unfortunately the hotel really spoiled our impression of Istanbul and it's people.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent service, good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: AustrianinCH
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent a long weekend in Istanbul and enjoyed every minute. The hotel is right very close to major sights and is therefore a great base for exploring Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: avoronin
Reviews.Content: Very good place to stay. Everything was fine and we enjoyed every minuet.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay at Dersaadet Hotel Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: USHAA85
Reviews.Content: The Dersaadet Hotel Istanbul is centrally and conveniently located to some of the main attractions of Istanbul, i.e Haghia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Museums, and Basilica Cistern etc. We would walk to these attractions and shopping areas till late at night as the area was safe. We walked nearby to discover an area of several art galleries and calligraphers. The bus, tram, train, and taxis were within a walking distance, enabling us to travel all over Istanbul comfortably. The room was cozy and tastefully decorated with an attached modern bathroom. In the lobby there was a PC with high speed internet connection. The staff was friendly, professional, courteous and very helpful. We plan to return to Istanbul and stay again at Dersaadet Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: smarty1Ukraine
Reviews.Content: Was there to celebrate my birthday - it was a real pleasure to find a bottle of wine and some fruits along with the note from hotel's owner in the room. Good staff, excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Small, charming Ottoman hotel - Terrific views, location and service.”
Reviews.Author: JeanneMG_9
Reviews.Content: Breakfast and sundown drinks served in a rooftop room with wonderful views of the Blue Mosque and the blue Sea of Marmara. From the moment we arrived and were greated by the owner it was a very enjoyable stay. Restaurant recommendations were excellent including Asitane, next to the Chora Church museum, and Rumeli near the Bazaar (Despite the strength of the dollar vs the Turkish lira, food and drinks are relatively expensive). The Dersaadet Hotel was impeccably clean and the staff were warm and eager to provide to service. We especially enjoyed the breakfasts and the great location close to all of the old city sights - just a few blocks from the Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar - yet on a quiet rather than busy or touristy street. A wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep like a Sultan”
Reviews.Author: AlternaTrotter
Reviews.Content: We selected the Desaardet specifically for the Sultan's Penthouse Suite as we didn't want to begin our first trip to Turkey in an antiseptically modern chain hotel (or in a colorful but cramped room in an independent hotel). This room certainly lived up to the hotel's photos. We found it to be stylish, plush and very spacious. The bathroom is similarly roomy and reasonably well-appointed, and most importantly, clean. The balcony is quite small although we had little use for it in December, other than putting out a little bread for the seagulls. There is a little bit of urban blight in the view, but mostly we looked out to the harbor and scarcely noticed anything else. There is a minaret close by which may be a bit loud for some, but we did not find it disturbing. One of the hotel's few shortcomings is its selection of food. Quality is reasonable, but choices are minimal. The breakfast buffet has but a few items and the room service menu is limited to club sandwiches, omelettes, and french fries. However, there are several dining options, including take-away, within a few blocks of the hotel. Location is a major plus for the hotel. In addition to convenient food options, several major attractions are less than ten minutes away by foot. Better still, the walk from the hotel to the sights requires passing only one salesman (in front of the Turkish bath) and he's so quiet and polite that he barely qualifies as a hawker by Istanbul standards. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and handled all of our needs with competence and courtesy. We needed transfers to two different airports and both were on time. While many things in Istanbul that are marketed as "Sultan's" something-or-other may be mass-produced tourist nonsense, we were very satisfied with our decision to spend our first few days in Turkey at the Sultan's Penthouse Suite of the Desaardet.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculately kept, friendly hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: QuaestorLondon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break in Istanbul and would echo the recommedations of others for this hotel. The rooms are cosy and beautifully decorated and the hotel staff could not have done more for us. Umit was an excellent source of information and assistance on local restaurants and transport. The top floor terrace breakfast room and bar is a great amenity with great views of the waterfront on one side and the Blue Mosque on the other. If you want to be in a central location but in a small hotel with the personal touch then the Dersaadet is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: TexasA69
Reviews.Content: The Dersaadet Hotel was perfect for us. They have complimentary airport pick-up service, which was great because we arrived after 10pm. The location of the hotel is exceptional - very close to many of the historic sites. The staff was friendly, efficient and helpful. The breakfast buffet was always good -- eggs, breads, yogurt, fresh & dried fruit, cereal, etc. It was a perfect way to start our day - we especially enjoyed having coffee on the terrace. We stayed in one of the corner suites, which had a king bed and a twin, plus a sitting area and vanity desk. The bathroom was updated & very clean, with a jacuzzi tub. We would definitely stay at this hotel again in the future. This was our first trip to Istanbul, and I'm so glad we chose to stay at Dersaadet Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Truely the most wonderfull hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: limaDK
Reviews.Content: I had the most pleasent stay at Dersaadet Hotel Istanbul. The whole staff, and especialy the front manager was so helpfull and gave us some good and honest advises on whatever matter. I loved the fact that it was located in the "old" part of Istanbul, very charming, just a 5 min the blue mosque, but still quite peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly small hotel, great staff and lovely roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: xerwen
Reviews.Content: Well located in a quiet road near to the Blue Mosque, with exceptionally friendly staff - Umit on the front desk, another Umit and Mehmet in the breakfast room. The room was comfortable, and the roof terrace is really lovely with fine views over the sea. Very good buffet breakfast. On my birthday, the staff surprised me with wine, fruit and turkish delight!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, well appointed small hotel, perfectly placed but quiet”
Reviews.Author: Peagirl
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel on the basis of Lonely Planet comments and web reviews. We were not disappointed! The hotel is very well appointed, clean and comfortable and, although only 5 mintes from the big attractions of Istanbul (Blue Mosque, Hayia Sofia and Topkapi), it is very quiet. The staff are genuinely friendly, helpful and keen to chat if you are! The breakfast room has a lovely view of the Blue mosque and you can watch the shipping traffic on the Sea of Marmara. Breakfast is great! We would recommend this place to anyone - it is excellent value, particularly for a city hotel wth character.

Reviews.Title: “The service was exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: Laner
Reviews.Content: I cannot thank the staff of the hotel enough for all their ideas, assistance and overall pleasant experience. Having been recommended by a client, I decided to book here; and I am glad we did. Having broke my flat iron on the trip, Umit, one of the front desk receptionists was quick to find me one and allow me to use it for the remainder of my stay. I was pleasantly surprised. Umit and Mahmud in the Terrance Restaurant were always smiling and ready to provide information about the city and its people. I found Turkey to be an interesting and extremely friendly city. The staff at the Dersaadet Hotel just made it better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: claky
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before our cruise departed. We have been to Istanbul before so only wanted to stay 1 night. We were picked up from the airport by the Hotel and on arrival went straight to our room I had tried to book a suite but there were none available but that didn't matter as the room we had was lovely. We had a view of the water and could open the window to let in the breeze. All the facilities in the room were in good working order and there was plenty of room to move around. The bathroom was compact but designed well. The breakfast in the morning on the terrace is great as you can sit in or outside and view the Blue Mosque. This hotel is in a great location and has staff that are willing to go out of there way to help you. Excellent stay and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly a nice experience"”
Reviews.Author: htber
Reviews.Content: The Dersaadet Hotel's location in the Sultanahmet quarter is idea for exploring; the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and Topkapi Palace are within easy walking distance as are abundant shops and restaurants. Our room was small but adequate. My only conplaint was the shower mildew that needed attention. Overall the hotel is clean, well maintained, and attractive. The breakfast buffet was good. Special kudos to the food and drink attendant who was very helpful and pleasant from breakfast on through the cocktail hour. The terrace area where breakfast and drinks are served overlooks the sea and provides a beautiful view. The service was for the most part very good. The day clerks cheerfully and efficiently arranged tours and dinner reservations and accurately answered our many queries. On the other hand, the night clerk ranks at or near the top of my list of surliest travel industry workers. The hotel needs to enroll him in a public relations/customer service course. Overall a good experience, however.

Reviews.Title: “Just as discribed.”
Reviews.Author: boblNashvilleTn_
Reviews.Content: My wife and I try to stay in small family hotels. This is one of the ones we enjoyed the most. The five star rating is not like the Four Season's five stars, but comes from the quality of the people. They were super friendly. The room was just as I expected, not fancy, but quaint. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible views, but ok value”
Reviews.Author: liapa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well appointed. Views on Marmara Sea and Blue Mosque are unforgettable. Very nice breakfast. I thought Umit - in the restaurant - and Samit - in the reception- (i hope my spellings are correct) were most professional and knowledgeable. Few reservations - I would not stay below 3rd floor. Sea view from the room was not that much worth it, as windows are a bit small. I stayed in room 401, may be it is different in other rooms. Room had noise from bathroom, which was also not in excellent condition. I had bed-bug bites in room 201, gladly I stayed there for one night and still not sure if they came with me, but the bathroom seemed in a better condition. They have pillows for all tastes, which is very thoughtful. I wish hotel served dinner at the restaurant, the area is very touristy and hard to find lovely place to eat. Plus it is better to enjoy such phenomenal views at night.

Reviews.Title: “Conviently located to all the sights”
Reviews.Author: JacknDiane40
Reviews.Content: Rooftop terrace was a great breakfast location or a place for a glass of wine before dinner with its spectacular view of the city. Desk staff was very helpful in directtions and recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place! Great historic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cattypas
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel to stay in if you're more interested in atmosphere than luxe amenities (since hotel does not have fitness facilities, conference rooms, etc). This is one of a small number of Special Category Hotels in Istanbul whose facilities are old Ottoman mansions rehabbed and brought into 21st century. Everyone who works here is most congenial and helpful, incl. dining and sights recommendations. Mr. Ciftci at the hotel front office has a book of "Cool Restaurants in Istanbul". The hotel is small -- only 17 rooms. Buffet breakfast ( a fine one) occurs on the rooftop patio cafe, with a fine vista of the sea and the Blue Mosque. They have an elevator -- not always the case in smaller hotels -- but essential for your luggage. The neighborhood is very colorful; OK for walking in during the day but might not be so great for women walking at night. Great location for seeing the historic sights of Istanbul: a short walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, and the Grand Bazaar. I would recommend this hotel very enthusiastically and without any reservations!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bajangirl2009
Reviews.Content: spent 3 nights at the Dersaadet Hotel and was impressed with the staff - always willing to help! Although we had a minaret right outside our bedroom window, we were never disturbed by the call to prayers. the hotel bar/terrace is a perfect place to end the day with a glass of wine looking out over the Marmara Sea. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A small, friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: russell29
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a small group (2 couples) and chose the Dersaadet Hotel because it was ideally located for the sights of historic Istanbul and sounded friendly and full of character. We were not disappointed. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and the stunning Topkapi Palace. There is an abundance of restaurants, cafes and bars in the area. Although the traffic in Istanbul can be horrendous at times, The Dersaadet is off the main thoroughfare and quiet. The staff of the hotel were some of the most friendly and helpful we have encountered. Nothing was too much trouble: arranging transfers from the cruise terminal and to the airport, recommending and booking restaurants, offering general advice on sights and attractions, even printing our boarding passes for the flight home. Although the Hotel does not have a restaurant, there is a breakfast room and bar on the roof offering great views of The Blue Mosque and The Sea of Marmara. Open until late in the evening, it was a great place to relax after dinner in the Old City. The standard rooms are nicely furnished, if a little small. If your budget allows we would recommend one of the larger suites, which are very comfortable. Bathrooms are very well appointed and spotlessly clean throughout.

Reviews.Title: “A Stone's Throw From All The Main Attractions”
Reviews.Author: DonIsGood
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Dersaadet Hotel for 3 nights and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay... definitely a gem in Istanbul LOCATION - A stone's throw away from all the main attractions (e.g. Blue Mosque, H.Sophia, etc), yet it is located on a quiet street far away from all the manic traffic STAFF - Very helpful and with a smile on their face. Feel free to chat and they love to learn about your culture and language (ours being English) ROOM - Don't expect ultra large room as we are talking about European standard here! Having said that, it is adequate and roomy, and we feel right at home once entered. A few more English TV channels would have been a plus BREAKFAST - A real stand out (by European standard) - Not only are the choices ample, but the view from the terrace is simply stunning. Have I mentioned that it's FREE? CLEANLINESS - Spot on. Not a drop of dust and the cleaning lady insisted on cleaning our room on daily basis

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to be based for Istanbul! Great Service”
Reviews.Author: casinitaly
Reviews.Content: We began and ended our holiday in Turkey at the Dersaadet. In total we spent 5 nights there. As we had 3 nights booked for our first stay we were picked up at the airport, no charge. They organized our return transport to the airport at a very reasonable fee - likewise for our return we did not pay much for pick up and return to the airport. The rooms are spotless - clean, pretty and pleasantly decorated. We had rooms 503 and 501. On our arrival the second time (room 503) we noticed an unpleasant smell in the bathroom. I reported this to the staff and I don't know what they did, but it was very quickly taken care of and we were perfectly content. The beds were very firm, extra blankets available if needed, a safe in the room, great views of the Marmara Sea. The staff could not possibly have been friendlier or kinder. We felt like they really were interested in making sure we enjoyed ourselves. Our friends left at 5am on their last day and the staff offered them a cup of tea while they waited for the driver! The views from the terrace were lovely - especially the Blue Mosque in the evening. Breakfasts were tasty with a bit of variety every morning - and home made pastries every day. The coffee was good too (and we live in Italy so our standards are pretty high!) We had tea or coffee every day after sight seeing and before dinner, and it was lovely to relax on the terrace, either inside or outside. There is also free internet which was nice to have, and there were tables and chairs for socializing. The location is fantastic - a five minute walk to the hippodrome and the Blue Mosque, 15 mintues to the tram, close to restaurants and ATMs. I would go back to the Dersaadet at the drop of a hat!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect spot to discover Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: maociu
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Dersaadet and enjoyed every moment of our stay. The location is great, right in the middle of Sultanahmet, perfect to visit all the attractions of the old city. The same atmosphere permeates the hotel lobby and the rooms. After the first night, we were upgraded to a bigger room: the first one was cosy, the second was spacious. Both rooms were clean and snug. As reported by other travellers the highlight of the hotel is the rooftop where breakfast is served. But what we liked best was the muezzin prayer early in the morning from a very close minaret, which added even more atmosphere to our stay. We will definitely stay again at the Dersaadet every time we come to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Helped make Istanbul a Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkNYTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Dersaadet Hotel helps make any trip to Istanbul amazing. They went above and beyond to make sure that we felt comfortable and gave us plenty of suggestions for great dinner places and hot spots. The hotel itself has a great roof deck for breakfast or just for an afternoon Turkish coffee. I would recommend this hotel to any traveler... family, couple, or singles.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, well located small hotel with excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller37
Reviews.Content: The Dersadeet is well located for all of the major attractions of the old city of Sultanahmet while in a quieter spot than some of the other area hotels. We booked a corner room which was comfortable and of ample size for our 3 night stay. The room was clean and the bathroom was of a good size and modern. The rooftop breakfast area and lounge offer fabulous views of the Blue Mosque on one side and the Sea of Marmara on the other. Availability of a computer with free internet in the lobby is a plus. Above all, the staff, especially manager, Umit , are excellent and professional. The staff was always available to answer questions, resolve any issues promptly and provide excellent recommendations as to restaurants and activities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in the Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Big_Al_215
Reviews.Content: We had the privilege of staying in the Sultan Penthouse Suite for 3 nights in August. The suite itself is fit for a sultan and just one short flight up is the terrace cafe where we had breakfast each morning and late evening drinks every night. Both the hotel suite and the terrace cafe overlook the Marmara Sea and the terrace cafe also has a view of the Blue Mosque. Within walking distance of all of the major sights, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Hippodrome, Grand Bazaar, this hotel is the ultimate in an intimate hotel in Istanbul with the most perfect service imagineable. Also, wonderful restaurants and cafes are within a few short blocks.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: addictedtotravel80
Reviews.Content: We had really a great time, service, cleanliness were outstanding. My wife and two children aged 9 and 11 loved it very much. The only recommendation to hotel staff to use blackout blinds. Mr. Umit Ciftci who is the front office manger was very helpful in providing excellent tips and welling to help at any time. Overall this was a wonderful experience and I will definitely come back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Ecellent hotel..great service!”
Reviews.Author: ArchanaDubai
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend Hotel Dersaadet in Istanbul.The hotel rooms were not too big but very clean and tidy .Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.We were travelling with our 2 and half year old son and they went out of their way to help us.The hotel has a great location too..loads of shopping nearby..turkish spa...and also a supermarket down theroad.This hotel is great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “quiet hotel- great location”
Reviews.Author: whateverChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: Room clean and comfortable; delightful rooftop terrace with great breakfast and views of the city and sea. Ask for a room with a sea view. Close to all the historical sites. My daughter checked in early without difficulty; they arranged airport pick-up for me. We enjoyed our stay- and I would stay here again if I wanted to stay in the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: patsy013
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul. The Dersaadet was such a good value. It was clean, personnel and staff were extremely helpful, breakfast was very satisfying and the view on the rooftop for breakfast and end of the day were perfect. It is very convenient and a short walking distance to all the sites and restaurants. The street was quiet and the view of the Bosphorous was excellent. Rooms are rather small but that is typical of European boutique hotels. The only time we spent in the room was to fall asleep. We liked the Dersaadet so much that on our way back home we stayed another night since we were flying out of Istanbul. If we ever returned, we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: akt30
Reviews.Content: In the interest of full disclosure, I will say that this is the one and only hotel that we've ever stayed at in Istanbul. That being said, I'm not sure what else I could've asked for? The room was spotless (including the bathroom which is always most important) and was cleaned well on a daily basis. Some people might find the rooms to be a bit small, but this appears to be par for the course in almost all of the other hotels that we looked into in this area. The location is very quiet and right in the heart of old city with a four minute walk to the Arasta Bazaar (Which is not nearly as overwhelming as the Grand Bazaar), The Blue Mosque, and the Hagia Sophia. The service was fantastic. The hotel manager (Umit Ciftci) could not have been more helpful to us. His English is very good and his recommendations for sights and attractions all turned out to be spot on. The poor guy was working 12 hour shifts while we were there, but he never let it affect his mood, which was always pleasant. The breakfast buffet in the morning wasn't fancy, but it was sufficient, and the staff was very helpful and attentive. The view from the rooftop area was beautiful. One side gave you a view of the water, while the other side showed you the Blue Mosque. Antonio & Jennifer Thomas Maplewood, New Jersey USA

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, hotel, location, bfast and strongly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: MDN53
Reviews.Content: All of the hotel staff are extremely kind, helpful and very pleasant to talk to, especially Sunay Yilmaz who gave us a very warm welcoming introduction to Istanbul on our first night, and who continued to provide us with wonderful help and assistance with car, restaurant reservations and suggestions during our stay. The hotel staff and the vibrant city made our stay in Istanbul very memorable. The hotel owner was at the hotel everyday, and gave us very good sightseeing suggestions. We have told our friends in Seattle about the hotel and wonderful city, and everybody is anxious to travel to Istanbul and they know where to book their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming well-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: NJLisa
Reviews.Content: Dersaadet Hotel is a gem in the heart of Sultanahmet. The included breakfast on a roof garden overlooks the Bosphorous, the Blue Mosque minarets and baby gulls nesting on the red-tiled rooftops. The breakfast offering is ample with real scrambled eggs and good coffee. You'll return to that garden cafe for apple tea or a raki after a day of touring. The personnel at the front desk are very accommodating and helpful. It is a short walk to Istanbul's major attractions and the nearby Sultanahmet tram takes you all over the city for 1.4 TL each way. The standard rooms are small but large for an Ottoman house and the bathrooms with shower are modern. It has an elevator and free use of the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: simon53
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for four nights at the Dersaadet Hotel which we had chsen from reviews on this site. The location is perfect - a 5 minute walk from the Blue Mosque and a couple more minutes to the Aghia Sophia and Basilica. The reception area is beautiful, the breakfasts excellent [fresh strawberries and yoghurt] and the rooms are clean [ours had a view of the Bosphorus]. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful [especially Mehmet]. We spent each evening sat on the roof terrace with a view of the Blue Mosque, illuminated at night and the boats on the Bosphorus. Thoroughly recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Classy, comfortable, and very service oriented”
Reviews.Author: ncejm
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful 5 days in Istanbul at the Dersaadet Hotel. It was convenient for walking to the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sofia, and a tram stop, yet a few blocks away so that the street was not filled with tourists. There were several convenient restaurants nearby which had only one drawback, no fish, as my husband is a quasi-vegetarian, i.e. eats fish. Focusing on the hotel, it was exceptionally pleasant. Breakfast was served on the rooftop and was a sumptuous spread, the usual tomatoes and cucumbers but with 3 or 4 cheeses to choose from. They also served scrambled eggs, "hot dogs" and biscuit, potatoes, a fruit salad, fresh strawberries, watermelon, and several types of jam. There was bread for toast, as well as sweet breads. At night, the rooftop offered (for a fee) drinks (alcohol) and/or tea and coffee, again with classical music. You could see the Blue Mosque from one side of the rooftop. On the other side was the sea. Our room was a reasonable size, we could move in it, open suitcases, and had a chair and desk. There was always plenty of hot water for showers. We also had what was called a semi-sea view room which was a better sea view than the room we had the first night. The first night only a sea view room was available. We were in room 403. A new hotel is going up next door, but I don't think it will block the sea view we had. The room had two windows which you could open. And for those who want to always stay connected, there is a free internet notebook in the lobby, and if you are carrying your laptop, easy wi-fi access from your room or rooftop. Overall a great hotel with a staff ever willing to answer questions, call a taxi, advise over restaurants. I really can't think of any thing I would want to complain about. It could be a little cheaper, but it was comparable in price to Empress Zoe and other hotels I read about. Oh! It had one great advantage that often goes unnoticed, it had a lift!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: ozteach
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wonderful place to stay at while you're in Istanbul. It's only a five minutes walk from the Blue Mosque. Once you enter the hotel you feel like staying in an Ottoman palace, wonderful colour combinations and nice old furniture. But the best thing about this hotel is the wonderful staff. We have never met such friendly staff anywhere else before. Next time we will definitely stay at Dersaadet again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: NCVSanDiego
Reviews.Content: The staff is very helpful and welcoming, the hotel is clean and well appointed, good value and centrally located. We would recommend the Dersaadet to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best stay in Istanbul....”
Reviews.Author: ShirvanShah
Reviews.Content: This was my 6th trip to Istanbul which I had been looking forward to. Hotel itself offers a great location and features nice rooms, while single rooms are just tiny. I had my USD1000 stolen from my room and the hotel management did nothing to assist me. They claimed that surveillance camera's hard disk was full and eventually did not record anything. I understand I should have kept my money locked in the safe but where is the security? Anyway, I still enjoyed Istanbul and look forward to going back there agian.

Reviews.Title: “Dersaadet Hotel was the most perfect place to stay in Istanbul, in every respect.”
Reviews.Author: JoanBerg
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Istanbul with my 85 year old mother and my daughter and our stay in Istanbul was a fabulous experience. The city is beautiful and fascinating and the Dersaadet Hotel made our experience completely positive. The manager Umit made every effort to meet our needs and provided the hotel car for short distances, when available, for my mother. The rooms are clean, the daily maid service was impecable, the breakfast on the roof top terrace was full of healthy choices, and all of the staff were kind and considerate. The location of the hotel is perfect, a short distance to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia. In the late afternoon, while sipping on a glass of wine, the view of the Bosphoros and Blue Mosque from the roof top terrace was breathtaking. I did alot of research for this trip as it was a special time for my mother and I choose the Dersaadet Hotel over all the others I researched and my choice was perfect. If you are looking for an intimate experience in the old section of Istanbul, then I highly recommed the Dersaadet Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Dersaadet - a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: MedusaS_England
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our daughter on a week's stay in this very friendly and professionally run family hotel. We really like small, independent hotels and that is exactly what we got! The staff couldn't have been nicer and Umit at the front desk bent over backwards to recommend restaurants and tourist sites, which all lived up to his promises...and beyond! We had the corner suite for the three of us and there was plenty of room to be comfortable. Everything else has been said in previous reviews, so I won't repeat it, but must stress that our fantastic week in Istanbul was made all the more memorable for the care and attention (always with a smile) we received at The Dersaadet.

Reviews.Title: “Great locatoin - excellent service. Worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: vansa
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Derssadet for 6 nights in May, and have only positive things to say about this place. They picked us up at the airport, (complimentary when booking 3 nights and more), which was a perfect way to start our holiday. The food (breakfast) was nice - really lovely to enjoy it at the roofdeck... We switched rooms halfway - one was a suite and the other a standard double, they were both great - but would recommend the suite for friends because of the space and the standard would suit a couple more. All the attractions of the old city - Sultanahmet, is in walking distanse, and the first ting you se when you enter the roofterrace in the mornings is the Blue Mosque. So it is perfect located. You'll just love it! The service was excellent as well. All the staff were pleasant and helpful. I can absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Neighorhood Boutique Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Soigneez
Reviews.Content: Our room overlooked the Sea of Mamara. The hotel is located in an Istanbul neighborhood with children playing in the street and a mini-mart across the street. The free breakfast served on the indoor/outdoor rooftop terrace included an omlette, various cold cereals, diced fruits and a clear view of the Blue Mosque. The service was fantastic. Umit and Sonny provided great suggestions for dining in the Sultanahmet district. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: billyin
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in this small, unique, and extremly helpful hotel. The rooftop terrace lounge/breakfast nook will be one of my favorite memories of Istanbul. The hotel is well placed in a secluded block in the overly busy Sultanahmet area. we can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Fabulous Staff, Charming Details”
Reviews.Author: LKtravels
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at the Dersaadet. Our experience was wonderful on all dimensions. The rooms are cozy, clean and charming. The staff is friendly, welcoming, and extremely helpful. The rooftop terrace is a delightful respite from the hustle of the city. The location in the old city can't be beat. A five minute walk from the Blue Mosque and Hippodrome. All in all a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Travellerlass
Reviews.Content: We stayed the week before the Easter break during Obama's visit. Initially we couldn't locate the hotel from the tram as you have to walk pass the Blue Mosque and down the hill, then a side street leading to Dersaadet. The walk from Sultanhamet tram line to the hotel is about 5 mins. The hotel looks exactly as the website so you can't miss it and we stayed in room 503 on the 3rd floor which overlooked the sea which was really nice although there were building works opposite the hotel so not sure if that block the view. The staff at the front desk were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel had an internet for all the guest to use free of charge (located by the front desk). The standard double rooms are on a bit of a cozy size but it was clean although we had problems with water leaking through the base of the shower base but it was cleared up every day. The breakfast on the terrace was a pleasant surprise as there is a beautiful view of the Blue Mosque and the sea so we managed to sit outside for breakfast (unfortunately, we had wet weather during our stay so on our last day, we managed to take advantage of the outside terrace). If you're not used to the Muslim calls for prayer...the first call takes place at 5.30am and there is a tower just outside opposite our room! To note, we paid cash on check out and the hotel gave us 10% discount. Upon arrival before customs, you get your visa and beware you may expect a long queue. I would recommend taking public transport when you arrive from Istanbul International airport because it was so efficent and it cost 1.40 TL for each jeton (token). As mentioned in the travel tips on Istanbul, you'd need to buy 2 jetons to get to the historical area. You can purchase these when you board the Light Railway at the airport which is sign posted and downstairs from the arrival lounge. The Light Railway journey takes about 10 mins then you have to change to get on to the Tram and to get to Sultanhamet stop, it takes approx 25 mins. We managed to get a seat from start to finish.
