I wouldn't say Istanbul is cheap destination as on the first night, we were recommended by the hotel to eat at Almerida restaurant which turns out to be favoured by tourists as there were no locals eating there at all (which was quite funny!) and as for the price - it worked out around 40 TL per head without alcohol. After that experience we tried the local food as much as we could. The seafood was fantastic and fresh. If you aim towards the ferry pier which is about 15 mins walk from Sultanhamet then you would be able to find more seafood or cheaper restaurants along the way...just follow the tram line (downhill) to the last stop...you can't miss the ferry pier. If you're game, try the fish bread sandwich which is freshly grilled mackeral with lettuce and onions in a bagette - you can try this by the ferry pier where you see floating boats grilling the fish and the locals sitting and eating by it (costs 4 TL). The Spice market is by the ferry pier and great for getting your turkish delight (facing the front main entrance of the spice bazaar and on the right hand side you will see stalls selling fish, cheese, etc, walk up and you will see an entrance on the left hand side going into the bazaar, enter, and you will see a turkish delight stall on the corner which also sells tea) for 6 TL for half a kilo box - you can also sample before trying! Along Galata Bridge, you will see locals fishing and underneath the bridge there are a number of restaurants and cafes. To get to Taksim, we took the funicular (1.40 TL) up to the bottom of the bridge to the bottom of Taksim Square and walked up - the shops and cafes are similar to those you find in any big cities and prices to match e.g., a cake and coffee came to 10 TL. There are Starbucks and MacDonalds if you get bored of eating kebabs and fish. Unfortunately some of the mosques were undergoing renovation e.g., Hagia Sophia (20 TL entrance fee) and the mosques closed on Mondays. In fact, it's more spectacular at night when the mosques are lit up. Walk along the back route of the Spice Bazaar to the Grand Bazaar as you won't get hassled by the touristy shops in fact it was a really nice walk to mingle with the locals on their daily routine.

Reviews.Title: “excellent position for main attractions in "old city", quite exceptional friendly staff and impartial advice.”
Reviews.Author: kerryLancashire
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the sultan's suite. very spacious. some of other rooms are less big and may have only partial views of the sea of marmaris. check with desk staff before booking. Umit, front office manager, was very honest and can be trusted. the complimentery pick-up service from airport went like clockwork. we used same service to return to airport, Â£14 only. the hotel is only 10 mins walk from the Blue mosque and other sites.as well as the main tram stop. brand new trams and incredibly inexpensive. Staff's knowledge of evening resteraunts was accurate and impartial. most comfortabe room with endless hot water for bath or shower to ease aching feet!! john sayer aged 70

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: pamsrollz
Reviews.Content: We've returned from a 6 night stay at the Dersaadet. Our first night was in the Seaview double, very small, but with a lovely view. We moved to the Corner Suite for the rest of our stay. That was a large room with plenty of windows and a city view. The rooms were immaculate, and well kept. Bedding was very comfortable. The bathroom had a jacuzzi/shower, thyme soap, shampoo, lotions and fluffy robes to use. Towels were changed daily. The water pressure was excellent, with plenty of hot water. Our computer did not like their internet, we had trouble connecting, but there is a modern computer in the lobby that is always available to use at no charge. The staff was fantastic. Umit and the other fellows were always there to help, give advice, make arrangements, and were knowledgeable about hours for sites and getting around. Breakfast is served on the rooftop terrace which has outstanding views over the city and Bosphorus. It is lovely up there, lots of flowers and a place of calm. Choices included fresh fruits, yoghurt, cereals, eggs, olives and dried fruit, many breads, cheese and cold cuts, coffee or tea, and juices. Always fresh and excellent. The location is fantastic. You can walk to a different restaurant every night. We liked Doy Doy and Tamara a block away for lunch. Walk to the end of the Arasta Bazaar and turn right, that is the area loaded with restaurants and night life. We enjoyed Turquoise and Kathisma in particular. You can walk to all of the major tourist sites, which are incredible, of course, otherwise take the modern, clean tram for 1.40 TL to where you want to go. The Bosphorus cruise was lovely, a good day trip on a warm, good weather day. The hotel itself is very quiet, but you will wake up with the call to prayer very early in the morning, just try to fall back asleep. Even with the double glazed windows, the speakers are very loud in old town.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: rbmb
Reviews.Content: Well located in a quiet and safe neighbourhood near the Blue Mosque (10 minute walk). Staff are what made the stay. Always very friendly and helpful, and ready to meet your needs. Rooms were comfortable and adequate, but nothing special. The lobby was comfortable. Breakfast was on the rooftop with a wonderful view; and a nice place for a drink in the evening. The tram is about a 10/15 minute walk away, and so the hotel is conviently located. Definitely would recommend this hotel, however there appeared to be similar ones ("special" hotels in traditional Ottoman style buildings with antique furnishings) nearby that are possibly just as good. Note: avoid the Grand Bazaar if you plan to buy something. Asking prices are 4x higher than asking prices elsewhere! Note: The Bosphorus ferry (local) is well worth the journey on a nice day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay - Yet Again !!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Littledave1972
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my Mum and I have stayed, and we will be back. As ever the staff were top class, and couldn't do enough for us - special thanks go again to Umit ! The hotel itself is well situated, a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque, and everything else is a short walking distance, whether you want the Bazaars or the Bosphorus. It is very clean - towel & bedding changes, & cleaning of the rooms are done daily. Breakfast is served inside or out, on the roof terrace, and has an excellent selection of fresh produce. We took advantage of the complimentary airport transfers too, of which again the service was excellent. I wouldn't stay anywhere else now !!!!!! - Highly Recommended

Reviews.Title: “A lovely small hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sarabeth721
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay. The staff is exceptional. My husband learned some Turkish before our trip and the staff was very helpful; giving him suggestions to help his Turkish. We were always offered apple tea in the evening (at no charge) and there is a computer for guest use. The staff also offered hints and places to make our stay even better. The room, albeit small, was very clean and the view was fantastic, as you can see in my pictures. The shower is small, but it worked very well. We had the use of robes and got to keep the slippers!! We really liked the location; close to the sites, but just far enough away for a nice walk as well as being away from other major hotels. One evening we stumbled upon the Four Seasons and Empress Zoe, where we wanted to originally stay. When we saw the location, we were very happy we had chosen the Dersaadt. The breakfast was wonderful. The most delicious eggs we have ever had, homemade breads and pastry, rose preserves (my favorite), juice, coffee, fresh fruit, cheese, a perfect start to the day. Eating on the patio with a view of the Blue Mosque was fantastic. We would definitely stay there again. Sorry, most of my pictures were too big of a file to upload.

Reviews.Title: “Baffled by all the positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: familyof5Austin
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and 3 teenagers spent a total of 6 nights in March in Istanbul -- 3 at the Empress Zoe (based on recommendation of travel agent) and 3 at Hotel Dersaadet (based on TripAdvisor reviews). I am completely baffled by the glowing reviews of other travelers. While we loved Istanbul, we found the Dersaadet lacking. (For the same price, the Empress Zoe was far superior.) The deluxe corner suites were booked so we had a standard double and a triple on the 3rd floor. The cons: entire hotel was very hot and stuffy (cold outside); although technically a non-smoking hotel, the smell of cigarette smoke wafted through our vents; the bathroom was tiny and smelled of sewer gas; the shower was even tinier and the door fell off (I'm not tall and couldn't bend over; my husband said that he felt like he was trapped in a jar); TV didn't work (staff immediately replaced it with a different one that worked, but was equally old and small); dated furnishings (neither new nor quaint near-antique); thin walls so noise from hallway and neighbors; very loud construction noise right outside our window every night (not the hotel's fault, but do you really want to stay next to a construction site?). The pros: very nice staff -- we didn't ask for much, but I feel certain that we would have gotten it had we asked; good breakfasts; convenient location; WiFi connection in the rooms. Unfortunately, the good staff and service can't compensate for the sub-standard accomodations so, for the same amount of money, I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Taxpeggy1
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at this hotel - we are four lively senior citizens - and loved every minute of it -- from the easy walk to restaurants, the Arasta Bazaar, the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia, and to the tram. The staff went out of their way to detail directions, make dinner reservations, and suggest sights. There is a little laundry next door and a mini-market across the street where one could buy water, wine, and snacks. The rooms were comfortable and quiet and the breakfast was very adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay at Dersaadet”
Reviews.Author: annie_malone
Reviews.Content: My son and I traveled to Istanbul for his 16th birthday and chose Dersaadet after a lot of thought. We loved it there -- our week in Istanbul (and at Dersaadet) passed way too fast and we were sorry to say goodbye. Best thing -- the fantastic staff, especially Umit the manager and Umit who keeps the upstairs terrace running so pleasantly in the mornings. The staff surprised us with a lovely fruit basket on my son's actual birthday -- just very thoughtful and touching. We had a fairly modest room, but with a lovely sea view, and in every way fantastic location. It's easily walkable to everywhere in the old part of the city, but it's also in a real living neighborhood just far enough from the most touristed areas. Lots of kids and lots of cats! We were repeat visitors to a family-run restaurant called -- Family Cafe and Restaurant -- our favorite, just wonderful. It's on Akbiyik Caddesi, very close to Dersaadet. (On the other hand we had a really awful encounter at a restaurant called Valentino, in the Kumkapi District -- on principle, I only relate good experiences, but based on what happened to us there, I hope other visitors might avoid it.) We are so grateful to the gracious and welcoming people of Istanbul who helped to make our first visit there so memorable. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “When in Istanbul - Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: a_citizen_of_earth
Reviews.Content: Extremely clean, comfortable and quiet hotel complete with amenities and breakfast served daily at hotels roof terrace cafe (which offers excellent views of Istanbul attractions). Staff are highly personable, courteous and always ready to offer assistance. Central location, minutes walk to Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistren, Grand Bazaar and all other major attractions in Sultanhamet and around. Short tram ride to other central districts Beyoglu, Bazaar District etc Really proved to be a "second home" as the concierge promised upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Atmosphere and Kind Staff”
Reviews.Author: dramateach
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the street-level double (can also be a triple), and I thought it was great. Prior to arriving, I was worried that the room would be noisier or less safe than a room above ground level, but the room was surprisingly quiet and secure. The location was great. I would suggest taking the free shuttle from the airport to the hotel on arrival. Once you get to the hotel, it is easy to launch out on your own. Two great restaurants just one block away, five minutes to the Hippodrome and ten minutes to an amazing hammam. The staff--front desk, cafe and cleaning--were all friendly and professional. Two thumbs way up!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great room, great staff”
Reviews.Author: eurotraveller85
Reviews.Content: We weren't initially planning on staying here but for one reason or another we ended up in the Dersaadet. We didn't pay full price (we had originally booked hotel Niles but it was closed due to nearby construction), so it was very good value. Staff were very obliging, extremely helpful, generous and professional. They were also really friendly - like most people we encountered in Turkey. There is free wifi, big comfortable beds, comfortable and stylish furnishings (if you like ottoman antique bling) very clean (excellent daily housekeeping) and magnificent views from the terrace. Really can't fault this place. There were families and couples of all ages staying here and all seemed to be very pleased. Incidentally we are a couple of two guys - shock horror - but they didn't bat an eyelid at this.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight!”
Reviews.Author: chowbeller
Reviews.Content: If you want The Four Seasons then don't stay here.If you want utter charm,a wonderful staff,and the perfect location then you won't be disappointed with this sweet hotel.The rooms are tiny but cozy,the beds are firm and comfortable and everything is impeccably clean.Walking toward the Derssadet at the end of the day is like going home.Someone is ALWAYS at the front desk during every hour of the day to greet you with a smile and a warm welcome...ESPECIALLY Umit and Suney!!!For first-timers in a predominantly Muslim country you will be taken aback by the volumn(I mean decibels NOT quantity) of the first call-to-prayer you hear booming right into your bedroom window.If you are bothered by this then just close your windows which are very soundproofed.I came to LOVE hearing this melancholy chanting/singing even at 6AM...it reminded my that I was really in an ancient crossroads of rich civilizations.If you are back at the Dersaadet in the early evenings you will also hear the sounds of children playing and laughing before being called in to dinner.This is because The Dersaadet is off the main commercial drag in a lovely residential area within a three minutes walk to EVERYTHING.Cats are everywhere around the area and they are lovingly fed by all of the neighbors.Every night we drifted to sleep with a virtual kitty soap opera playing in the background...kitty fights,kitty love-making,all kinds of kitty sounds.We loved every minute of our six night stay at this little hotel full of life and personality.I must not forget to mention that breakfast is served on the rooftop and the views from this vantage are just wonderful.We found ourselves lingering there way too long and always getting a later start to the day than we'd anticipated....but then,isn't this what traveling is all about...the journey rather than the destination?If this is not your philosophy then stick to The Four Seasons which is just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “This is the one”
Reviews.Author: PJ2009
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the historic heart of Istanbul, open you windows to Sea of Mamara, hear the call to prayer from the Blue Mosque and enjoy the welcoming atmosphere of a boutique hotel, then Hotel Dersaadet is the one. Umit and his professional team provide excellent service. Great care is taken in the cleaning and tidying of rooms, the breakfast is varied and delicious (we loved the scrambled eggs, sour cherry juice and jars of jams) and the people at the front desk showed genuine interest in our daily activities in Istanbul. Best of all, they were always helpful and often guided us to special places we might otherwise never have seen. We were charmed by The Hotel Dersaadet experience and it made our stay in Istanbul very special.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blurphantic
Reviews.Content: I broke this review up into sections, so you can skip past what you don't care about...although I think the location section is important. Why we booked: We booked this hotel having read many great review on Trip Advisor. The price of the room, 100 Euros / Night seemed reasonable to split among 3 people. As an added bonus the free pick-up from the airport was a nice touch. Airport Pick Up: The arrival into Istanbul was painless, the driver (very friendly, I might add) was waiting for us with a sign as we exited the customs entrance. A very pleasant welcome after a long flight. The ride to the hotel took all of 30 minutes. It's just a quick zip on a coastal highway. Hotel Location: Location is in the heart of the tourist district, Sultanhamete. The neighborhood is very residential and super super quiet. If you're looking to be in the heart of the action I do not recommend this location. Also the downside of this neighborhood is it's very geared towards tourists and everything is overpriced. Food isn't that great, shops are targeted to tourists, nightlife is a 30 minute ride on rail, or a 15 - 20 Lira Taxi ride. If it's tourist sight by day, and action by night, I DO NOT recommend this hotel. You're better off finding a hotel in Taksim Square area also know as Begoylu. Tons of bars, great restaurants, shopping, public transit, full of natives, and very vibrant. Hotel Room / Facilities : The room -- Yes, I'm American, and we are used to everything being big, but I've also traveled a lot and for three people staying in the room it was a bit cramped. The room itself and the bed were decent. Old-fashioned,traditional decor. Everything was spotlessly clean. Lets just call it very cozy. View was basically non-existent, tiny window looking down on to the street. Also, free wifi, always a plus! The rest -- The top floor breakfast area is really nice. Like all hotels in the area you have a view looking onto the sea, and the surroundings. Food was delicious for being a free breakfast. The waiter was very friendly and helpful in every way possible. Downside is it closes at 10:30 pm, so forgot going up for a smoke or having a little romantic private time. Staff is very helpful, courteous, what one should generally expect. They have a laptop on the bottom floor if you didn't bring your computer. Overall, it's about average for what you should expect from a hotel. Pluses: -Staff, cozy, close to the super touristy spots. Great if you're just spending a weekend. Quiet if you like quiet. Clean. Friendly. Minuses: Location, location, location. Taxis never are able to find the place. You're not in the heart of the action. Yes, you're close to the Blue Mosque and tourist spots but. If you're in Taksim Square, it's just a train ride over to tourist central for the day, and you're back in the action at night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ks122
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend in Istanbul and were extremely impressed with Dersaadet HotelÂ´s levels of quality and service. A driver picked us up from the airport, free of charge, eliminating the hassle of navigating a foreign transit system or paying for a taxi. The hotel staff was welcoming and accommodating, and gave us a personalized introduction to the city, covering the main tourist attractions and other places of interest. We interacted with about four or five front desk attendants, and all of them were very knowledgable about the city. Umit was especially helpful and friendly. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated, and the continental breakfast had a wide variety of breads, fruit, juices, meats, and eggs. The breakfast room doubles as a cafe/bar and offers beautiful views of the water and the Blue Mosque. The hotel is perfectly situated within the city. We were able to walk to all of the main sights without problems. Overall, a wonderful holiday and an extremely enjoyable hotel stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: hsbrz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Dersaadet this month of January and had a pleasant experience. The hotel is located next to many touristic sites, the apartments are comfortable and the service is excellent. All the services are provided by nice and very informed persons and we used the hotel's transfer in and out that were offered to us. Thanks a lot !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Dersaadet”
Reviews.Author: Gpd_9
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location! Step out on to the roof terrace and look at the imposing turrets of the Blue Mosque, turn around and watch boats sail across the Sea of Marmara. This small hotel is friendly, welcoming and comfortable. The breakfast is great and you can pop up to the roof terrace in the evening for a drink and a light snack. You are right in the heart of the Sultanahmet district and near lots of great cafes and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place like home when you travel”
Reviews.Author: MayafromChina
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place for us during our staying in Istanbul. Not to mention the well located neighborhood to reach out so many spectacular relics, the hospitality and kindness of the staff in the hotel warmed our hearts in the days of unforecastable cold weather. We have travelled through SEA countries, but the stay in Desaadet made us feel more like home. The hotel is well decorated in Turkish style, and the room is always clean and neat. Every morning, you can see the MARMARA sea while having your breakfast. That will always be the picture in my memory.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service/ location”
Reviews.Author: phillipegarcia
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect stay.This place is great.The location is perfect,just a few meters from Sultanahmet Square.. Very near to the (must see sights like Saint Sofia or Agia Sofia ,Top Kapi,and the Hippodrome).The service was perfect, the room was great, big emough - though not huge, and overall it was a great experience.The staff is friendly, pleasant, and accommodating. The hotel is always spotless.Breakfast on the top floor was delicious. The people who work at the front desk are professional, yet not stuffy, and are constantly trying to do things to make your stay more pleasant,and they would say hello each time we walked by.. We would have no hesitation returning to Dersaadet or recommending to others.

Reviews.Title: “This was a fantastic place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: JaneMolloy
Reviews.Content: The hotel, location and staff, especially Umit and the evening staff were some of the most accomodating I have ever experienced. These caring folks go the extra mile for everything, making you really feel as though you are at home. My husband and I wanted for nothing here. As fine as some of the 5 star hotels all over the world for staff attention.

Reviews.Title: “A little over-rated”
Reviews.Author: ascalapius
Reviews.Content: The wife and me stayed at dersaadat for 5 days in december (room 402). We have travelled a lot and stayed in quite a few hotels but it is our first time in Istanbul. Backpacing is not an option (says the wife)so most of the hotels have been 3-4 stars.The thing about hotels is,there are two ways they dissappoint. The first, when the service is poor, the place unsanitary and amenities and location are lousy. The second is when the the clients expectations are not matched The latter is not always the hotels fault. It can do the best job within its parameters but still not satisfy. The dersaadat falls in the second category. ITs not a bad hotel but tripadvisor raises the bar significantly in terms of expectations. Also it is my first time in turkey and this is the only hotel i stayed in so i dont know what the others are like. Please bear that in mind when reading this review. The hotel's plus points - Pick up from the airport was punctual and spot on, check in was quick and hassle free, staff was polite, courteous and friendly (service with a smile), breakfast (i am a HUGE breakfast man) was brilliant(meat, eggs, homemade jams, cereals etc) and the terrace breakfast venue is a delight. The blue mosque and the sea of marmara greet you in the morning at breakfast. Location was perfect. Free internet from a computer in the lobby( no wifi) but are you really going to be surfing the net in a city like istanbul?! Room cleaning was done promptly. The hotel was an old mansion at one time so it could be called old or vintage (depending on perspective). Some might like it for that and some might not.We thought 'charecter' The negative points - the room was a bit small,my room had wallpaper peeling,the A/c blower was NOISY.We turned it off and had to open the windows (it was not that cold in turkey, by our standards) only to let in the noises of the street. We did bring it to the attention of the recepetion but not much was (or maybe could be) done. BUT the worst thing was the BED. Very uncomfortable. WE could feel our backs complain in the morning for the 5 days we were there. TV lacks any REAL channels for the non-turkish speaker( but again its istanbul!) In summary, i would not stay here if it was summer (A/c issues) and the bed was the same (at that price) but other wise we thought it was good. We grade it B+

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisJ35
Reviews.Content: The Dersaadet is an excellent hotel which provides a great (and peaceful) refuge from the hectic Old Town. The service was exemplary and staff were always willing to go that extra mile. The breakfast was very pleasant and the room and other facilities were of a very good standard.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly staff, goes out of the way to get things done for you.Gr8 Ambience”
Reviews.Author: bindhyasudhir
Reviews.Content: we have never experienced such incredible service before.my son is 15 months old, we had many things to keep in mind. we needed hot water, hot milk, needed a baby sitter at times, let me let u the management and the staff was brillant . they cattered to our each request made by us.baby sitter was very friendly took care of the baby well.we absolutely cherished the Turkish delight (Bhaklava) which was kept for the hotel guests at the lobby.Its a boutique hotel with 16 rooms,We stayed in room 503 , 3rd floor. We had bought a ceramic plateSouveniour, the hotel manager Mr, Umit helped us wraping it , with bubble paper and cardboard box, thanks to him it reached in one piece.we wanted to eat fish in a good resturant, he literally took us to the place where u get good food.absolutely wounderful ppl. Gr8 Experience. In case u want to book directly this is his mail id onburo@hoteldersaadet.com

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Inn in Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: patrickfoster18
Reviews.Content: Dersaadet Oteli is a small inn located in the shadow of the Blue Mosque in Sultanahmet. The inn is a restored 19th century Ottoman wooden house and has a beautiful decor and a cozy ambiance about it that makes it a welcome place to come back to after a day of sightseeing. The inn is about a 5 minute walk from the Blue Mosque but is also located on a quiet little side street unlike most of the hotels in Sultanahmet which are located in clustered tourist areas. There are a few restaurants and local markets with reasonable prices within blocks of the inn. We had only booked for two nights but ended up extending our stay two nights more because we were so happy with the accommodations. The first two nights we were in a sea view double and the second two nights we were in a standard double. The rooms are definitely on the small side, but in a cozy way, and also are very clean and have all the amenities one would need. The sea view is not worth the extra money so I would recommend just getting the standard double (though it is street level and much noisier). You can get plenty of the sea view at the free breakfast on the beautiful rooftop terrace. The aspect that puts the Dersaadet over the top is the service. The front desk was extremely helpful and kind under all circumstances including booking us at their sister hotel, Hotel Niles, for a fifth night (we tried to extend again but they were full) and transporting us there for free. Also because we ended up staying more than three nights we became eligible for a free transfer to the airport and the staff at both hotels made it a point that we got that free transfer. I would not hesitate to stay here again if traveling to Istanbul. You can read more about out visit to Istanbul on our travel blog- http://patrinadoestheglobe.blogspot.com/

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dersaadet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: savtiLosAngeles_CA
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Istanbul where we stayed for 5 days at a most charming small hotel close to all the important sites. Dersaadet Hotel is a gem!! We stayed in a double, sea view room with a lovely view of the Bosphorous and minarets. The room was somewhat small but adequate with a wonderful bed and luxurious bedding. The bathroom was small, but adequate, with great towels. We were welcomed so warmly and treated so specially by all the staff at the Hotel. Umit at the front desk (and all the other staff) was always willing to suggest places to go and eat, give us transportation directions and offer help in every way. The breakfasts up on the rooftop terrace were delicious, and the view of the Blue Mosque at dusk and at night from up there was breathtaking. We were a group of 5 individuals traveling together (1 single and 2 couples), and we all were thrilled with the Dersaadet. We hope to return to Istanbul sometime soon and would definitely book the Dersaadet for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Dersaadet - the door to grace and hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: starausa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dersaadet hotel for 9 days in November 2008. At first we were not sure what to expect but went by a dear and widely traveled friend's recommendation but as soon as we checked into this most charming, wonderful hotel, we never looked back. It's a delightfully aesthetic property and just what we were looking for in terms of local or ethnic Turkish flavor as we were a couple of 'been there, done that' weary travellers from New York city. The rooms are simple but tastefully done, we were especially taken up with the motifs that are hand painted on the ceiling of each room. The rooms to go for are the sea facing ones so one can catch beautiful views of the fascinating Sea of Marmara with it's steady stream of graceful ships and boats sailing across. The best feature of the hotel is their rooftop bar/restaurant with it's views of the Blue Mosque (you feel you can almost touch this marvellous edifice , it's so close to the hotel) and the sea all around. Breakfast is served in the mornings here and for the rest of the day guests can use it as a cafe to sit and gaze at the sea and dream, to sketch or read while all the while the most melodious classical music streams in from various European radio stations. We cannot say enough about the hospitality and friendliness of the hotel staff. They are so genuinely helpful and friendly and when they told us to view their hotel as their 'home' in Istanbul, it had a ring of authenticity to it. And finally, if you , like us are looking to be in the ancient and historic part of Istanbul, then this is the place to be as the hotel is located in the Sultanahmet area and you can literally stumble across to the Blue Mosque and all the wonderful historic sights of the city. All in all a great place to stay,

Reviews.Title: “If you want hospitality,charm, character....stay HERE at the Dersaadet!”
Reviews.Author: cseverin821
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed here while touring Istanbul. Nevermind the glitzy 5 star boring decor...here, you have authentic, charming, relaxing atmosphere of true Istanbul. I can't say enough about the staff / management at the Dersaadet Hotel. Upon arriving we were "warmly" welcome and immediately shown to our rooms. The terrance is "breath taking"...having breakfast along the Bosporus was spectacular, and let's not forget the Blue Mosque!! Our friend, Umit was gracious, kind and a pleasure to talk to. Hearing "call to prayer" 5x a day was easy to get used to...you don't hear that in the states! The location was PERFECT! We pretty much walked to the "must see" sights! The Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia ("Ayasofya" in Turkish), the Topkipa Palace, the Hippodrome were just around the corner. Also, the Grand Bazaar and Spice Market was about a 20minute walk...not a problem. Also, getting a Taxi is not a problem to check out other areas! We didn't have time to take the ferry up the Bosporus, sadly. Around the corner from the hotel is a gem of a kebab place called "House of Kebab"...Ahmet, is very pleasant with goes without saying how gracious the staff were to us. The menu is both in Turkish and English...very helpful. Sure there a many other hotels you could choose, but we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Dersaadet deserves its high rating”
Reviews.Author: traveltruffles
Reviews.Content: Dersaadet tries hard to give its guests a great experience and delivers. The hotel is convenient to the major tourist sites. Staff are professional and friendly. Rooms are clean and tastefully decorated, though not large. Breakfast will set you up for the day and the views from the terrace are great. It is a bit pricey at full rack rate but if you can get under $150 or Â£100 p/n it's good value for Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Very Responsive Staff”
Reviews.Author: PortlandPair
Reviews.Content: Our experience at this charming hotel was very positive. We stayed for 4 nights in a corner suite (there were three of us) that was full of charm and spotlessly clean. The complimentary airport pickup was waiting for us when we arrived, and every one of our requests of the staff was responded to promptly. Breakfast on the terrace was delicious, with lovely views. I can't think of anything at all to fault the Dersaadet on. We would definitely stay there again. Umit at the front desk is a real gem - he can help you out with almost anything!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Historic Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Akolea
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at this beautiful and well-staffed Hotel in the old section of Istanbul and agree with all the positive reviews. The hotel is a refurbished Ottoman-style house in a neighborhood at the foot of the Blue Mosque. We had a corner suite (404) with a view to the Marmara Sea and the room was spacious and decorated with an eye on history. The beds were very comfortable after a day of sightseeing and the shower was fantastic. Breakfast on the rooftop terrace overlooking the sea and the Blue Mosque is a great way to start the day with local fresh-baked pastries and breads with rose jam, fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, and yoghurt with honey. We ended every day back on the terrace for wine or tea and watched the ships on their way up the Bosporus. I cannot say enough about the staff â€“ professional and friendly, they were especially helpful with taxis, directions, and restaurant recommendations (donâ€™t miss Asitane). Umit at the front desk and Umit at the Terrace were the two happy faces we saw most days, and Murat and Tayfun were also great assets. We would surely return to this great little hotel because of its accessibility to Bazaars and Mosques. The tram stop is nearby and easy to navigate. Above all, the staff made us feel welcome at every turn.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: hawkeyes
Reviews.Content: If you expect nothing less than a Marriott or a Hilton, don't read this review and don't stay here. The excellent hotel is very conventinely located in old Istanbul, about a five minute walk from the Blue Mosque, ten minutes from the tramline and twenty minutes from the Topkapi Palace. We felt very safe is this area, despite the fact that the area is certainly not posh. The hotel has 17 rooms, a small elevator and a lovely roof garden where breakfast and evening drinks are served. We had a twin room on the 1st floor (one above street level). The room was medium size, the beds were firm and comfortable, decent storage space, A/C, phone and TV. The bathroom was modern (shower only). The room and bathroom were immaculate. The hotel is quiet. You can hear the call the prayer in the morning. It only lasts a few minutes. There are some good restaurants in the area. The staff are extremely good at their jobs. Those serving customers speak excellent English, understand customer service and are knowlegable about things to do and see. For visitors that have trouble walking, the sidewalks in the area are a little uneven and the roads are cobblestone. It is slightly uphill to the city centre. The only criticism that I have is that the breakfast is the same every morning. After 4-5 days, it gets repititious. This is an excellent hotel - central, clean, quiet, with capable staff. Giving it a "five" across the board is a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base For Exploring Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: EldrickWo
Reviews.Content: We are now Ä±n Istanbul aÄ±rport waÄ±tÄ±ng for our flÄ±ght home to sÄ±ngapore. We were Ä±n Ä±stanbul for 5 days and stay at thÄ±s accomodatÄ±on. Overall, rooms are small (sometÄ±mes a bÄ±t noÄ±sy as Ä±nsulatÄ±on Ä±s average) but locatÄ±on Ä±s GREAT. ThÄ±s Ä±s a decent boutÄ±que (small) hotel not desÄ±gn for bÄ±g groups. Good location, easy to move about on your own from hotel. WÄ±thÄ±n 2km walkÄ±ng of all major tourÄ±sts sÄ±tes. Easy access to restaurants, grocery store (opens from 7.30am to 9.30pm) and laundry at 7YTL per kÄ±lo of clothes (opens 8.30am to 8.30pm) Ä±f needed. Must eat at Doy Doy restaurant (decent turkÄ±sh food average prÄ±ce 8 YTL per dÄ±sh) and Ä±f you Ä±ntend to watch the swÄ±rlÄ±ng dance (pls go only Ä±f Ä±ts free admÄ±ssÄ±onÅŸ other than that gÄ±ve that a mÄ±ss as we paÄ±d 30YTL for the 1 hr show whÄ±ch consÄ±sted of 30mÄ±ns of musÄ±c and 20 mÄ±ns of swÄ±rlÄ±ng... thats Ä±t!)

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: channelhopperbobbo
Reviews.Content: I have got nothing but superlatives to offer concerning the Dersaadet hotel and we loved everything about it. The staff were all absolutely charming, our 3rd floor room was very tastefully decorated and had fabulous views over the Sea of Marmara, the bathroom was well specified and the roof terrace was just lovely with views over both the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque. Even the lift in this hotel was a charming if small wooden contraption. The location of the hotel in the heart of old Istanbul meant that most of the major sites were literally on the doorstep but the nearby excellent tramline meant that even sites further afield were easy to get to. We only used taxis to get to and from the airport. All in all a truly delightful "boutique" hotel which we would be very pleased to go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, Helpful People”
Reviews.Author: honest4u
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in Istanbul as part of a 3 week vacation in Turkey. We selected the Dersaadet Hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews, and we were not disappointed. The location is great, just a couple of blocks from the Blue Mosque in the Sultaahmet area. The staff were uniformly helpful and friendly. The hotel is spotless, with a nice lobby area, and a delightful rooftop terrace for breakfast or tea, with a lovely view of the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara. Breakfast was very good, and ample. Our room was the smallest in the hotel, and was very small indeed. However, we had been informed about that when we made our reservation, and hoped to upgrade when we arrived, but the place was full and could not oblige us. All the other advantages of the hotel outweighed this disadvantage for us, so we decided to stay, and were glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “Dersaadet-A Fabulous and Authentically Turkish Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Clockwatch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Dersaadet for five days and did not regret one second of it. The hotel is fantastically located-within walking distance of the great sites of the Old City-yet reasonably priced. We stayed in a Corner Suite and loved it. The room was very spacious and spotless with a fabulous bathroom.The entire staff is absolutely wonderful-courteous, helpful and fluent in English. They all define Turkish hospitality. There is complimentary use of a lobby computer and the staff go out of their way to get you information regarding ferry schedules, touring plans and, of course, dinner reservations. We appreciated the complimentary car service to the hotel-the driver was waiting at the airport with a sign with our name on it-a welcome sight after a long transcontinental flight! One of our daily highlights was the rooftop breakfast-included in the room rate. The view of the sea is spectacular and the terrace has indoor and outdoor options. The breakfast is bountiful and delicious-serving traditional Turkish fare as well as international goodies. You can also just sit up there at other times of the day or have a drink or a tea/coffee. For those people looking for a non cookie-cutter feel (and we have stayed in our fair share of very high-end chain hotels), this small boutique Turkish gem is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Dersaadet Hotel - Wonderful Hotel in the Heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: rfraz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dersaadet Hotel last week (October 7 - 10, 2008) and had a wonderful stay. We booked the standard double room, which was very clean and comfortable - and we even had a view of the Sea of Marmara. The manager and employees were very professional and made sure our stay was comfortable. They were very helpful in terms of mapping out the sites in Instanbul and helping us with local restaurants and cultural events. The hotel is within easy walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, restaurants and public transportation. The roof top breakfast room is awesome and it is open all day for beverages and cocktails! I would absolutely recommend this hotel - hands down!

Reviews.Title: “Superior Service”
Reviews.Author: Nickalex
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at Dersaadet, which entitled us to free pickup when we arrived at IST airport. Front Office Mgr Umit Ciftci couldn't have been nicer and more helpful, giving directions, recommending restaurants, booking tours. There's a laptop in the lobby so guests can use the Internet and check e-mail. We upgraded to a sea view room, which was $156 (115 Euro) in late Sept. We didn't take advantage of the 5% discount for paying cash. A few steps down the street is a laundry. For $8.80, we dropped off a bag of clothes in the morning, picked it up around dinner time. Clothes are dried on a rack on the street, so don't hand over anything you don't want the neighbors to see!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CheltenhamShell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dersaadet Hotel with two friends at the beginning of September. We shared a third floor triple room and had a great stay. The staff were really helpful and extremely polite and made our break even more enjoyable. The hotel's sun terrace was the perfect location for breakfast and a drink after a long day sight-seeing and the view was stunning. The hotel is in a great location for getting around the old city sights. The only drawback we found was that the room's hairdryer was pathetic for 3 girls and a fan could have dried our hair quicker!!! A thoroughably enjoyable experience & I would recommend this little gem to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “First room great, second room awful”
Reviews.Author: suzygd2
Reviews.Content: We read about Dersaadet Hotel here on TA and were impressed by the reviews. When we booked, they put us in 3rd floor room for 4 nights, then to a "larger" room on ground/street without a sea view. The ground floor room was positively described by the Hotel management. Since they have a fantastic roof terrace, I was unconcerned about not having a sea view the last 2 nights. The 3rd floor room was great. Small, but charming, and comfortable. It had a nice sea view. If we had spent the entire time in that room, I would rate the hotel as perfect. Breakfast on the roof terrace was very, very pleasant. Our last 2 nights were to be spent in the "larger" room on the ground floor without a sea view. It was, in fact, a dingy basement triple room, with 2 high windows that would open to the front street. The room smelled awful and moldy. There was black mildew around the a/c vent and on the adjacent ceiling. There had been a big rain the day before...so, I don't know if this was a factor. I couldn't find wet carpet or wall board, but it smelled like wet carpet that had not dried properly. We opened the windows and aired it out. It helped us breath, but the street noise (you were watching people's feet walking 2 feet away & cars going by) was deafening. We could not carry on a conversation with the windows open, let alone sleep. Management told us it was the only room in the house, which I believe. We did spend a couple of hours airing out the room, hoping it would help. Unfortunately, when we closed the windows the moldy stench was overwhelming. We complained and were told that "we knew it was a ground floor room when we booked it. Too, bad." We have stayed in some bad places in our travels around the world, but this is the first time we have ever had to leave a hotel. Our phone did not work in the room, but we finally able to book into the Best Western Presidente. The worst part is we lost a day in Istanbul working this out. Dersaadet Hotel was unhelpful and charged us the cancellation rate, so we paid for one night at the Dersaadet we were not there. The bottom line.....the hotel should not be renting this particular room. It is the only hotel room on the ground (basement) floor. If you can stay above ground, the Dersaadet is fabulous. Love the roof terrace and location. DO NOT let them put you in the "large" ground floor room....it is uninhabitable. I am disappointed Hotel management would not help us move (no working phone) and forced us to pay for the room even tho we couldn't sleep there. Poor public relations in misrepresenting the room as a nice large room, simply without a the sea view. They made me so mad, I could not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Dersaadet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Where_to_next_79
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I stayed at the Dersaadet Hotel at the beginning of September and loved it. This hotel has it all: great views of the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus (amazing to watch the many many ships all queued up, waiting to go to port) from a wonderful rooftop terrace/bar, where we also enjoyed a delicious breakfast each morning. Umit and the rest of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful with all inquiries. It was nice to have free access to the laptop in the lobby - Umit even brought me a cup of tea while I was checking my email one afternoon. The location is within very close proximity and walking distance to all the main attractions in the Old Town. The rooms are very comfortable and wonderfully decorated. When we go back to Istanbul we will definitely stay at the Dersaadet again. As seasoned travelers, we highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great choice which we would recommend to all”
Reviews.Author: Ratsal
Reviews.Content: We and another couple stayed at the Dersaadet from Septmeber 19 through September 27. To echo many other reviewers, the hotel was a wonderful find. Some of many highlights were the staff, location , and incredible cleanliness. The breakfast, which was included in the cost of the room, was delicious, healthly and with lots of home made breads and pastries. If you are accustomed to American and European chains, you will find the rooms smaller. This is customary in private European hotels, and actually lends charm and local culture to the trip. We would hightly recommend this hotel. We would also like to comment on our dining experiences; these experiences are outside of the Dersaadet hotel as the hotel does not have a formal dining restaurant. While selecting a restaurant, be sure to ask a lot of questions. Foods placed on the table are rarely complimentary. According to the staff at the Dersaadet, you should just say that you are not interested and send them back. We had a disappointing experience at the Boukoleon Fish Restaurant. A tray of appetizers or mezes was presented and we asked the cost. We were told that they varied from six to ten Lira. We did not realize until the bill came that the price was per person rather than per dish. We also felt that our experience with the Cagaloglu bath was disappointing as it appeared to us to be overpriced, over hyped, and over rated. The full body massage was nothing more than a rub down.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Cardinal46
Reviews.Content: We spent five days at the Hotel Dersaadet, Istanbul, Turkey. It is located in the old part of the city, close by many of the historical sites that most visitors likely would like to see. Indeed, it is just around the corner from the Hippodrome and a few blocks from the tram. For us, it was an ideal location. The hotel itself was clean and well maintained. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. Any request that was made was handled efficiently and timely. They would not only do what you asked, but whatever else might required to actually accomplish whatever end result you were seeking. We really enjoyed beginning (breakfast buffet and view of the Bosporus) and ending (the illuminated Blue Mosque and a Raki!) our days on the roof top terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dersaadet!”
Reviews.Author: ReneeS
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Dersaadet hotel! My sister and I were there for six nights. Not only is the hotel lovely, the staff are unbelievable! We found an injured cat on a Sunday night at 8:00 p.m. and not only did the staff help us find a 24 hour emergency veterinarian, they also arranged for a low fixed-rate fee taxi to get us to the vet (almost 40 minutes away) and back. They helped us with all our questions while planning our itinerary of sights to see. The breakfast was perfect, and location can't be beat! We will definitely stay here again if we return to Istanbul .

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul on the bosphorous”
Reviews.Author: wilycoyote13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Dersaadet from the 12 September to the 16 September. I cant praise the staff enough. They were extremely welcoming & friendly , and very efficient. That is extremely rare to find in my opinion !. The hotel is superbly located , besides all the attractions. I will come back to this lovely hotel when there are less tourists !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel made superb by the staff”
Reviews.Author: AlpalWiltshire
Reviews.Content: Have just enjoyed 3 magical days in Istanbul staying at the Dersaadet. It's a lovely boutique hotel made particularly special by the very helpful and friendly staff. The view from the roof top bar is gorgeous. It is a 10 minute stroll to the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia making it well located. If you like large luxury hotels with huge marble lobby's and 24 hour room service then this is not the one for you. It is quaint and quirky with traditional furniture and we would recommend a corner suite because they are lovely and spacious. All in all a great choice but only if authentique and traditional with a real flavour of the city appeals.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a gem”
Reviews.Author: Kata113
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a week starting 31.8 2008 and came back yesterday. Very good breakfast, wonderful view from the roof terrace to Bosporus to have it and to sit in the evening with a glass of wine. Good location. The rooms are OK and the air condition works well. The staff is very friendly and helpful. One of them said always "of course" every time I asked a favor. I really recommed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: keyte
Reviews.Content: Great location and gorgeous hotel with fantastic hospitality. We were made to feel extremely comfortable and given great advice on local restaurants and tours. Loved having breakfast every morning on the rooftop overlooking the Bosphorous with a view of the Blue Mosque in the background. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbullish on the Dersaadet”
Reviews.Author: gonebabygone5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dersaadet based on the Tripadvisor reviews, and it was perfect for our needs. The hotel is tiny on the outside, but the corner suites (my wife and I and our two older children stayed in two of the suites; I cannot comment on the smaller rooms) are roomy, nicely furnished, have great bathrooms and - most importantly in August - are extremely well air-conditioned. The location is excellent, both in terms of being walking distance to the Blue Mosque/Haya Sofia/Topkapi Palace area, as well as having a nice shopping bazaar and charming restaurant district (through the bazaar and down the hill a block) a couple blocks away. Service was, as other writers noted, uniformly friendly and helpful, particularly Umit-of-the-front-desk. The rooftop breakfast room serves a nice breakfast with a great view, and is also a nice place to hang out for a drink in the evening. For an extremely tasty local lunch and the largest (included) naan-type bread you'll ever see, try the Tamara around the corner - Umit recommended it to us, and it was the best meal we had in Turkey, and a bargain to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Delectable Desaardet”
Reviews.Author: MelBelSuffolk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 days in Istanbul staying at the Oteli Desaardet. I booked the hotel for a short break for myself, my husband and our 15 yr old son after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor.We were definitely not disappointed. The hotel was spotlessly clean (this is something that is always top of my list) and only a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque. What can I say about the amazing staff that has not already been said. They were fantastic, nothing was too much trouble, offering advice and looking after our every need. This was not just good service, it was genuine care as well. The other highlight of the Desaardet is the roof terrace with the wonderful views of the Sea of Marmara and the beautiful Blue Mosque. This is where we had breakfast (very nice) and after a day walking around Istanbul it was the perfect place to wind down with an Efes, freshly squeezed orange juice and iced tea! I would have been quite happy spending a day on the terrace watching the boats, ships and Ocean Liners (the binoculars came in handy! ). In the time we spent in Istanbul we still didn't manage to see everything, so we will have to return. When we do, we will have no hesitation in booking Oteli Desaardet. Thank you again to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTraveller9
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel in the area of Istanbul closest to all the main tourist sites. The rooms reflect the historical nature of the area and the view from the rooftop terrace where meals are taken is wonderful. Complementary airport transport for longer stays is a great help. What really makes your stay so enjoyable however, is the friendly and very helpful attitude of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice experience!”
Reviews.Author: Mizkuniko
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this family owned hotel from 24th to 27th July 2008. It is located in the touristic area of Istanbul (Sultanhamet), behind the Blue Mosque (which you can admire from the terrace of the hotel) and very near to all major turistic attractions of Istanbul (Topkapy Palace, Aya Sofia, the Basilica Cisterns, the Arasta Bazar, etc.). The building is a typical ottoman style building, very well maintained and carachteristic. The neighborhoods are not particularly exciting (a laundry, some undefined shops, bakery, etc) but they are safe and sufficiently quiet. Inside, the Hotel is very very well maintained, incredibly clean and the general feeling is that the owner and the personnel really care about their â€œbabyâ€�. With particular reference to the personnel, with no doubts we can say that they are absolutely efficient, never getting tired of trying to help you in whatever need you may have and always available to make your journey as much pleasant as possible. Therefore, weâ€™d like to personally thank the front office personnel, the waiters, the maids and all the other workers of the hotel. We had booked the Corner Suite, the photos of which are published in the hotelâ€™s website. The room was very clean and quite big, even if the photos in the website make it a 30% better than how it really is. The bathroom was very functional (a lovely Jacuzzi and a wide range of beauty products) to make your stay more pleasant. In general we would say that the Hotel is very worth to go, and you can with no doubts rank it among the 4 stars hotel. Of course, if you seek for the best, it would not satisfy you, but if you are looking for a price/quality balanced structure (190 Euro per night, the Suite) you may not be disappointed. The only thing that disappointed me is the lack of a restaurant, but you can easily go out and find something to eat. I would certainly recommend to my friends this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Tonytrain
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Istanbul and I couldnt have stayed at a more friendly place. A car was sent to pick us from the airport which made things easy from the onset; then when we arrived at the hotel the check-in procedure was made easy and friendly. The rooms were maybe smaller than we are used to in the US but they wwere cosy, clean and comfortable. The AC was perfect and made our room a welcome haven from the searing Istanbul heat whenever we came back 'home' to our room. Breakfast on a terrace witha panoramic view of the Sea of Marmara and the islands in the distance. The front desk staff were so helpful whenever we had a question. When I needed a tailor for a few adjustments to some trousers they actually walked me to the tailor, translated and they picked up the finished trousers later while I went on an excursion in Itsanbul. Sincerely the guys in the hotel are so friendly, and most of them speak great English which makes things so much simpler. I just cant wait for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Sultan Ah'met”
Reviews.Author: Quizkid
Reviews.Content: A beautiful little hotel in the heart of the Sultan Ah'met district, just a block from the beautiful Blue Mosque. You can have breakfast on the hotel terrace or a drink in the evening, and watch the seagulls circle above the minarets of the Blue Mosque, or the boats on the Sea of Marmora. Very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are small but charming, with traditional furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: bostonwandererBoston
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It was by chance that I found the name on the internet, and since I was traveling at short notice I didnt have much chance to pick and choose and was prepared to switch to a better hotel after arrival. As it happens wild horses could not have dragged me elsewhere! The rooms were spotless and cosy; the position was optimum, just a few steps away from the Arasta Bazaar and the Sultan Ahmet Mosque. The roof terrace had stunning views of the Sea of Marmara and the Princes' Islands. Breakfast consisted of a well varied choice of items, both Turkish specialities and international fare. But the real talking point about this hotel is the staff, who are willing to bend over backwards to please there guests in every way possible. They are polite to the extreme and always answer even the oddest requests with a smile and an immediate implementation. From the cleaning staff to the waiters to the front desk to the manager, I could fault nobody. Their English is impeccable too, and their recommendations - whether for sightseeing or restaurants - invariably helpful and reliable. All in home it was like staying at my own home, except that at home I do not have so many individuals pandering to my every whim! I just cant wait to fly off and stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Cathleen406
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Istanbul for 3 nights and two days. The Dersaadet made our stay very enjoyable. The staff was very nice and helpful, particularly Umit, the day time desk manager. They staff took time to point us to the right sights and mark them on the map (which they provided.) They also made restaurant recommendations that were good. The room was clean and comfortable. The bed was a little hard, but fine. The maid noticed that we had put towels under our pillow to add a little more fluff so she left us extra pillows, which was very nice. We didn't pay for a water view but we got a little slice of one anyway. The hardwood floors in the room gave it a warm and cozy feel. The shower was excellent. They served a generous breakfast with eggs, fruit, cereals, muffins, breads, cheeses and cold cuts. They also had a nice array of jams, honey and traditional toppings. Our only complaint, and it's a minor one, was the orange juice. It tasted like Tang or SunnyD or some other artificial juice. The location of the hotel was excellent and made it easy to see a sites and make a quick stop at the hotel to recharge and then head back out. It was a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque and St. Sohphia Church and the main street for shopping and snacking, and 15 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar. We paid $109 euros a night for the hotel, which included the 5 percent discount for paying in cash. We paid in Turkish lira so the hotel calculated the exchange rate between euros and lira. The exchange rate was off by a few percent from the published daily rate, but it wasn't too bad. The hotel picked us up and dropped us off from the airport. They charged 25 euros for the pickup and 35 lira for the drop off. Both times they were very prompt. Our stay was fantastic. We've already recommended the Dersaadet to family members who are considering a trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Dersaadet!”
Reviews.Author: Twinkers
Reviews.Content: I decided to book the Dersaadet Hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and I was not disappointed! The hotel was spotlessly clean and the rooms were spacious and comfortable. The staff were extremely courteous and friendly. I certainly felt at home in the hotel. The location is second to none for sightseeing with the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi palace to name but a few nearby. I wouldn't hesitate staying here again, or recommending to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Endearing Dersaadet”
Reviews.Author: aboyce
Reviews.Content: The Dersaadet is a charming, excellently located, extremely friendly and inexpensive way to stay in Istanbul. Although the hotel is small, the rooms are generous and very comfortable. The roof terrace has wonderful views of the city and the Sea of Marmara. Located in the Sultanahmet district it is just around the corner from the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Aya Sofya. The staff are a pleasure; friendly, efficient, sincere and will oblige any request with grace. Words cannot compliment this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: LACHEILENE
Reviews.Content: The majority of the attractions are all in one main area and the hotel is only a 5-10 minute walk away. The rooms are neat, clean and have a great view. The service is fantastic, everyone is friendly, smiles and even go out of their way to make you feel at ease. The breakfast on the roof top is calming and good. I would definitely go back to the Dersaadet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dersaadet”
Reviews.Author: IcedGreenTea
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was gracious, very accommodating, and attentive. We travelled with three other couples. All of our rooms were extremely clean. Any request we had was instantly addressed with a smile. The staff took great pride in their hotel and service - their English was wonderful !! We enjoyed cocktails every night on the terrace - beautiful panoramic view. Breakfast was a feast !!!!!! Excellent buffet style selection. Delicious homemade breads. Umit and the staff were very helpful with suggestions and directions. The location was perfect for all the popular sights - walked to everything - The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar, Topkapi, etc. You never know what to expect when traveling to a foreign city - The Dersaadet is one of our favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique by the Blue Masque”
Reviews.Author: 0NETrip_AtA_Time
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff and clean rooms. Close to all the old city sites and transportation. The staff was very helpful and the rooms impeccably clean. We debated staying here or on the other side of the Golden Horn. This was definitely the right choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Sea view not as expected”
Reviews.Author: jhatman1
Reviews.Content: I reserved two rooms with a sea view. The first room was a corner suite with sea view. The room was on the second floor and the view was mainly of buildings. Over the top of the building there was a small view of sea. I discussed with front desk that my room really did not have a sea view. They told me the same rooom on third floor had a sea view, but that room was rented. The second room reserved was a sea view double room. This room was on third floor. The room had a small window with a view of the sea. I asked the hotel if they would allow me to cancel my reservation and stay at another hotel. They were apologetic that I did not get the view expected and allowed me to cancel reservation.

Reviews.Title: “A real Ottoman home”
Reviews.Author: Lonepiner
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and was not disappointed! The hotel has been lovingly restored with great attention to detail so that you truly feel you are entering an Ottoman home. Our room and bathroom were spotless and although small never seemed cramped. We paid for a sea view and it was well worth it. The views were wonderful. Breakfast on the rooftop terrace offered a good choice and it was a lovely start to the day. Having a drink at the end of a busy day was even better. We stayed 10 days as my husband was taking photographs for his book on Istanbul. This necessitated visiting far flung parts of the city and the hotel staff were very helpful in giving advice on how to get around. They always welcomed us back on our return so it felt like coming home. All the staff struck the right balance between friendly and helpful but not intrusive. The location behind the Blue Mosque meant easy access to the main sites of the old city and there are plenty of small restaurants within easy walking distance.This is an excellent choice for a short or long stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Almatt
Reviews.Content: There are so many reviews of the Dersaadet that it's difficult to think of something new to write! I agree entirely with everything written by samsacremento in a recent review (26 May 2008) - it's a really accurate report, in my opinion, and it doesn't raise unreasonable expectations. We were very happy with this hotel - the location, the staff, the cleanliness and comfort of our room (the Sultan's Penthouse Suite) and the breakfast were all excellent; if we ever return to Istanbul, then we would not hesitate to stay here again. The proximity of the Dersaadet to many of the main sights is a major plus. I don't think I have ever seen anything more beautiful than the view from the hotel's roof terrace of the Blue Mosque lit up at night with the seagulls flying above it, all shining white in the lights. The public transport system in Istanbul is great and cheap - we used the Tramway to reach Eminonu and when we went across to Beyoglu. It's 1.4 Turkish Lira per journey. The ferry system is also just as cheap and it's a great way to see Istanbul from a different perspective. There are plenty of restaurants and bars near the hotel. We tried The Pudding Shop on Divan Yolu on the first evening. That was pretty OK but not spectacular. We also ate at the Cafe Mesale - a tea garden/water pipe restaurant (outdoors - NB no alcohol) and that was excellent. There's a short whirling dervish performance at 8pm and 10 pm each day and we liked the overall atmosphere as well as the meze. We the world's most expensive (well, maybe!!) lattes in the Topkapi Palace! Of the bars/restaurants on the main drag in Sultanahmet (Divan Yolu) we liked the Cozy Pub the best - had an excellent steak for 24 Turkish Lira. The drinks are not cheap but there was a good vibe about the place. One thing we did (in easy walking distance of the Dersaadet was the cookery class with Eveline (cooking Alaturka) - brilliant! If you have time then I recommend it. The cost has increased to 60 euros but you do get to eat a huge meal at the end with a couple of glasses of wine. Overall, we loved Istanbul and we were very happy with our hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel in the heart of Istanbul - Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Aussiesabroad_8
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed at the Dersaadet hotel for four nights last week and thouroughly enjoyed our stay. We were accomodated in separate rooms on the same floor and both our rooms were very comfortable - incredibly clean and had an intimate and personalised feel compared to many hotel rooms in major chains. The hotel is within easywalking distance of all the old town sights but away from the main tourist area of Sultanhamet so apart from the occasional call to prayers ( which we actually enjoyed hearing even first thing in the morning) the location is lovely and quiet. The rooftop terrace is divine with the most wonderful views across the nearby rooftops to the Sea of Marmara. The breakfast provided was a perfect way to start the day - the scrambled eggs were outstanding. We also rushed back late each afternoon to have a glass of Efes ( the local beer) before heading out to dinner. The free wireless laptop in the lobby was a real bonus to check e-mails, book seats and google. Also wonderful were the wide range of guidebooks available to browse in the lobby and the free airport pickup if staying for 4 nights or more. But without a doubt the highlight of the Dersaadet is the staff - they are incredibly obliging and friendly and nothing is too much trouble - booking restaurants, getting cabs, recommendations for restaurants... and making sure that the local taxi drivers do the right thing by foreign tourists. Will definitely recommend to all our friends travelling to Istanbul. Brisbane, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with lovely view”
Reviews.Author: totramundo
Reviews.Content: The Dersaadet Hotel is close to all the important sites in Sultanhamet. The staff is very helpful and the owner is always present. There is a laptop in the lobby available to guests and also books and travel guides. The rooms are a bit larger than other boutique hotels in the area. The crowning touch is the terrace where breakfast, etc. is served...lovely view. A wonderful way to start off the day or to relax after a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel in the old city of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SamSacramento_CA
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a full week at the Dersaadet Hotel. There were 2 couples and we all enjoyed this small, friendly, family run hotel. It's located in the old city in a residential area. That was the best part. We enjoyed "living" among our neighbors. Yes, there is a manual car wash business across the street, but all you hear is the sound of water coming from one pressure washer and the voices of the 1 or 2 people working there. There's also the neighborhood produce man who wheels his cart through the narrow streets each day, the bread man who comes by calling out with a huge round tray of fresh bread on his head. Each day a man comes by crying out to buy scrap iron which he loads into his wheelbarrow. The potato truck drives by now and then. Women hang their laundry on their rooftop terraces to dry. One woman lowered her money in a bucket on a rope from her 3rd story window to pay for some fresh goods a peddler put into the bucket for her to haul up. Kids play soccer outside their homes in the narrow street. The nearby mosque calls the faithful to prayer. I loved it, even at 5 in the morning. Other than that, the neighborhood is quiet at night except for an occasional dog barking. The location is perfect for seeing the major attractions in Istanbul. This is the area the tour buses haul everyone to from somewhere else, but we got to live here instead and simply walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, the Grand Bazaar, the Hop On/Hop Off city tour bus, the Topeki Palace, many and varied restaurants, the Archeological Museum, and more. The only time we needed transportation was to catch the ferry to tour the Bosphorous (and actually we could have walked -- it would just have taken 30 minutes). So the location is perfect. Besides that, so is the hotel. It has about 17 rooms on 3 floors with the lobby below and the rooftop terrace above. We sprang for one of the two corner suites and it was worth it. It was huge with one double bed and across the room a single bed, in the middle were 2 comfy overstuffed chairs with a little coffee table and reading lamp, a big roomy dresser and an ample wardrobe for hanging clothes. The bathroom could have used some shelf space but otherwise is large and included a jacuzzi tub with shower. Shower cap, shower gel, soap, shampoo, conditioner, lotion and a hair dryer are provided. The room has five windows -- the better to stick our heads out for watching neighborhood life, gazing at the sea, and getting plenty of light. Nicely decorated in rich, warm colors and a Turkish rug. The room has 2 heat/ac units which worked just fine. The lobby is comfy with a sofa, bookshelves with LOTS of guide books you can borrow, and several small round tables/chairs. We four played bridge there several times in the evening. Also a lap top computer is set up on one for patrons to use with no charge. It works fast and without problems. There is free Wi-Fi in the rooms (our laptop worked great -- no problems using it the whole week). The entire hotel is spotlessly clean and nicely furnished and decorated. The front desk is manned 24/7 with the most helpful, friendly people possible. They can recommend places to see and eat and will arrange reservations, transportation, etc. When returning one night from a wonderful dinner at a newly opened restaurant recommended by the young man at the front desk, we told him the otherwise great meal was spoiled by cigarette smokers surrounding us. We found out the next day he had spoken with the owner and given him our complaint and they were working on a smoke free space upstairs! By the way, we were told that within a month or so new city ordinances will be in effect requiring all public areas to provide separate smoking and non-smoking areas. That will be a big help as there is a LOT of smoking in Istanbul -- everywhere. We had absolutely no problems walking around at night. Never the slightest concern about our safety. There are lots of tourists wandering around by the nearby attractions and near our hotel there are many neighbors out and about. The hotel has a small, efficient elevator. It's true as others have written, that the electricity may fail (it did only once that we were aware of in our 7 night stay and that was for less than 30 minutes). The elevator will not take you to the terrace level. It goes only to the 3 floors of rooms, then you must walk one short, circular flight to the rooftop. Breakfast is served here until 10:30 so no need to get up early. There are several round inside tables and smaller, wrought iron outside tables with floor to ceiling glass/sliding door for an unspoiled view of the sea and the Blue Mosque. The food was very good. Scrambled eggs were especially good. Cheese or meat wrapped in baked/fried pastry, dry cereals, many different breads/muffins, cheeses, butter, cream cheese, creamed chocolate spread, hard-cooked eggs, thick yogurt, lots of jams, milk, cherry and orange juice, American style coffee that was delicious. One of us did wish there had been oatmeal (instant would be fine if a microwave could be provided) and skim milk since he's working on a low fat diet. We ate 7 breakfasts and I never tired of them. There is always someone there to help/serve. After breakfast, the terrace is open until late at night. Very light snacks (2 types of sandwich) are served as well as mixed drinks, several beers, and wine. Just across the narrow, hilly street from the hotel are 2 mini markets where we got snacks and even decent red wine for about $12 a bottle. In both of the markets, the clerks were willing to open the bottle for us and even provided plastic cups without charge. There a tiny laundry next door where you can drop off your clothes and pick them up washed and dried that night or the next day. About $7 for 2 pounds. They'll even iron for an additional charge. There is even a turkish bath down the street (but we didn't try it). One of the best services the hotel offers is free pickup at the airport if you are staying 3 or more nights. It was such a gift to find our names on a placard being held by a very friendly man as we walked into the terminal. He introduced us to another friendly man who managed to fit us 4 and our 12 pieces of luggage into his new, clean, big "people mover." Although this same free service isn't offered when you leave, the hotel will arrange it for less than $30 total (not per person)! Well worth it. Another nice service: because we paid cash (some in US dollars, some in Turkish lire, and some in Euros) our bill was discounted 5%. Remembering some of the complaints other reviewers had: I have fibromyalgia and have a very difficult time finding a comfortable bed away from home. I had no problem with the hotel bed; I didn't even ask for the extra topper. The bed was firm but felt good. The car wash is virtually a one man operation and not a repair shop in any way; it's not a problem. The free computer works fine; no problems at all. If you can walk for 10 minutes, there are plenty of restaurants around serving all different kinds of food. Yes there are a lot with only traditional Turkish and that does get old after awhile, but we found Indian, fish, continental, Italian, and even Mexican as well, all within easy walking distance.
