I agree: be sure to see the Basilica Cistern (it's huge, underground, amazing -- they even sometimes have concerts there). Also definitely take a cruise up the Bosphorous. Don't take a tourist ferry. Take the regular commuter ferry. It will zig zag from the European to the Asian side, stopping at several fishing villages. At the end (where the ferry will have a 2 or 3 hour wait before returning), get off and eat a nice leisurely lunch in the village, then cruise back to Istanbul. Pretty sights along the way. The Hop On/Hop Off bus is expensive but we enjoyed the tour. Saw the modern side of Istanbul and so glad we stayed in the old city. But also saw many other sights we'd miss otherwise (e.g., the metal church brought from Norway (?), miles of the original city fortress walls). The Grand Bazaar is nothing special, really -- just huge and claustrophobic. Much more fun and exotic was the Spice Bazaar which we saw right before we boarded the ferry for the cruise up the Bosphorous (they are just across the street from each other).

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the Dersaadet Hotel Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Manapools
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in the Dersaadet Hotel in Istanbul. Close to the Blue Mosque (five minute walk) and the Aya Sofya, the hotel is very conveniently situated in the Old City, but away from noise and bustle. The staff were all absolutely charming and nothing was too much trouble for them - indeed they regularly went out of their way to help us and were always cheerful with a ready smile and greeting. Breakfast on the roof terrace in the sunshine with beautiful views out to sea and to the Asian side were a lovely way to start each day. I would commend the Dersaadet Hotel to anyone looking for a conveniently placed, comfortable and friendly hotel in the Old City, Istanbul. David Fettes Surrey England

Reviews.Title: “Most excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Braudel
Reviews.Content: I am a regular guest at Dersaadet Hotel since business trips bring me to Istanbul on a regular basis. I discovered Dersaadet Hotel a few years ago in an internet search for a nice hotel in the historical Sultanahmet area. I was very satisfied with all my stays (5 in total so far) and was there last week, this time accompanied by my wife and daughter. The staff of the hotel is immensenly helpful and friendly. They assist on all occasions, inculding pick-up service from the airport, they also provided a baby cot and had many useful suggestions for restaurants, travel business (e.g. checking Golden Horn or Bosphorus sea-bus timetables and printing these out). The hotel is in a fantastic period design, all rooms are stunningly beautiful and very clean. The breakfast on the roof terrace is an unforgettable experience with sea-view on the Marmara sea as well as on the Blue Mosque. The hotel is in a 3-minute-walking distance from the Hippodrome, the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. I do strongly recommend Dersaadet hotel to all Istanbul travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Pay the extra for the sea-view room”
Reviews.Author: galloping_grannie
Reviews.Content: Friendly 'family run' small hotel. I stayed in a 'sea-view' room for 3 nights and a 'standard' room for 2 nights. Clean, comfortable, excellent hot showers, but do not take 304, 305, 404 or 405 at the front of the house(standard rooms) because of the DOG! He lives outside the carpet shop opposite and barks all night. The call to prayer is only once at daybreak but the dog howls and barks throughout the night! Also some proper orange juice at breakfast would be a huge plus. It wasn't even juice but what we call 'orange squash' in the UK. Otherwise I enjoyed my stay here in a less touristy part of Sultanahmet - there are even real people living in the neighbourhood!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff”
Reviews.Author: BibliophileMaryland
Reviews.Content: We were satisfied overall with this hotel. It is centrally located in the Old Town district of Istanbul, and convienient to the major sites and restaurants (but take note of landmarks if you leave on foot--it's hard to find! Our cabdriver had to ask literally about 10 people, and we had the address written on a piece of paper for him! We also got lost the first time we tried to find it again on foot). The staff (main desk and assistants) was excellent, and the (included) breakfast was quite tasty and diverse. The rooftop restaurant setting has a great view of either the Blue Mosque, and the sea of Marmara. Drawbacks: the room was supposed to be ready at 1, and it wasn't ready until 2:30, which lost us major time waiting around and caused us to miss much of what we wanted to see at Topkapi Palace, since they closed at 5 (guidebooks had said 7). There are no washcloths provided, just towels--staff said they don't have washcloths. There was a slight water leak from the minibar fridge on the floor, and there seemed to be a bit of mold in the tub. It was a small room, but the decor was interesting, and beds comfortable enough (our room had a double and a twin bed). Not luxury, but for location and a short stay, a good place if you're prepared for a few things not being the best. The front desk manager also arranged for airport transport when we asked about it the day before we left; the car service he called was a good one, and right on time. ALso, the room we had was a bit noisy for a while, as the hotel is across the street from a carwash that had a LOUD sprayer. There is a laptop in the lobby with free internet (but the Turkish-character keyboard was not configured the way ours is...for example, where the period would be, we got the "slash" character!) There are also local guidebooks that one can borrow, in the lobby. The toilet was somewhat flimsy in the seat and lid. But overall, it was fine for a short stay, and seemed clean. Helpful hint: There is a small grocery store right across the street for bottled water or other needs, and the man was kind (when he didn't have change for our $20 Turkish lira bill, he offered the 2 waters for free and said "You pay tomorrow"--we were leaving then, so we gave him $1 American.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: bonb88
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at Dersaadet in Sultanahmet and 3 nights at the Orient Express (metro stop is GÃ¼lhane), so I will do a comparison of the two. They are about 10 Euros difference in price and both offer cash discounts: LOCATION: ORIENT EXPRESS (because I personally don't like the touristy aspect of Sultanahmet) Sultanahmet is where all the main attractions are, Aya Sofya, Sultanahmet Camii, KapalÄ± Ã§arÅŸÄ± (Grand Bazaar), etc. so it's great for all that. The thing I don't like is that Sultanahmet is incredibly touristy, so someone will try to sell you something every 2 minutes walking in that area. There's a bunch of restaurants by the metro station. Within a few short blocks of the hotel there are some decent restaurants too, so you don't have to always walk over to the main drag. Orient Express is one metro stop away from Sultanahmet. It's literally right on the metro path (you walk out of the hotel a few steps and you could get hit by the metro). That street has restaurants and usual shops, but they don't grab you as much as they do in Sultanahmet. In fact, rarely. Being on the metro path and a busy street, you will hear some street noise but it wasn't too bad at all. ROOM / HOTEL: ORIENT EXPRESS (edged out slightly due to room size) Dersaadet is an independent, small hotel. The rooms are smaller and older, but very clean and absolutely adequate. Bed is comfortable and bathroom is very clean. There is free internet at the lobby, and there is a laundry shop a few doors down. There's a restaurant at the rooftop but we only had breakfast there. Orient Express is part of a hotel group, so it has more of a standard hotel feel. The room is more standard Hilton'ish, decent size and there's more room for luggage and stuff. Bed is also comfortable and bathroom is also very clean. There is also free internet and printer by the lobby, but the printer was broken at the time. There's a rooftop restaurant and a cafe/bar downstairs. They have laundry service but I imagine it'd be on par with the price at a regular hotel, which is expensive. They serve welcome Elma Ã‡ay (fake apple tea) and zimit when we checked in. Both hotels offer free airport pickup if you stay a certain number of nights. To go to istanbul airport, you actually could take the metro if you don't have too much luggage and it'll save you money (about 2.6 YTL vs. 25 Euros). Just remember that during busy hours the metro cars get crowded and it may not be comfortable for a few stops, but it was fine for us. STAFF: DERSAADET All the front desk staff at Dersaadet is awesome - incredibly polite, friendly, and helpful, and I'd say more personable than OE. We mostly talked to Umit and he's just great. Really friendly and try to help with everything. More people work at OE, and the staff we met were also very polite and helpful, but just slightly more "standard" overall. When they were recommending things to do, it was more to the tune of generic packaged tours. If you ask about other specific things, they may not know. There's really nothing I can fault the staff at OE, but Dersaadet's smaller, more close-knit staff gives a more personal feeling to our stay. BREAKFAST: Sort of tied. Both have good selection of cereal, cold cuts, breads, dried fruits, etc. OE has a larger selection that includes sausages and scrambled eggs, different cheeses, etc. But really, how much can you eat at breakfast? So both are adequate. BOTTOMLINE: They're both good for different reasons so it's really your personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “All the charm of the Old City Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Vermonlover
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the quaint Dersaadet to find the cleanest, renovated (just enough) hotel you could hope for in the old city. Our room was exactly what we imagined a Turkish hotel would be decorated like. Our room was a charming yellow with a stunning burndt red stencil on the ceiling. Our bus boy became our go-to-guy. He was more than accommodating. Our breakfast (included) on the roof top terrace was fantastic. If you want a REAL Turkish hotel and not a transplanted franchise, go here. One word of advise for the traveler....while very knowledgeable, our tour guide steered us to venders from whom he obviously received large kickbacks. Do you really want a $500 "authentic" bowl?

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel - Fantastic time!!!! Thanks to you all”
Reviews.Author: TauntonHarvey1
Reviews.Content: Everything about this Hotel is fabulous. My daughter and I had a four night stay there. It was a 60th birthday present from my family and what a fabulous present it was! The staff were superb, location superb and the breakfasts fantastic. The views from the terrace to the Bospherous were superb. Nothing was too much trouble and we shall definitely be returning. Thank you all for a fantastic stay. Highly recommended to all. Taunton, England March 2008

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hullonian
Reviews.Content: The Dersaadet Hotel provides guests with superb Ottoman-style accomodations in the heart of Sultanahmet, Istanbul's most charming and historic district. There are only 19 rooms; ours was very large and nicely furnished and had an incredible view of the Sea of Marmara. A lovely buffet-style breakfast is included; this was served in the terrace room on the top floor, which provides thrilling views of the neighborhood, the sea, and the "Blue Mosque." In the evening, the terrace is a romantic spot to enjoy a drink or two. The hotel staff could not have been nicer, and with their restaurant recommendations, ensured that these first-time visitors to Istanbul had memorable dining experiences as well. Did I mention that the hotel is immaculately clean? Or that it provides free internet? Or that the hotel picks you up and drops you off at the airport? For the price, the Dersaadet Hotel is, in a word, perfect.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimleamington
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and were absolutely delighted. The location is great..a quiet everyday street yet just around the corner from major sights such as the Blue Mosque. The views from thr roof terrace, where breakfast is served ,are fantastic..as good as anywhere in the city. We particularly liked the extremely professional yet friendly approach of all the staff who would help with any query we had. The rooms themselves are very clean and tastefully furnished in keeping with the wooden building and we didn't experience any noise disturbance. The area below the hotel, down to the sea , is interesting in itself with a beautiful Mosque, small market and 'little Ag. Sofia'. Really, a model of a well run small hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul is amazing”
Reviews.Author: SugarCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Istanbul was everything people who traveled to the city said it was.. and more. We couldn't get enough of the Blue Mosque at night, just beautiful. There is too much to see in the old part of town, Sultanahmet. It is convienent to stay in the area as it takes more than a couple of days to see it all properly. We also found this part of town more quiet and less crowded. If you stay in that area, one place to consider is the Dersaadet Hotel. More like a Bed and Breakfast, this hotel was very clean and the staff, friendly and helpful, essential if it is your first visit. I recommend a corner suite if you can afforf it. The hotel is a 5 miniute walk to the major tourist sites and the metro. It is safe and quiet and has a beautiful view of the Bosphorus from the roof top terrace. Much thanks to Deniz and Umit for making our stay a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice - thanks to all the reviews”
Reviews.Author: jospanner
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Dersaadet Hotel based on all the excellent Trip Advisor reviews and it was the best choice! It's ideally situated, comfortable, has great staff and a delicious breakfast. We will definitely stay there again and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: DarrenMichelle1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Dersaadet Hotel in Istanbul and would thoroughly recommend it to others. It is a small hotel which means it is NOT your usual sterile large hotel experience. We booked late and so had the basement room without a view however this was fine. It was clean, quiet and comfortable. The staff are superb and the rooftop terrace is great for a drink and breakfast. Where better to start the day than an outdoor terrace with a view of the sea one way and the blue mosque the other? The staff were all honest, helpful and extremely friendly as well as very knowledgeable about their city. The location is also ideal for the Sultanahmet area where most of the sites are located blue mosque, Aya Sofya, Basilica Cistern. Darren and Michelle, UK

Reviews.Title: “Dersaadet hotel is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ruthiebaby_uk
Reviews.Content: Have just arrived back in drab grey England having just spent a glorious five night stay in the Dersaadet hotel. Had originally booked this hotel having seen the previous reviews on this website. The hotel really is as nice as the reviews say it is, nothing is ever too much trouble for any of the staff. We were made to feel very welcome from the moment we first stepped through the door. They certainly could not have been more helpful. The rooms are a nice size, although I am a small person. However, there is so much to see and do in Istanbul that you will spend very little time in the room. The breakfasts were some of the nicest that I have ever had in any hotel that I have ever stayed in. The location of the hotel was also superb as you are very close to all of the major sightseeing places. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to go to Istanbul and I personally cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A nice base to visit Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Dr_DGuildford
Reviews.Content: Location, comfort and helpful, excellent staff make the Dersaadet Hotel a good base when visiting Istanbul. It is located in a quiet street a ten-minute walk from the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya. Our room on the second floor had a view of the Sea of Marmara and the local mosque which broadcasts the call to prayer, including the early call at sunrise. The bed was firm and comfortable with cotton bed linen. At breakfast they serve a nice mix of hot and cold foods including homemade savoury pastries. This is served on the roof-top terrace which has a stunning view of the ships passing through the strait, also a nice place to enjoy a drink in the afternoon when you return. The staff are friendly and very helpful which added to the enjoyment and comfort of our staff. They have four categories of room plus a penthouse suite so you may wish to clarify which type you are being offered when you book. Although there are numerous restaurants within walking distance, for meals that are more than average you will need to travel across town, about 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Great neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: mlk1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Dersaadet. Great location! Close enough to walk to most destinations. Really nice and helpful staff. The double room was large and well furnished. The wi-fi was fairly reliable. Booking the hotel on the hotels website was a breeze with quick response. The cafe on the roof had a stunning view and the breakfast was very nice. Cereal, fresh home baked breads, yogurt, different fresh and dried fruits, cheese, juice etc. The only 2 negatives about this hotel I can think of are the cold scrambled eggs and the fairly brutal coffee. A small price to payfor such a great view. I will definitely return to the Dersaadet. Great value in a great Istanbul location!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: grillotine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dersaadet Hotel the first week of March 2008 and we just loved it. Wonderful location, close to the Blue Mosquee, Sainte-Sophie Mosquee, Topkapi, and the main sightseeings of Istanbul. The staff is very discret, friendly and helpful. We highly appreciated the breakfast served on the terrace which overviews the Marmara Sea and the Blue Mosquee. We will probably repeat this very good experience and recommend the Dersaadt Hotel to our friends! Dominique and Philippe Le Corroller - Vincennes - FRANCE

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Dublinlass
Reviews.Content: My family of five adults have just returned from a wonderful long weekend in Instanbul where we stayed at the Dersaadet Hotel. Umit on reception was exceptional in all his dealings with us which varied from booking restaurants prior to our arrival, to advising us on local restaurants serving Turkish cusine.Taxis were booked,boat trips arranged and all with a smile and courtesy which all the staff showed to the hotel guests . At all times the staff were helpful and nothing was too much bother to make our stay enjoyable. We stayed in a corner room which was very clean and spacious and had a wonderful shower in a roomy bathroom. Our three adult children had a triple room which was comfortable though not as roomy as ours! Early morning deliveries and collections were somewhat noisey but not something the hotel could do anything about. Breakfast was adaquete and served in the rooftop breakfast room with stunning views of the Blue mosque. Weather though changeable was for the most part sunny and crisp, perfect sight seeing weather. We found everyone we met helpful and friendly and would certainly recommend Istanbul to our friends as a place to spend a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A true home from home”
Reviews.Author: AEMLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at Hotel Dersaadet last month to celebrate her 60th birthday. From the moment we arrived at the hotel in the early morning (seriously delayed because of snow), the staff bent over backwards to make us feel welcome. The location is perfect - ten minutes walk from most of the key sites, but on a quiet back street, the view from the restaurant and rooms on the upper floors is magnificent, everything is clean and tidy and the atmosphere is relaxed and friendly. I cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Superb week in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sneilk
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel based on reviews I read on this site. The incredible reviews were all well deserved. The hotel itself was lovely and immaculate in every way. The breakfast room upstairs had lovely views overlooking the sea and the food was excellent. The beds were orthopedic and the room itself was large, spotless and quiet, again with a view to the sea. The bedroom slippers were a nice touch. The hotel was very well located and close to everything we wanted to see. For me, the best thing about this hotel was the extremely high level of service provided by the caring and highly trained hotel staff. Without exception, each person who works there is committed to providing personalized service to each guest. The staff was both professional and caring, but never intrusive. Cemil, the breakfast waiter and Donit, the office manager were just two stand-outs in a group of people who helped to make our trip to Istanbul very special. I expect to return to Istanbul in May and hope to be lucky enough to get a reservation at this hotel again. I will book it soon.

Reviews.Title: “Pied-a-terre for the lovers of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Jo_largas
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located in a quiet corner of otherwise super-touristy Sultanhamet. The hotel looks down Bosporus, and some rooms have the tranquil view over the water. The hotel has a tasteful, authentic appearance and decor, but provides modern facilities (plus free internet connection) and spotlessly clean. Knowledgeable staff are extremely resourceful and helpful, and the guest book I quickly looked in confirmed that. It basically feels like a home, especially when you come in from the busy neighbourhood. Pity that there are not many places to eat in the neighbourhood, but the European side where restaurants concentrate is just a tram-ride away, and Istanbul is a pleasant place to have a quiet stroll back in the evening from the Sultanhamet tram station. They will pick you up from the Ataturk airport if you are staying 4 nights or more. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ellegaard
Reviews.Content: 8 of us have just returned from a really enjoyable 4 days staying at the Dersaadet Hotel. I booked online after reading complimentary reviews on Tripadvisor. They were not wrong! It's a small hotel staffed by very helpful people, particularly Umit, the Front Office Manager, and Billur his excellent assistant. Impressive value for money. Even the owner, Deniz Duyar, came up to the little roof-top bar late in the evening to welcome us. Location is perfect for all the top Istanbul sights - the Blue Mosque (visible from the roof-top breakfast room) is less than 5 minutes walk. Rooms are comfortable and well equipped. The breakfast is good, tasty and plentiful. There's free internet access in the lobby as well as free Wi-fi in the bedrooms. They organised a very efficient airport pickup service for us. Finally, the best thing they did for us was to advise on restaurants (you must go to Amedros) and excursions. Nothing was too much trouble for them - they just pick up the phone and it's done! What more can I say? Do yourself a favour and stay here - I don't think you'll regret it.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MiguelBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: I go to Istanbul about once a year and this is the fourth time I stay at the Dersaadet hotel. It is an amazing boutique hotel, beautifully restored, very comfortable, in a great location, and with, most importantly, wonderful people. The staff is not only extremely nice (always smiling!) but also incredibly helpful and knowledgeable. This hotel (and, once again, its staff!) is a gem in Istanbul. Not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Astrogirl1979
Reviews.Content: I donâ€™t normally write reviews but this hotel is so fantastic and the service was so good I just had to write. I got the recommendation for the hotel from Trip Advisor and the hotel lived up to all its positive comments. The staffs were so helpful and were happy to answer all our questions. The location is great and walking distance of all the major attractions. The blue mosque is a 2 minute walk. The rooms were nice and clean and the hotel felt very cosy. Would stay here again and would recommend to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Dedphred
Reviews.Content: We were a group of four women "of a certain age". We thought the Dersaadet was fabulous!! We arrived at night, tired from a long flight from the west coast of the US. They brought us tea when we registered in their pleasant lobby, took us instantly to our rooms, advised us about a nearby restaurant and made the transition very easy for us. The next morning we ate breakfast on the rooftop, taking in the gorgeous views of the Sea of Marmaris, ships moving along the sea lanes, and the Blue Mosque. It has to be one of the finest views in Istanbul. Breakfast was wonderful--a large selection of breads and cakes, cheese, meats, hard boiled eggs and endless coffee. We began our explorations with maps and directions supplied by the desk staff who were so patient with our questions--for our entire three day stay. Our rooms were simple and clean with gorgeous views of the nearby mosque and the sea. The elevator made our climb to our 5th floor room effortless. The old town area where the hotel is located is full of interesting shops, architecture, historical sights and restaurants. We walked to everything--The Grand Bazaar, the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Cisterns--all within 20 minutes easy walking for us oldsters. I don't think we could have found a nicer place to stay and the prices was very reasonable. The hotel staff arranged for a car and driver for us one afternoon. We covered a lot of ground for a very reasonable price--much less than any of the organized tours available and so much easier with only four people. The hotel goes out of its way to make their clients comfortable and happy. I don't think we could have found another hotel to suit our little group so well. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: allison_coburg
Reviews.Content: My wife had to go to a congress and so I went with her to Istanbul where everyone stayed in the Desaarat. We had a very nice stay, even if it was in one of the "standard" rooms, the was no way of complaining about the standard package included. Safe, slippers, bathrobes, weather forecast card every night on the bed, some sweets, bottle of water supplied.security seems to be a big issue, every car is checked even with a mirror to see underneeth. Luguage is passed through an X-ray machine, also every bag when you re-enter the building goes through it.Staff is very helpful, no problem when you need a cab, a map of Istanbul (two kinds: touristic one and detailed with all the streets - but the last one you have to ask specially), also good help in the Spa (Laveda) even if you forget a comb or toothpaste it is no extra effort !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peritomoreno
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days here. Corner suites being refurbished so we were given an upgrade to the 'Sultan Suite' for 2 nights, with the other 2 nights in a standard room, all with an appropriate financial reduction. The Sultan Suite is impressive, palatial decor - nice views toward the sea. The standard room is just that - standard - no frills, but everything you need, although some more drawer space would have been welcome. Breakfast is on the roof terrace, indoor or outdoor, nice view of Bosphorous and Blue Mosque. Turkish style buffet, cold meats, eggs, yoghurt, cheese etc - all very nice. Hotel is 5 minutes from Blue Mosque, 10 mins from Aya Sofya, 15 minutes from Topkapi - so ideal for sightseeing. General area is pretty quiet at night when the tourists have gone - but perfectly safe. A few restaurants locally, but 10 minutes walk to get a selection. All staff were superb, courteous and very helpful with advice on boat schedules, restaurant, etc. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dersaadet”
Reviews.Author: ava10_8
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We stayed last summer with two children (8 and 10) and a grandad and would definitely go back. The building is charming, the location great and although our rooms were small they were comfortable. The rooftop terrace breakfast buffet was lovely with wonderful views. Best was the warm welcome and friendly and helpful staff. On the first morning the manager went out of his way to tell us about places of interest and give helpful advice.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel...fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: enmsmommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel by the recommendation from tripadviosr. WE were very pleased with this hotel. I stayed her with my husband and two children. We were picked up from the airport and whisked away to the hotel. The hotel is in a residential location. We were on the third floor in a corner room. 1. The hotel is in a great location. You can walk to the all of the sights, restaurants and to the public tram. 2. The room was nice. It was not overly decorated or furnished, but it suited our needs. There was a queen size bed, a single and a cot in our room. 3. The staff was very helpful and kind. They were always smiling and helped us with any questions we had and gave us suggestions on places to eat with our children. 4. The morning breakfast was very good. The food was good and so was the coffee. The views from the rooftop were a wonderful way to start the day. 5. The only problem that we encountered with the hotel was when the electricity went out for an hour or so. Not the hotels fault, and the problem was fixed in a timely manner. Apparently, it happens quite a bit. We had a great stay in this hotel and would recommend it to anyone. Turkey was a very nice place to visit. The people are very friendly, especially to children.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a residence”
Reviews.Author: Lintogo
Reviews.Content: There is nothing negative to say about this hotel. It truly feels as if one is staying in a friend's home. The staff is exceptionally helpful, gracious, and knowledgable, the rooms spacious and immaculate, the ambiance warm. As a bonus, it is very well located for those wishing to sightsee, being walking distance from major sites. LSA, NY

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Gaius_Tacitus
Reviews.Content: What an excellent hotel! I researched this hotel through Trip Advisor and I was very glad I did. The Dersaadet was everything I expected and more. There were so many pluses it's hard to know where to begin. Firstly, I had a great view from my window towards the Sea of Marmara. (Note: there are some rooms without this type of view so don't forget to ask when you book) The rooms were clean and quiet and the small, open air breakfast lounge/beer garden on the roof of the hotel was perfect. Again, with a magnificent view. You can see the minarets of the Blue Mosque but a stone's throw away and the never ending ocean traffic through the Bosporus had me captivated. I sat there on my first night in Istanbul sipping a cold beer and listening to the adhan just after sunset, wow! The location can't be beaten, if you first wish to explore Istanbul's older quarter, and it is close to all the major sites on the south side of the Golden Horn. The Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome, the Basilica Cistern and Hagia Sophia are all less than twenty minutes walk away. Deniz (the owner/manager) and his staff were very friendly and attentive and went out of their way to make my stay pleasant. They even had a laptop computer set up in the small foyer lounge that guests could use to collect e-mail etc. for free. After a very enjoyable week there I joined a tour group and unfortunately had to relocate to the Taksim Square Hotel. Sadly many steps down on the hotel star ladder. I missed the Dersaadet very much. I would highly recommend the Dersaadet. It is a boutique hotel though and quite old so please don't expect every last facet of the hotel to be 100% perfect. It's NOT one of the big chain hotels and for that reason alone, it has infinitely more charm. It's the perfect hotel for a lone traveller or a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Charming”
Reviews.Author: mivodrums
Reviews.Content: I travel to Istanbul on business twice a year. After staying in several hotels, I have found my new home away from home. This charming small hotel is in a restored Ottoman style home, with great attention paid to the smallest details. Hand-painted ceilings, hard wood floors, patterned tile bathrooms, embroidered table cloths, kilms everywhere...just beautiful. The panoramic view of the Sea of Marmora from the rooftop breakfast room and patio is outstanding and also includes a view of the Blue Mosque. The location couldn't be better. Just blocks from the Arasta Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hiipdrome, Hagia Sophia, and Topkapi. Best of all, however, is the staff....very friendly and helpful. The owner (Dennis) has an MBA form the states and runs a first class shop. He just added free wi-fi in every room while I was there. There's even a laptop in the lobby if you don't bring your own. Can you tell I like this hotel? I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: yozoyozo
Reviews.Content: Date: December 11, 2007 Reviewer: Toshi, Ibaraki Japan I stayed the hotel 8days from 30th Nov. Just as another reviewer, I had requested pick up service. The flight delayed almost an hour and I was quite uneasy when I arrived the airport. But I was greeted with the hotel staff's hearty smile. The location of the hotel is very quiet but for the Koran from the nearby mosques and convenient enough.The view from the room and roof terrace is great. But I was impressed most by all the staff. The hotel and the room was always kept very clean. Though my English is quite poor, my every request was fulfiled very quickly. And especially, I always found their smiles. We were so happy that my wife urged me to send them the mail of thanks the first thing we returnd home.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: melis_82
Reviews.Content: Dersaadet is a wonderful hotel, I really can't recommend it enough. From the beginning of my stay to the end, the service was truly excellent. Despite delays of over an hour, the gentlemen sent from the hotel to collect me from Ataturk airport was waiting for me as I arrived (the collection service is free if you stay at the hotel for over three days). The rooms are thoroughly cleaned everyday, there is free internet access, a truly amazing view from the terrace, and the location is great (walking distance to all the major historical attractions). However, it is the staff which make this hotel particularly pleasant. I was in Istanbul alone, and really appreciated the sense of friendship provided by the staff (particularly Umit and Eser), who were ever friendly, helpful and smiling.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Molandtang
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Dersaadet in Istanbul and we can only wholeheartedly concur with previous 5 star reviews while adding thoughts of our own. I would highly recommend the Dersaadet to anyone wishing to enjoy a holiday in Turkeyâ€™s famous city. We booked our trip via the hotelâ€™s website based on the tripadvisor reviews and all booking details were dealt with efficiently by the hotel staff. Upon arrival we were met by the hotelâ€™s pick-up service and driven into the heart of the Sultanahmet district. The hotelâ€™s location was very conveniently located only minutes away from the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia and in turn only minutes away from the tram stop to allow for easy travelling to other areas of the city. We stayed in the sea view room which was comfortable and always immaculately cleaned each day. Each morning the generous breakfast on the roof was enjoyed overlooking the waters of the Marmara with the Blue Mosque looking on. While these are all aspects and highlights that can be found in many other hotels in the world, what perhaps makes the Dersaadet stand out is the effort of the staff to make you feel at home. In fact I donâ€™t think I have ever stayed in a hotel in which I have genuinely felt sad to say goodbye to those who work there. It was as if we had popped over to Istanbul and stayed with old friends. We were always welcomed with a smile and all requests were dealt with immediately while any advice we needed was dutifully and enthusiastically given. The whole team deserve to accept these plaudits but in particular Umitâ€™s friendliness and professionalism was something that my girlfriend and I could warmly take away with us and fondly remember. Dersaadet really was a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from Istanbul and stayed at the Dersaadet Hotel. Our experience in Istanbul was absolutely wonderful, in large part because of the hospitality, location and safety of this hotel. We were picked up at the airport by a complimentary hotel shuttle which was a great convenience as we were two women who arrived in the city at night. When we got to the hotel we were greeted by Umet, a very friendly, polite and knowledgeable concierge. Our room was clean, spacious and comfortable. We had breakfast every morning on the roof top terrace with a view of the Bosphorous. Although the hotel is located close to all the major attractions, like the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, the tram line is close by for those who prefer. We opted to walk everywhere and enjoyed the neighborhoods, which are hilly like our hometown of San Francisco! The neighborhood shop keepers and locals are very friendly and helped us out when we got lost in some of the more condense neighborhoods with very winding streets. The staff at the Dersaadet made recommendations for restaurants, some of which actually sent a shuttle to the hotel to pick us up. We plan on going back to Istanbul in the near future to explore more of Turkey and would definitely stay at the Dersaadet again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Turkish Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Pretty27
Reviews.Content: We had such a wonderful stay at the Dersaadet. From the staff to the traditional breakfast on the terrace to the gorgeous location, we could not have asked for a better small hotel. Denis is an extremely professional and attentive manager who is full of helpful tips and insights into Turkish culture. The staff catered to our every need. We cannot wait to come back to this gem of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Whykickamoocow
Reviews.Content: We arrived home in Sydney yesterday and I would like to say â€œthank youâ€� to all the team at Hotel Dersaadet for a slendid week there in October. We enjoyed our time in Turkey and especially the warm hospitality and service at the hotel. We also appreciated the 24 hour availability of the free internet which is very comforting when you are so far from home. We greatly enjoyed the breakfasts and especially the warm smile and helpful advice we always received at the front deskâ€¦â€¦.we felt like one of the family especially when the staff waved us off when we left by taxi.Great hotel....good value and pefectly placed for tourists to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “What a delight!”
Reviews.Author: Mammakelster
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 young sons (5 and 6 y.o.) and I stayed at this charming hotel for 4 days in December and 4 days in Jan '06/07, (at the start and end of our 5 wks in Turkey) and would highly recommend it to anyone. Denis and his staff were extremely friendly, welcoming and helpful and spoke excellent English. They were also happy to store some of our luggage for a few weeks at no cost. There is a gorgeous lounge area off the foyer with tables, chairs, books and free internet access. There are lovely amenities in the bathrooms, and a lot of careful attention has been paid to all of the decor. One of the main highlights was the rooftop breakfast - not only the stunning views across the bosphorous one way, and towards the blue mosque the other, but what delicious treats! As well as the usual Turkish fare of bread, eggs, olives, cheese etc..., there were cereals, divine homemade sweet and savoury pastries and real coffee with real milk (not easy to find in Turkey). Our triple room was lovely, but a tad cramped for the 4 of us - the boys were fine to top and tail in the single, but there was little floor space for all our stuff. We contemplated changing to a suite, but would have then been blowing the budget a bit. the triple was fine - we'd stay in it again. A stay of 4 consecutive nights gives you a free airport pick up or drop off, which is also really handy. As for the location, there are many restaurants nearby, as well as craft shops etc and it's a very short stroll up to the centre of Sultanahmet. We remember our stay very fondly and hope to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Cheers for Dersaadet”
Reviews.Author: EmmyOrlando
Reviews.Content: We returned yesterday from our trip to Istanbul and we feel as if we left our home there when we left the Dersaadet. The key to the hotel's excellence is the staff. They are the most friendly, helpful and caring group ever. The rooms and lobby were perfect restorations except for the private baths which were fully modern and bright. The rooftop breakfast and cafe area look out over the Sea of Marmara as the ships enter the Bosporus. A slight turn of the head and there are the domes and minerets of the Blue Mosque. The food was delicous. A quick walk on the cobbled back streets leads to all the most important historic sites. We strong recommend Deniz and his outstanding staff as the best small hotel in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ZuzuBangalore
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights from the 2nd of November. We picked the hotel based on reviews on tripadvisor and we weren't dissappointed. Perfect location with nearly everything a stone throw's away; and some beautiful restaurants within 5 min walking distance. We were put up at 502 which has a nice view of the sea. The room is a bit small, but very cozy. Wish the toilet was a bit larger. The thing about this hotel is their staff, which were excellent. Wonderful people who really made our stay very comfortable. Sunay, Umit, Billur, Essar..... thanks a lot! Would surely stay again, albeit at the sultan's suite. (we got a peek on our last day there)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Lucy1974
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault the service or the location. The bathroom was tiny, the bed linen rather scratchy and the room small. The breakfast was average. You get what you pay for I suppose!

Reviews.Title: “Great Personal Service”
Reviews.Author: PorkySydney
Reviews.Content: I booked the Dersaadet after all the favourable reviews from Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. It was a charming little boutique hotel privately run just about 10 minutes walk to all the tourist attractions. The front desk staff were very helpful and we were provided with all the necessary information we need to know to get around. Breakfast was of good quality and plentiful and all the staff were very friendly and polite. We regret we only stayed at the hotel for only 1 night after our coach tour. When we check out, the front desk manager saw us to our pickup vehicle to the airport and thanking us for stay which you will happen when you stay at a commercial hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A taste of old Turkish hospitality”
Reviews.Author: RayattheBay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dersaadet for five nights in October, and I have to concur with the great majority of reviews below (upon which we chose this hotel in the first place). The hotel is a little gem, being small, beautifully kept and terrifically located, just a couple of hundred paces from the southern end of the Hippodrome, in one direction and the Bosphorus in another. We booked the Sultan's Penthouse Suite, which is a very nice place to stay, with views over the Bosphorus and lots of lovely wood everywhere. Breakfasts were good, as has been noted, and the house-keeping was excellent (we left a half-eaten bag of roasted chestnuts in our room, and the maid emptied the discarded shells and folded the bag up nicely for our return - truly beyond the call of duty). The other staff were likewise courteous, knowledgeable and friendly. If you don't want corporate blandness, gyms and swimming pools, but would prefer family-run intimacy right in the heart of the city, the Dersaadet could be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wrldtvlr26
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel. Breakfast on the top floor is not only delicious but worth the trip for the view. The staff was friendly and helpful. I was provided lots of advice about touring Istanbul, including where to eat and shop. Clean, reasonably priced and well situated in the heart of the city. If you're looking for a nice place to stay without breaking the bank, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Paloma26
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Dersaadet far surpassed my expectations, even though I read many positive reviews on TripAdvisor and based my selection on them. It was a wonderful experience. Every aspect of this small, charming hotel was simply outstanding. The hotel arranged an air-conditioned car to meet me at the airport, a great help after a long flight to an unknown city where I didn't know the language. This was a nice beginning. My very comfortable and attractive room, enhanced by traditional, hand-painted designs on the ceiling, had a lovely view to the sea, a wonderful sight at any time of day or evening. (While I was completely satisfied with the room, I also learned that the staff will try to accommodate a guest's special wishes, too.) The bathroom was very pleasant, tiled in charming, color-coordinated tiles. Both the room and the bathroom were kept spotlessly clean, fresh and well-supplied by housekeeping. The hotel's roof terrace is a marvelous feature which I enjoyed every morning and many evenings. The very good and varied buffet breakfast is served there, as well as drinks at other times of day. At breakfast, I loved the fresh melon and watermelon, dried apricots and raisins, cereals, cheese, sliced meats, homemade baked goods and their (optional) wonderful Turkish coffee. It was a great way to begin the day, to chat with other guests and the staff, and to simply soak up the view, sea breeze and Mediterranean environment. I really loved the wonderful view from this terrace toward the Blue Mosque and over the rooftops to the sea. Sitting there in the evening having some light refreshments, with the lighted mosque on one side and the lights of the Bosphorus on another side, and sometimes the moon rising over the water, was one of my favorite ways to relax at the end of the day. Last but definitely not least, I was impressed by the warm, friendly atmosphere and the amazing level of service provided by everyone I encountered on the staff. They really shine in this area, making me feel at home and among friends. The staff were always available to help, for example, assisting guests if requested in making plans for the day, suggesting interesting places to visit or to dine, helping to understand local customs, finding boat schedules, calling taxis and making dinner reservations, even offering to locate a doctor for a guest in need and then offering to get the prescriptions filled at the pharmacy -- and much more. All is done in a relaxed, courteous, competent and friendly manner. I can't say enough about how much I enjoyed my stay and would highly recommend it without reservation to anyone who wants a charming, well-located, lovely and friendly hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: MandiZm
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with all of the other reviews. This is a truly great hotel. I have never had such warm, wonderful service. The staff is truly exceptional. The hotel rooms and common areas are immaculately clean. Housecleaning was spectacular. Terrific views at breakfast on the rooftop terrace. (We capped each evening with a cocktail on the terrace and checked our e-mail with our laptop. The hotel has wireless in the terrace and lobby). We stayed in room 401 (sea view double). Great view, nice size room. Cozy furnishings. This hotel is a great value for the experience. We were able to walk to all the major sites. The hotel itself is in a quiet residential neighborhood which we just loved. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: xaxalala
Reviews.Content: What a great little gem ! We alyways look for small, "boutique-like" hotels when travelling. I can only reiterate this website's reviews of the Dersaadet. One notice though; the Dersaadet is not a hotel for people looking for a 7-star accomodation and designer luxury. It is a simple, tastefully decorated and highly attractive ottoman building, ideal for travellers who appreciate local flavours and a personal touch. After a few months of procrastination, I finally post this review of our hotel stay of march 9th to the 13th. My husband and I stayed 4 nights, had a very small but very comfy room on the 1st floor (one above the ground level). As we booked over the Internet and paid cash, we paid only 63â‚¬/night for a double room with breakfast. And free wi-fi internet was also a feature that made us choose the Dersaadet. It worked perfectly especially from the rooftop bar. A definite plus. There was no carpet in our room (which is my criteria # 1 in choosing hotels - criteria # 2 beeing wi-fi internet). It had a very modern but also very small bathroom, good water pressure, clean towels and bedsheets, rather smallish but very good mattresses, very friendly reception services (in English and also a bit of German). There is a lift in the hotel too. The breakfast/lunch roof-terrace/bar is absolutely lovely and even offers a partial view of the Blue Mosque and the water. Right in the middle of Sultanahmet, it is conveniently located to many touristic attractions (Ayasofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand and Spice Bazaars, Basilica Cistern, etc). It's also easily accessible from the AtatÃ¼rk Airport. If you are willing to get your feet moving, you can reach so many attractions by foot from the hotel without a problem. Sultanahmet is a "real" neighborhood so the houses around are not out of a Disney attraction park, you see how some people really live and work in today's Istanbul. Definitely worth a visit is the Taksim quarter of Istanbul, situated on the other of the city. That's where "real" life in today's Istanbul is happening. Cool, metropolitan and extremely european in it's feel. Another big plus; as we had stayed 4 nights, we also had a free airport pick-up included in the price which was really appreciated. We flew with Turkish Airlines from Berlin to Istanbul and I must admit, and my husband and I travel quite a lot, that it was the most relaxed flight we had in a long time. There are lots of restaurants in the aera; charcoaled lamb meat is definitely a delicious turkish specialty, so is pomegranate juice and their strong turkish coffee :-) On our last day at the hotel, I asked the assistant manager to show us the suite situated at the corner of the hotel. The right room for more luxury, comfort and space. One thing really stuck me in Istanbul; the amount of cats !! A local told us that the authorities tolerate their massive presence as they keep the mice and rat population under control. I found this to be an interesting touch. And the colors and smells of the markets... Quite unique. All in all, this is the hotel we will stay at next time we have the joy of visiting Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth going just for the lift (elevator)”
Reviews.Author: M_Bates
Reviews.Content: Very hard to fault this character-filled hotel in the old city. Clean, comfortable room at a very reasonable rate. Restaurant/bar on the roof with views over the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus. Staff very helpful and friendly. Could not recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Warm accomodations and incredible service at Dersaadet Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: hether
Reviews.Content: We spent four days at Dersaadet Hotel in Istanbul and it was a great place. The rooms are impeccibly clean, and the downstairs common area and rooftop common areas were delightful places to spend downtime. My family and I enjoyed the variety of foods availble for breakfast while enjoying the amazing view from the rooftop dining room. We were able to walk just about everywhere we wanted to go during the day; it's close to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Grand Bazaar, etc. And the extremely helpful staff takes as much time as you need to give directions and answer questions. I would highly recommend Dersaadet!

Reviews.Title: “Desaaded is a real HOME and location, location...”
Reviews.Author: Wolfra
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in a cornersuite (second floor). The room was great and spacious and very clean with little bit of seaview. It was furnished in traditional style. The beds are a little bit hard and the bathroom was very smal. The hotel is situated, 50 mtr from the Blue Mosque, in a rather quiet street. There can be some noise from a carwash opposite the hotel. During the nights it is very silent. Early in the morning the mosques calls for the prayers and you will be awakend (also in all other hotels in Istanbul). The staf is very friendly and does everything for you to make your stay very comfortable. Every question gets an answer. We had a realy good time here. The hotel has a good price/quality relation. The man in the rooftop terrace was always very attentive and friendly and become a little friend. The breakfast was good; the choice was rather limited. When you don't like the sausage you only can take the cheese. When we visit Istanbul again, we will choise for the Dersaaded again and will highly recommend this nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dersaadet in Sultanahmet in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: TEAAlefty
Reviews.Content: The Dersaadet Hotel in Sultanahmet is fantastic. It has a great location, but more than that a fabulously congenial and helpful staff. Every person we met, from the owner to the rooftop cafe server, was kind, gracious, and helpful. I cannot praise the service too much. Additionally, we had complimentary airport pickup and delivery (we stayed 8 nights), and we had a 10% discount for paying in cash (any major currency accepted). The breakfasts, included in the daily rate, were outstanding, and nothing beats starting the day by looking out over the Sea of Marmara or around up at the Blue Mosque. In the immediate neighborhood are a laundry, a bookstore with daily newspapers, a bath/haman, barber, restaurants, curio/handicraft shops (including an excellent watercolorist, Kubilay Senses, who does landmark scenes), shops for bottled water and snacks, the Hippodrome, and an entrance to the Arasta Bazaar a block away. The location is in easy walking distance to all the Old City sites from Beyazit Square/Grand Bazaar to Topkapi. The tram stop of Sultanahmet (marker for the currency exchange office just behind it) allows you to take the inexpensive tram anywhere on its route. Yes, the rooms are small, but we were rarely at the hotel except for tea and sleep; therefore, size of rooms was no issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “Eight wonderful nights”
Reviews.Author: NGOhio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent eight wonderful nights at the Dersaadet Hotel. We spent 5 nights in the Sultans Penthouse. THe room was very large with a lovely new bathroom. The view was wonderful and looked out over the whole city. We then moved to the corner suite, one floor below. This was a good size room with a queen and twin bed. I loved the rooftop breakfast with a gorgeous view. We have travelled to many parts of the world and stayed in all different kinds of hotels. The Dersaadet really sets itself apart because of the wonderful staff. They simply cannot do enough for you. Every single staff member went out of their way to welcome us. My husband and I wanted to visit the leather outlet shops near the airport and were prepared to take a taxi. Instead, they arranged a ride for us with one of their taxi drivers. I highly reccommend the Dersaadet Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: scarpia
Reviews.Content: The Dersaadet Hotel is a very friendly little hotel in walking distance to all the main tourist attactions in Istanbul. For the price you couldn't ask for more. As with most traveling outside the U.S., the beds could be a tad more comfortable and with any place in a Muslim country you will wake up earlier than you want when the call to prayer happens. But this little hotel was ideal. The staff couldn't have been more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A traditional ottoman hotel”
Reviews.Author: foodiesfnative
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from my vacation to Istanbul and Greece. We were only in Istanbul for two full days. Looking back in hind sight, I wish that we had at least a couple more days to tour Istanbul. This hotel was centrally located. It was great to be able to walk to all the popular sites, and nice to stay in a place with so much culture. This is a traditional Ottamon style hotel. We got a room with a view, but note that the windows are very small, so not sure if a room with a view is worth the upgrade. The people here are very friendly, especailly Amat and Sunay. Amat gave us some great recommendations of where to eat. One of our favorite throughout our trip was Refik in the area referred to Taxim. Don't expect a menu here. They come around with plates of mezes and you chose from the various options. This area was filled with locals. Therefore, it was nice to see how they spend their free time. Overall, it was a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly base in Sultanamet”
Reviews.Author: bromsgrovian
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights in late September 2007. We are regular visitors to Istanbul and normally stay at Hotel Alzar on the Hippodrome but this hotel was full. The Dersaadet is typical of many smaller bed and breakfast hotels in this area and is just behind the Blue Mosque and if you pick the right room has splendid views of the Sea of Marmara. Our room was fairly basic but had everthing you would want for a short stay but we could have done with a bit more wardrobe space and an additional pillow each. There was some street noise at night mainly due to Ramadan celebrations going on fairly late but this was only a minor inconvenience. Service at the Dersaadet could not be faulted and the staff are some of the friendliest we have experienced anywhere in a hotel. Their help and advice to first time visitors is excellent and the free internet access is a plus point. The location is good but there are better in this area and whilst the roof terrace is an attractive feature, breakfast here, we felt, was a little basic compared to the Alzar. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would consider returning but only if we could not get into the Alzar.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: JanPan50
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the end of September - me and my husband. Absolutely loved the hotel and had a great break. The room and hotel interior was lovely - tastefully furnished and decorated in traditional style. The staff were faultless - helpful and informative and spot on in terms of service and friendliness. Location was very good being in the middle of the old Sultanahmet district. Breakfast was excellent with a good buffet choice but the best bit is the roof top breakfast room/bar with views over the Bosphorus and Blue Mosque - perfect to relax here after a hard day's sightseeing. Internet access is free in the lobby/lounge. We used the hotel pick up car to take us back to the airport - more expensive than a taxi but so reliable, courteous and safe driver etc!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: AGMoore
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very well located. We loved being able to be so close to so many of the great Istanbul sites. The terrace was great for both breakfast and late afternoon drinks. We loved being up there and found it very relaxing. The view of the Blue Mosic and the Sea of Marmara was wonderful!! The staff was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was very good. The room was small but adequate. The bathroom and shower were very small. We would recommend this hotel to others. We enjoyed our stay here. We paid cash and got a somewhat lower rate. This was nice, too.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful way to experience Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: World'sTraveler
Reviews.Content: The house itself is wonderful to experience, but most memorable is the extraordinary helpful and graceous service rendered by the staff. The terrific Turkish-style breakfast served on the roof in the shadow of the Blue Mosque is an experience in itself. And after a full, exciting day exploring the city, what ould be better than a glass of wne (or beer) gazing up to the Blue Mosque's lighted minarets. But definitely not a place for people who prefer "Hilton-like" surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “warm and friendly”
Reviews.Author: burgmantulalip
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay at the Dersaadet Hotel. The room was comfortable, and the top floor breakfast was not only good, but presented by very warm and friendly staff. The view of the sea made the start of the day even more enjoyable. The location was perfect for those intending to see the "old town".

Reviews.Title: “Small but Great hotel with Perfect staff”
Reviews.Author: DOLCEVITAinTOKYO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dersaadet hotel for 7nights in early SEP 2007. 2nights in Sultan's Penthouse Suite, 2nights in Triple room and 3nights in Dersaadet Corner Suite. I stayed in 3 types of rooms. All the rooms were very clean and comfortable with tasteful interior decoration. I strongly recommend Sultan's Penthouse Suite to all the couples who want to make their holidays "romantic "ones. The interior was so gorgeous but chic,which is called "Ottoman style". Though I liked Dersaadet Corner Suite the best because it made me felt most comfortable and it was an appropriate-sized room which is large enough. The most important fact to remember is that the wonderful hotel consists of talented staff.They were all doing their best to make my stay a comfortable one. I traveled alone, but a friendly front desk staff(Yes,Mr.Sunay. It's YOU!)talked with me everyday and gave me so much useful advice about my sightseeing. Of course, all the other staff showed me kind hospitality and friendly smile,too,which was very much appreciated. Everything they do made it possible for me to stay without feeling loneliness at all . I felt as if the Dersaadet "MY HOME"while in Istanbul. I look forward to staying at the Fantastic hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: rubybouvier
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a total of 4 nights at the Dersaadet Hotel. The staff are very attentive and helpful; they went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. The rooftop terrace offers a wonderful view of the Blue Mosque and of the Marmara Sea. The breakfasts are excellent, with a great selection of fresh fruit and freshly baked pastries. The location can't be beat; a short walk from the Hippodrome, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia.

Reviews.Title: “The Desirable Dersaadet”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeofYork
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights after 3 nights at the Niles Hotel which see,and were very well satisfied in all respects. Location is quiet and convenient for major places of interest, 5 minutes-a bit uphill - to the Blue Mosque and Hagya Sofia, and 10 to the fast tram service; the staff are well trained, most obliging and cheerful . The standard double room was comfortable with a view over a minaret to the sea; the bathroom was OK - though the bath was small. All areas were very clean. You can choose from a wide choice at breakfast in the rooftop restaurant with its great view down over the Sea of Marmara and also uphill to the Blue Mosque. As in most areas of Istanbul, you can be awakened early by the morning call to prayer - useful if you want to take photographs in the Blue Mosque/Hagya Sofia area before the streets fill up with coach loads of tourists. A taxi to the airport, arranged by the front desk, is 20 Euros. and well worth it, we thought. (Taxis are really cheap for local runs) We would not recommend dining at restaurants putting on dancing displays at dinner - they are grossly expensive. The excellent Fener fish restaurant will provide a free taxi from and back to the hotel. We would certainly book into the Dersaadet if returning to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home, Incredibly friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dfmirand
Reviews.Content: The Dersaadet hotel is within walking distance of all the major sites in Sultanahmet. The staff is among the friendliest I have seen anywhere. Everyone from the front desk staff to the housekeeping staff made sure we were made to feel welcome. The terrace (where breakfast is served daily) has a great view of the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque. It is also open till midnight so guest can just relax there after a long day of sightseeing. My first few days at the Dersaadet I was in one of the lower single rooms. While the room I was in was small, it was clean and quiet. After two days I moved to one of the upper suites. These suites are big and beautifully decorated. Our room had a view of the Sea of Marmara. All rooms whether suites or smaller single rooms are inpeccably clean and well maintained. Throughout my stay at the Dersaadet the staff made sure that I was happy. I was also asked how my day went or if I needed anything. For a taste of Turkish hospitality and conveniance to Istanbul's major sites, the Dersaadet can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “A week in the Suite”
Reviews.Author: El_Huevo
Reviews.Content: We (3 of us) stayed in the Sultan Suite for a week in early Sept, 2007 and chose the hotel based on the TripAdviser reviews. We were not disappointed and many of the earlier reviews sum it up nicely. The location is great for the old town (very near the Hippodrome and Blue Mosque and a walk to most of the popular sights). The staff were very friendly and helpful and we ended up late most evenings on the terrace drinking coffee and looking at the Blue Mosque or out over the sea. The hotel has a deal with a local taxi company which saves you from the tricks of the dodgey drivers you sometimes get on the street. The bar serves limited food, but there are plenty of local restaurants. The Suite was very spacious, even with the extra bed we had, though it did get warm during the day if the air con wasn't left on. The reception area has an internet-linked computer for guest use which came in handy. This isn't a 5-star, full service hotel - it's a respectable, attractive, friendly, well-located hotel where you can eat, sleep and relax in comfort - which is what we wanted. Unless you want the trimmings of a 5-star hotel (gym, etc), then we'd happily recommend this hotel, and the Sultan Suite if you want to do it in a bit more style.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not that good.”
Reviews.Author: Arandale
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dersaadet for 4 nights in early Sept 07. The airport pickup worked fairly well (after some difficulty in locating the driver), and was excellent for the early-morning return trip to the airport. I can confirm that the hotel is located on a quiet street corner with a short (uphill) walk to the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia. My room (Room 202) was very small (see pictures), with a tiny bathroom, and after one night I asked for a larger room (for the 3rd & 4th nights I was given the larger (triple) room in the basement (Room 101)). I can't recommend the rooms on Levels 1 (the basement, with one room - 101) or 2 (street level, with two rooms - 201 & 202), which have small windows with no views & are poorly lit, yet they seem to be priced the same as the standard rooms on the higher floors (only the roof terrace and the floor below it (Level 5) have reasonable views). The service was very good and very attentive, and at breakfast we were presented with a reasonable choice (but no fresh fruit juices). The small roof-top terrace does have quite good views out to sea and up to the Blue Mosque. A free-access laptop in reception anables guests to use the Internet. The air-conditioning in the rooms worked well, but it wasn't silent! Overall, I can confirm that the Dersaadet provides very good service in a convenient location, but I think most of the standard rooms will disappoint those with inflated expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Dersaadet: Gem in the Heart of the Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: mginabq
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Dersaadet is a lovely, small, family-owned and managed property in the heart of the Sultanahmet (old city) of Istanbul. We had a double room on the 3rd floor that had a great view of the rooftops and walls of the old city, as well as the Bosphorus. We selected this hotel because of its high rating on TripAdvisor, and we weren't disappointed. We booked a ride from the airport to the hotel (when we were there it was included with a stay of three nights or more) , and when we stepped outside there was the driver just as planned. We were very glad to have used this service for a couple of reasons: (1) we speak no Turkish other than a few basic phrases that we learned; and, (2) it was unseasonably warm and the hotel's vehicle was air-conditioned, while many of the cabs in Istanbul are not. We arrived at the hotel about 11:00 AM and our room was ready, so we were allowed to check in. (Although we had flown overnight from New Mexico, we were eager to leave our belongings and begin exploring Istanbul right away. Since it was so hot, we went to the Cistern first, which was much cooler than the temperature on the streets and was an incredible place to behold.) This was our first adventure off the North American continent, so we were a bit surprised at the size of the room and adjoining bath, which were small by American standards. (I don't know why those of us from the US got the goofy idea that everything should super-sized, but we unfortunately have, and we need to get over it!) The room and bath were immaculately clean, and the furnishings were charming, with a beautifully decorated ceiling. The photos on the web site depict a really accurate picture, by the way, so if you really want to see what they look like, check that out. Our bed was two twins pushed together, with a nightstand and lamp on each side and a wardrobe for clothes storage. We were there to board a Wind Star cruise five days later, so we didn't unpack completly and instead stowed hanging clothes, but left the bulk of other items in our suitcases. There was no safe in the room, but we locked valuables a carry-on and had no trouble. You can check things at the front desk as well. Early each morning, the call to prayer could be heard from the speakers on minarets near the hotel, and that was totally magical. There is a rooftop terrace and breakfast room with a view of the Blue Mosque where a mini feast is served each morning. It included sliced meats, cheeses, and hard-boiled eggs and yogurt for us protein lovers, plus there were perfectly ripened tomatoes, cucumbers, melons, and other fruits including dates and figs. There were a couple kinds of cerelas and severals kinds of breads and pastries, as well as orange juice, which I believe was fresh-squeezed. The coffee was out of this world, as was the apple tea, which is served EVERYWHERE in Istanbul. The terrace was also open in the evenings; it was soothing way to end each day and begin each evening. We'd go up to the terrace and join other hotel guests to exchange stories of the day and drink a glass (or two!) of raki. In Turkey, raki is the unofficial 'national drink' and it is traditionally drunk mixed with water; the dilution causes this alcoholic beverage to turn a milky-white color, and possibly because of its color, this mixture is popularly called aslan sÃ¼tÃ¼ or arslan sÃ¼tÃ¼, both literally meaning "lion's milk" (aslan and arslan also mean strong, brave man, hence milk for the brave men). Very tasty and highly recommended! The hotel has a small elevator, but the stairs were actually a real treat as they were beautiful wood and went around and around. Given the fabulous food that is available througout the neighborhood right near the hotel, taking the stairs was one way to avoid piling on the pounds during our trip. The location of this property is ideal for those who wish to explore the major sites of Istanbul. We walked everywhere and felt totally safe day or night. I have heard from friends that Istanbul gives less of that feeling for women traveling alone, but we are a married couple and every single person we met throughout our five-day stay was lovely, save for one rug salesman who became beligerant when we declined to purchase a rug from him (we did buy four others from other vendors). Please remember to be respectful of local customs and beliefs: (1) For women, head, shoulders and knees are to be covered whenever entering a mosque. We saw an American (very embarrassing for us) woman who showed up at the Blue Mosque wearing a tube top and short shorts! One of the attendants outside the door quickly handed her several items to wrap around herself, averting his eyes the entire time. I found it very easy to roll up a skirt and a pashmina (both for sale everywherein the city) into day pack and then put them when needed. The expressions of thanks for my showing this simple courtesy were overwhelming. (2) Enthusiastic (some might say pushy) vendors trying to get people into their shops or restaurants is 'done' in Istanbul. While it may seem a bit over the top at times, generally if you simply enter the shop, have the apple tea and peruse the merchandise, most people don't care if you actually buy - they just want you to LOOK. If you're on limited time, however, you obviously can't enter every shop and look around. Say "no thank you" and move along. (3) The Grand Bazaar is one shop after another (over 4,000 of them) of the same kinds of things again and again. We found the Egyptian Spice Market to be a much more enjoyable and enchating place to shop. Many of the vendors have vacuum-sealing machines, so we were able to bring home olives and other "fresh" items. (4) The Eyewitness Guide to Istanbul was perfect for identifying all the fabulous places to see - allow a full day, if you have it, for Tokapi Palace and take the extra tour of the harem-it's fascinating. Also, the restaurant that overlooks the sea serves a wonderful lunch. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home!”
Reviews.Author: cruisinmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Dersaadet in June prior to boarding our cruise. I booked this boutique hotel based on the numerous positive reviews I have read here at Trip Advisor. I am happy to say that we had a wonderful stay! We had 2 triple rooms, one on the second floor and one on the third. We both had windows facing the sometimes mentioned "garage". It is only a car wash and we did hear it at times but it was not a bother. The windows were fairly well insulated so they buffered the carwash and the numerous "call to prayer" that occur throughout the day. The rooms were clean and simply furnished. My only negative about the room was that the beds were pretty hard. I had read from past reviews about getting a bed pad but we didn't bother with that. After walking around all day we were so tired that it didn't take much for us to drop off to sleep. The bathrooms were nice size, not large but not too small. We had plenty of hot water and water pressure. The hotel did lose power the morning of our last day but the staff worked like crazy to get it back on as quickly as possible. The one feature of this hotel that really served us well was the large sitting area next to reception. There were several tables, chairs, and a nice sofa. We spent many evenings there playing scrabble, using the hotel laptop and free internet, and just chatting with fellow guests. It gives you a comfortable place to relax outside your room. I am not a breakfast eater but the rest of my family thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast buffet that is included in the room rate. The location is very convenient to all the sights in Sultanahmet. We did not take a taxi once. We did take the hop on, hop off bus to see all the areas of Istanbul but if you want convenience in the older, historical area you will be happy with this hotel. The very best thing about this hotel is the staff. I know it is mentioned over and over again in the various reviews but the compliments are well deserved. We were greeted very warmly upon arrival, treated like family all week, and given a fond farewell when we left. I have travelled extensively around the world and I would rate the staff as one of the best we have ever had. True, the hotel is very small but the service is very big!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: SwannEngland
Reviews.Content: First time booking in Istanbul. We are a family with three children who were quite unsure of what to expect. The Hotel arranged airport pick up, were welcoming and all requests adhered to. The individual staff members were polite, knowledgable and nothing was too much trouble. Our comfort and quality of stay was utmost on their agenda. We looked forward to a sumptuous breakfast meal on the roof top terrace with wonderful views of nearby mosques and the Bosphorous. The regular calling to prayer was quite hypnotic! There is a garage on the street opposite, but only for car washing and this did not disturb us at any time. Our overall stay was 7 nights and no regrets at our choice of hotel. A big thank you to all the staff for making it so enjoyable. We shall return.

Reviews.Title: “faultless!”
Reviews.Author: ellie-dee
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Desraadet are amazing! They are friendly, helpful and on hand 24 hours a day. On arriving at the hotel, we were warmly welcomed by the receptionist and the duty manager. After settling into our room, we were encouraged to contact the duty manager for "orientation" This consisted of a twenty minute chat about the local area, where he answered lots of questions and gave us a map and guide book. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff at the Dersaadet! We were greeted with a smile at all times. The location of the Dersaadet is fantastic. It is a five minute walk from the Beautiful Blue Mosque, and about 10 minutes from Topkapi Palace.
