There is a bazaar just round the corner from the hotel, this is the best route to take to the Blue Mosque. At the end of the bazaar there are some restaurants where you can get very good apple tea. We walked down to the Grand Bazaar and the Spice Market, we found that we had to get very few taxis. Breakfast is served on the roof terrace which has an excellent view of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Chose it, loved it.”
Reviews.Author: fomalhaut
Reviews.Content: I chose the Dersaadet purely on the positive reviews it's received here. Having now stayed there I can confirm they are richly deserved. The hotel is located in a residential area, yet the Arasta Bazaar is just around the corner, and Sultanahmet Square, the heart of old Istanbul, is less than five minutes away. The interior of the hotel has a distinct Ottoman feel to it, with its attractive wooden decor adorned with stylish linen and carpets. The room itself was large, well provisioned, and boasted a pleasant view across the Sea of Marmara. The vistas from the delightful roof terrace were even more impressive, where I enjoyed the great breakfast and apple tea while watching ships glide serenely along the Bosphorus. What sets the Dersaadet apart though is the staff: they all spoke good English, and went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating at all times. I lost count of how many times Sunay or Billur spent ten minutes making recommendations or giving directions to me at reception. Staff never passed me without asking how I was or how my day had been. It was so refreshing to find a hotel where first rate service comes as standard. I have high expectations when choosing hotels, and feel they were all met or exceeded at the delightful Dersaadet.

Reviews.Title: “A risk worth taking”
Reviews.Author: Jacob_in_Florida
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Dersaadet started right with prompt pick-up at the port . Our rooms were airy and bright with crisp bed linens. The staff was courteous and helpful, assisiting with scheduling tours and dinner/ show bookings. We felt safe and were treated as one would expect from a top-notch boutique hotel. It was a risk not staying at the Ritz, but it was risk worth taking in beautiful Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that makes you feel at home.”
Reviews.Author: alicetingxu
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful boutique hotel that made me and my husband felt at home while in Turkey. The atmosphere is absolutely special in this hotel. We loved going to the terrace whenever we had a break from busy sightseeing, and enjoyed the occean breeze. Breakfast was my favorite part of the day, even though I have never had breakfast in my normal life. People in the hotel were not only super friendly, but also very professional. They made us feel totaly comfortable and happy. I have not had any problem during my stay for a week, and I would recommendate this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Dersaadet”
Reviews.Author: bristolreviewer
Reviews.Content: The Dersaadet is a delightful Ottoman hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet, the oldest part of Istanbul. Breakfasts are taken on a terrace with wonderful views of the Marmara sea and Blue Mosque (the terrace also acts as a bar until midnight) and the staff are unfailingly helpful. Rooms are furnished in traditional wood, but though small-ish, are well-equipped with TV, phone and min-bar/fridge, and good value at about Â£70 a night. Two particularly good local restaurants worth a visit are the Sera in the Hotel Armada, where the YTL58 chef's tasting menu gives you the chance to taste over a dozen dishes while you gaze over the Marmara sea from the wonderful terrace; and the fish restaurant allegedly favoured by the city's elite, the Balikci Sabahattin set in a garden in a surprisingly rundown neighbourhood. Full dinner with wine for two costs about YTL160 in both restaurants. Escaping Turkish food for a night, we greatly enjoyed the good value Dubb Indian restaurant, also nearby. Staying five nights, we had a free transfer from the airport, and the hotel car took us back for YTL30.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: myrasq
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Dersaadet Hotel three weeks ago. The staff, particularily Umit Ciftci, the front office manager, in this small, family run hotel were always so available, gracious, and helpful. We thought our seaview room was charming. Everything was spotlessly clean. Our breakfasts on the rooftop terrace were delicious. We had no problems whatsoever. The hotel's location is very convenient to major historical sights in Istanbul. The hotel's van is available for airport transportation. Within days of our checking out, we received a very nice thank you email from Umit. We will look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dersaadet is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: mjsuss
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Dersaadet for four nights and it was an extremely enjoyable time. The location in Sultanahmet was close to many of the major tourist sights and close enough to the other places of interest. We found that we could walk to the tram stop in about ten minutes and then we were on our way to the whole city, including across the Golden Horn. We walked all over town and it was always great to come "home" to our hotel and relax on the terrace with a cup of tea and Turkish Delight, while gazing out at the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara. It was hot, and the air conditioning worked well. Breakfasts were amazingly good, delicious, and more than ample. Free fast email in the lobby was a plus. The small size of the hotel made for personalized service.

Reviews.Title: “Your home in Istanbul !”
Reviews.Author: Luckmaster
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest small hotels you could choose in Istanbul. The location is great (heart of the Sultanahmet), the rooms are large and clean, the price is reasonable, but above all the staff is one of the friendliest, most helpful and kind that we have ever encountered. They are wonderful, and really do make you feel as though the Dersaadet is your "home" while you are enjoying their fantastic city. Thanks to Deniz, Ibo, and everyone at the Dersaadet that made our first experience in Istanbul so memorable! Bob and Elaine

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: rogerthat
Reviews.Content: The lcoation is perfect, staff is gracious & very helpful, and breakfast on the rooftop terrace offering Bosphorous views is a superb way to start the day. Rooms, however, have a bit of a shabby feel and air quality problems if windows are closed. Some sort of car maintenance operation across the street makes the setting quite noisey 12 hours a a day. Standard rooms are fairly small. Beds are not good. The bathroom sink drain didn't work properly in our junior suite and never was fixed during our four-day stay. Electricity went out several times. An in-room refrigerator didn't cool properly and also was not fixed despite a maintenance request on day one,. Dersaadet is not a bad budget choice, but it has far too many shortcomings to seriously be ranked a top choice either in its price category or in the Sultanahmet nerighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff at a great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaWoman1
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Dersaadet and loved every minute. Good beds, delightful, clean rooms and a charming delicious breakfast on the roof garden. Staff was there to help you plan your day (if you asked) and welcomed you home. Helped with tourist problems (taxi, call home etc) with a smile. Istanbul was wonderful. My daughter dropped her walet in a very popular restaurant, staff called them for us, they had the wallet, and everything was in tact. Everyone was kind and happy to share Turkey with us.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, atmosphere and staff.”
Reviews.Author: Rosanne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 wonderful days/nights at Dersaadet Oteli in June 2007. I first saw the hotel mentioned in Arthur Frommerâ€™s Budget Travel, Nov. 2006 list of â€œ50 Utterly Charming Hotels Around $100.â€� I checked out the reviews on Trip Advisor , what a great resource and thanks for the suggestions which we tookâ€¦. upgrading to a sea view room on a higher floor for a better view, and asking for a mattress cover for the hard bed. Our room was very clean and comfortable, and, from the moment we arrived until our departure, the hotel staff, especially Front Office Manager Umit Ciftci and Billur looked after our every need. We casually mentioned one morning that we were celebrating our wedding anniversary, and that evening a fruit plate and bottle of wine were waiting for us when we returned from a day of sightseeing. Our flight left before the breakfast room opened but staff provided us with coffee and cake at 6:30 am. The hotel is in a non-tourist neighborhood, with a local barbershop, laundry, convenience store, and small car repair shop nearby. Still, we were only a few minutes away from the Hippodrome, Hagia Sophia, and Blue Mosque. Breakfasts were provided in the rooftop terrace, which has spectacular views of the Marmara Sea and the Blue Mosque. The free use of the computer in the lobby was a great way to keep in touch with our family. Free airport pick up if you stay more than three nights is a plus. Donâ€™t miss the Basilica Cistern. What a unique site. We also enjoyed the Sunday night 6 pm free concert by the Mehter Military Band in front of the Hagia Sophia. We visited the Jewish Museum in Zulfaris Synagogue and then walked back across the bridge to the spice market and had lunch at Hamdi Restaurant, great view and delicious pistachio kebabs. We enjoyed dinner at the â€œBlue House,â€� near the hotel, with a fabulous view of the Blue Mosque. One night the hotel made a reservation for us at the Develi (the restaurant picks you up and brings you back) for another good meal on a rooftop restaurant. The dessert Kunefe, fine baked noodles with cheese in hot syrup was fabulous. Istanbul is a vibrant, beautiful city with lots to see and do. The atmosphere of staying in a 19th Century ottoman house and the wonderful staff of the Hotel Dersaadet enhanced our stay beyond measure.

Reviews.Title: “A Welcoming Place”
Reviews.Author: FromStockton
Reviews.Content: The Dersaadet Hotel has everything you need to feel at home in a new city. The staff is extraordinary, the nicest, most eager to help people you ever met. The neighborhood is just a short walk to all major sights in the Old City, or convenient to an easy to use metro system. The staff will provide you with all the information you need to negotiate the City. Our favorite restaurants and stores were right there. There is a lovely terrace with breathtaking views of the Blue Mosque and The Marmara Sea. Breakfast includes home made breakfast breads and Mediterrean treats, although the coffee was disappointing (a weak, instant sort of nescafe flavor). The terrace has a bar and will serve drinks and coffee until late in the evening, although somehow we didn't know that until the last day. There is a free internet connection and computer at your disposal in the cozy lobby. Our experience was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: cwg
Reviews.Content: While this small charming hotel earns high marks for comfort, location, amenities, tasteful decor, and a beautiful rooftop terrace, it's the staff that puts it in a class of its own. From the moment we arrived (complementary airport pick-up with a stay of four or more nights) we were greeted by the most friendly, helpful personel we have ever encountered. Our room, a triple, was small but adequate, with a much appreciated minibar, television and bathroom toiletries (the thyme soap is a special touch). The rooftop terrace, serving drinks and light snacks (and where breakfast is served as well), was a special treat, especially at night, with stunning views of the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque; a relaxing, almost mesmerizing, way to end a busy day of sightseeing. Complementary internet access was appreciated also. Many of Istanbul's sights are within an easy walk from the Dersaadet, making it an ideal home base. Thank you to everyone at the hotel for making this the perfect introduction to a beautiful city and a breathtaking country. This is Turkish hospitality at its best!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Cozy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjbk
Reviews.Content: We usually enjoy smaller hotels and the Dersaadet was wonderful, so now I know why they receive so many compliments. The staff are all terrific, service oriented ladies and gentlemen who really do take the time out to speak with you and be as helpful and genuinely hospitable. The rooms are comfortable and everything seemed to work fine and all areas of the hotel were kept clean and in order. The roof top terrace is nice. The breakfast was o.k., can use a little bit of upgrading, but the essentials were there and were fine in that respect. Location is fantastic to visit all the sites in the Sultanahmet and even close enough to walk to their above ground Metro which was a wonderful way to get over towards the Taksim area. I would stay with them again, as the price is right and the service was terrific. Thank you Dersaadet for making our trip to the exceptional city of Istanbul, a truly memorable visit. I cannot say enough about how we fell in love with Turkey, itÂ´s culture and of course, itÂ´s charming people!

Reviews.Title: “lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosiefredo
Reviews.Content: Dersaadet hotel June 24,2007. World traveler Chappaqua,N.Y.We were delighted by the Dersaadet Hotel. an oasis in an exciting metropo;is . On arriving here we were greeted by one of several young friendly and knowledgeable managers who gave us an excellent orientation to the city . The goal of this hotel is to please their guests and that they did At breakfast one was available to give suggestions and answer questions.The rooftop terrace breakfast room was a real treat, excellent food including..daily homemade borek and a splendid view of the Blue Mosque . The terrace at night with the seagulls circling the Mosque to the multiple calls to prayer in the area was evocative of all the mystery and fascination of this city. The corner view suite that we booked lived up to our expectations .We could see the dawn and dusk over the Bosphorus.the amazing light the boats the birds. Their was a pleasant breeze in the room from the 5 large windows, The furnishings were in keeping with this splendid Ottoman house.An excellent choice for a stay in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Nice, But Number One?”
Reviews.Author: linda528
Reviews.Content: We had a four night stay at Dersaadet during our honeymoon. We chose it based on TripAdvisor. The hotel is in a good location and has a nice terrace where you eat breakfast in the morning and can have a drink at night. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. But the rooms are nothing special and seemed a little shabby. The hair dryer in the bathroom was extremely weak. Also the hotel had some issues with electricity while we were there. I would recommend this hotel for budget-conscious travelers and students. Others may want to look beyond Number One.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: kernac
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very accomodating. My daughter and I stayed here for two days. We booked a double, but got a double bed. Evidently, you need to specify twin beds; however, they were wonderful about putting us into a suite for the night until another room opened up. This location was excellent for discovering the important ancient sights in Istanbul. The rooms with a sea view do overlook the sea, but it is so far away and looks over so many deteriorating rooftops that the effect is not what it sounds like. The rooftop, however, is a wonderful place for breakfast or a cup of tea. We were directed to this hotel by the glowing description in Frommer's. I guess many people were because one of the staff told us that 60% of their guests were Americans. However, I do not agree with the appreciative description in Frommer's. This hotel is old and it feels old--some people might like that, but I am not one of them. If you are prepared for that, you will be able to appreciate stepping back into time.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: jarnina
Reviews.Content: All we can do is to confirm that all the raves this hotel receives are well-deserved.The location and friendliness of the staff is the best .I would return to and reccommend this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “first impressions are not always right”
Reviews.Author: kiwibear
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a gargantuan monstrosity in Hong Kong we arrived at 6.30am to the ramshackle streets of Istanbul's old town, just behind the Blue Mosque. The hotel looked tiny but cute as we entered the reception. The beauty lay within, the staff in particular made our stay memorable. We felt that we were met in a very genuine and helpful way by all the staff during our stay. We were warmly greeted, offered refreshments despite the breakfast room not opening for a couple of hours, and invited to wait around 20 minutes until our room was checked by 'housekeeping', who had not yet arrived. Our room was simple but lovely. We went up to breakfast and the service and selection surpassed expectations, as did the view of old Istanbul, the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorous. I mentioned my gluten intolerance which they had not come across. I was happy to eat what was on offer without gluten but the next day was offered my own gluten free loaf which the assistant manager had researched on the net and sourced for me especially! Impressive! Whatever our needs were at any time of the day we were well looked after. My birthday was recognised by all the staff and I felt very special! . My son was taught backgammon one afternoon by Cemil in the restaurant and both children were given local gifts as we left by the staff who were there to bid us farewell. So in all we felt that the care and attention we received far exceeded our expectations out of anywhere we stayed on our six week world tour. Thankyou all at Dersaadet!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Wandererer
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the good reviews on TripAdvisor and we werenâ€™t disappointed. The location is superb, the view from the roof terrace amazing, the building is interesting, the price is very reasonable, but what makes the whole experience is the staff. I have simply never stayed anywhere where the staff go out of their way quite so much to be pleasant and helpful. The view from the roof terrace was fantastic, with not just a great view of the Blue Mosque but also of the Sea of Marmara. We tended to return there in the evening for a post-prandial drink, as not only did you get the great view and the friendly staff, but the prices were cheaper than the local bars as well! Although the rooms are not big, they are scrupulously clean, and fully provided with toiletries, hair dryer, safe etc. The double bed was very comfortable, and plenty big enough for me and my wife â€“ and Iâ€™m 6â€™ 3â€�. Staying for four nights meant we got a complimentary pick up from the airport, which made the whole business of arriving in a strange city much more pleasant. One tip I would give is that you are given a discount for paying in cash. The price is in Euros, but they will also accept other currencies â€“ I paid in British Pounds. The hotel looks up the exchange rate on the internet as you check out, and shows it to you - so all above board. The best bit is that the exchange rate the hotel gives you is the â€˜properâ€™ bank rate, rather than a tourist rate, so it was a full 10% better than if I had changed my Pounds into Euros at the airport. Since the rooms have a safe, taking the cash with you should not be a problem. We were also impressed with how friendly and safe a place Istanbul as a whole was. The history of the place was fascinating, and there is a lot to see. We enjoyed ourselves far more than we expected too, and the Dersaadet played a big part in that.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing,excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: CHrisCooper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 4 night break in istanbul. We found this hotel by looking at tripadvisors reviews and we were not disappointed. Everything that everyone has said (except the one with the pillows) is absolutely correct and precise. What for me was the most impressive aspect of this hotel were the staff . They all were truly amazing, so friendly, helpful and knowledgable. The rooms were clean and comfortable and I had the best first night sleep ever. It is well located to all the sights, lots of great restaurants within walking distance and the views are amazing. I really enjoyed sitting on the terrace of an evening watching the sights and listenng to the call to prayer from the Blue Mosque. We shall certainly return to this gem and recommend it to all of our friends. Thank you to all the staff for making our 25th wedding anniversary one we shall never forget.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: unison22
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel, and based in the perfect setting for a few days as a tourist in Instanbul. The major sites are on the doorstep and the modern tram to the rest of this river-edged city is a few minutes walk up the hill. The rooms are clean with wooden floors and very well refurbished to match the old wooden building. We had a sea view room. The hotel is set in a little group of `real` streets behind the Blue Mosque with children playing in the street, a small corner shop opposite to buy water and a small garage across the road. The veg seller called out every afternoon as he pushed his hand-cart passed the door. It is very good for people watching! From the roof-top breakfast room and bar there is a perfect view of the back of the Blue Mosque and the opposite way is a view down to the waterfront - see picture. We could look down on a small local mosque and seagull chicks hatching on the roof below. Breakfast was healthy and very good too! A wonderful hotel, with very helpful, friendly staff who did everything to make our honeymoon a memorable stay. Highley recommended hotel - as is this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Excelllent Hotel, Lovely Decor with Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: Lmarent
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a trip to Turkey and we stayed at the Dersaadet. We both thought the hotel and the room and the service were among the best we'd had in Europe (both of us have traveled there extensively.) Here's why: the hotel is small, quiet and lovely. Really nicely decorated, with nice, new, luxurious fixtures and furniture, but with a quaint European feel. The rooms are large for European rooms, beautifully decorated and spotless. The bathroom was pretty and spacious and there was even great water pressure. The breakfast, which is included, was again, among the best we'd had in Europe -- it's a large, substantial buffet on a terrace with a gorgeus view of the Sea of Marmara. Breakfast included cereals, omelettes, cheese, meats, fresh fruit, homemade cakes and pastries. The service at the Dersaddet was also ridiculously attentive. Friendly English-speaking staff came and asked us what they could do to help us find our way through the city each morning at breakfast. They were wonderful. And all this for $136 USD per night. (I swear I don't work for the hotel.) This was just a gem. And, it's incredibly close to all of the old city sights! (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, tram, etc.) We loved it and would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely stay in Istanbul and the Dersaadet”
Reviews.Author: DebKay
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 day stay at this hotel and have had a wonderful time. First impressions of the hotel rooms were a little disappointing as the rooms were quite small and not quite as luxurious as we had hoped but everything else more than made up for the initial disappointment. The staff were absolutely wonderful - after our first night they enquired if our rooms were ok and were the beds too hard? We said that actually we did find them hard and within hours mattress toppers had been fitted and an extra pillow supplied (as requested). The hotel was spotless and smelt so clean - the staff were so helpful, cheerful and a wealth of local information. We spent a lot of time on the rooftop terrace admiring the views and having a drink (!!) and the waiting staff were so attentive and pleasant. I really can't find anything bad to say. The localion was excellent - just around the corner from all the major sites and with a lovely little bazaar just around the corner. As a general note we found the people of Istanbul so courteous and polite - we couldn't fault anything about our stay apart from the fact it wasn't long enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: mivo
Reviews.Content: This is a charming little hotel right in the heart of everything you want to do in Istanbul. Arasta Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi, Cistern, Hippodrome, etc all just a few blocks away. English speaking staff very supportive, free ride from the airport with minimum stay, beautiful rooftop view of the Sea of Marmara. Well appointed period decor. Reasonable rates. I'll stay there each time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: KatherineE
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a fabulous 5 days visit to Istanbul. This hotel was absolutely perfect. By American sizes yes the rooms may seem small but as a well travelled Brit I think the hotel has a far higher service than anything in UK and other areas of Europe! Our room had one very large double (great seeing as my other half is 6â€™9â€�) and another single also. Bathroom and room whilst simple was very very clean. It was a perfectly located base and we only came back to sleep and change as there is too much to do in this wonderful city. So to sum up: a lovely simple hotel, very clean, delightful and helpful staff, great price, wonderful roof terrace with views of the Sea or Marmara and Blue Mosque and lastly right there within 5-10 mins of the main sights. Question we kept having: Why are UK hotels in this budget and much above so poor! Imagine such a hotel in Central London = Never! Thank you to all at Dersaadet for making out trip so wonderful and answering all our questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: __CB__Milan
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay ad the Dersaadet. The Hotel is well located, close to the Blue Mosque, but far from the noise of some streets of Sultanhamet. The room was quite small, but very well furnished. Bathroom ok. Heating was a little too high, so we had to sleep with a window partially open. Great view from the breakfast terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Fine except for the pillows”
Reviews.Author: roger_sellek
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 2 kids) stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in early April 2007. We took a corner suite with an extra bed which was fine for our needs, although the bathroom was very small with no bath. The beds were OK, not great, but the pillows (filled with chunks of foam) were the biggest problem - all of us hated them. The location of the hotel is great for the many of the principal sights in Istanbul, and the Grand Bazaar is only about a 10-minute walk once you've discovered the shortest route. The staff were generally very helpful and keen to try to help - the only exception being when I called the hotel on our return home to ask if a couple of small travel chargers we'd left in a drawer could be posted back to us (at my expense) only to be told that this was too difficult ! Breakfast was again OK with very helpful service but the food on offer was uninspired. All in all, this hotel is OK though I suspect you can find equally good places in the same part of town at rates 20% below what the Dersaadet can get away with on the back of its TripAdvisor scores.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with fantastic staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: misspinkstar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dersaadet for 4 nights over Easter and had a great time. We had a free airport transfer as we were staying for over 4 nights. This was great as our flight was arriving late. The staff were amazing and went out of their way to help with restaurant reservations and basically anything we asked. They were also very friendly and constantly smiling which makes a big difference. A great breakfast served on the room and a great location made this without a doubt a great find. Would definitely stay there again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Dersaadet Hotel in Sultanahmet area”
Reviews.Author: BeniciaChris
Reviews.Content: You can't beleive how hard it was to choose a hotel in Istanbul for our visit last September.After I saw a little item in National Geographic Traveler on this hotel I started E-mailing them. They answered quickly-when we got there they picked us up at the airport. The location was perfect for seeing all the wonderful sites of Istanbul. We had breakfast every morning on a roof top terrace. On our last morning there we had to leave too early. They had our breakfast waiting in the loby. The rooms were large and clean. If I ever go back to Istanbul it will be there and in one of their suites

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Armbot
Reviews.Content: We (parents + 15-year-old daughter) just spent a week at the Dersaadet Hotel and had a fantastic stay! This cozy hotel is very well located at walking distances from major touristic attractions. The whole staff was always very helpful and very nice with us (and everyone). Having breakfast or a drink on the roof floor/terrace (with a superb view on the Marmara sea and the Blue Mosque) is a real treat. We must admit that we rarely have had such a good price/quality ratio for a hotel. Warmly recommended indeed. You can book there with closed eyes and will for sure not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: nancy118
Reviews.Content: A wonderful small botique hotel. The entire staff is wonderful- they go out of their way to help and offer assistance. we had the corner suite and it was a very comfortable room, always clean. the breakfast view is amazing and the food delicious. highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Superb throughout”
Reviews.Author: andy&sian
Reviews.Content: From the outset the four of us were made to feel totally wecome. The hotel is very well located for the sights & the rooms were of a good size & great value. The staff were very attentive, polite & kind, especially Cemil- he has an uncanny likeness to a young Robert de Niro. Make him smile & you'll see. The tasty breakfasts were lovely overlooking the Marmaris. All in all a great place to stay. Andy, Sian, Jonathan & Carole.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: KT785
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great staff and great staff. I stayed 5 days in December. Loved the view from the restaurant at the top. Breakfast was simple but the view was heavenly. The only downsides - very small bathroom - in my double room, the door actually hit the toilet pedestal and if one is aged or disabled, there may be some difficulty getting to very close-by torist attractions. These small negatives make me reduce the score to 4.5. Otherwise, a solid 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: audball
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night. I requested a sea view room but found that the view wasn't really that great so I don't recommend paying extra for the room.. Overall, the hotel was clean and the room was small but functional. The bathroom was a bit cramped but for the price that we paid, I was satisfied with our stay.The front desk was extremely helpful and answered all the emails I sent him regarding our stay. There is also a computer for guests to use, which was nice. I didn't get to try the breakfast as we had an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Just do it!”
Reviews.Author: Utahrealtor
Reviews.Content: Best small hotel, staff, location, views, breakfast and price in Istanbul. This is a slam dunk. Just do it!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, great location, lovely rooms, gorgeous breakfast spot”
Reviews.Author: MistressB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best weÂ´ve stayed in in 6.5 months travel - the staff were so helpful and friendly, rooms were lovely, the breakfast was excellent and the view from the rooftop breakfast bar canÂ´t be beaten. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Made me like Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: napastak
Reviews.Content: I loved Istanbul, and the Dersaadet Hotel can take a lot of the credit. I prefer to make reservations online, impersonally. But the personal touch of corresponding by email with the hotel owner was, to my pleasant surprise, not annoying. The airport-limo driver, who turned out to be the owner's brother, was warm and efficient, even though my flight arrived two hours late at 4:15 a.m. Likewise warm and friendly were the rest of the hotel staff, specifically the front-desk clerks and the waiter in the breakfast area. Speaking of breakfast, there were plenty of homemade items, and at least a couple of Middle Eastern specialities, including grape paste, which made breakfast an extra-special treat. Add to that the breathtaking views from the top floor, where the meal is served. The room was fine, the slippers a nice touch. No iron, though. (I didn't ask whether I could get one, however. I suppose I could.) And no in-room Internet, though you could get high-speed wireless from the lobby and the roof. The one thing that stressed me out was the fact that I kept getting lost trying to find the hotel. After the third time, the fact that I was walking on winding cobblestone alleys in a historic area lost its charm!

Reviews.Title: “Peerless”
Reviews.Author: maldonian
Reviews.Content: Stunning experience, from pickup to dropoff at the airport. Perfect location, breathtaking views, extraordinary service and attention to detail. The staff made restaurant recommendations that never led us astray and provided helpful advice on timing for the "tourist" spots, as well as arranging transport around the city. I single out the day manager, Umit, who on the spur of the moment helped me arrange to photograph neighborhood Bayram sacrifices; and overhearing a toast to my wife's birthday, he sent a tray of fruit and Turkish wine to the room the next day. Everyone else was equally friendly, courteous and helpful. My daughters now want to make the Dersaadet a holiday tradition.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: luvtravel98
Reviews.Content: We were meet at the airport by their driver, who was very nice. When we arrived at the hotel the service was excellent. Friendly and very pleasant staff. They over heard a conversation with my husband and friends, about how each had slept on our first night, when we came back we had more pillows and a featherbed to soften the bed. The staff was always willing to share places to eat and visit. Every place we eat was excellent. We walked every where, excellent location to all major sites. Having this hotel staff to come back to every night made our trip relaxed and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: expattravelerw/kids
Reviews.Content: We spent five days in the Corner Suite. The room was terrific. The service was better than any place we have ever stayed including name brand resorts at three times the price. The hotel is convenient to all the major sights and the staff helped with booking every restaurant and taxi ride when requested. The staff offered excellent advice on restraunts and sights to see with the pros and cons of each option being well explained. Not just giving the same response to each guest, but tailoring the response based on your feedback. The views of the Maramara Sea and the Bosphorous are gorgeous from the roof top breakfast room/bar. I cannot recommend the Dersaadet highly enough. All of the people from the owner, front desk, waiters and cleaning staff were friendly and customer oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MickeyUk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in October 2006, and it was excellent. The hotel is in a quiet area of Istanbul, but less than five minutes walk from the Blue Mosque (that is, the main tourist centre), and about ten to fifteen minutes walk to the main shopping area. The room was well decorated in an old-fashioned style, with a good shower, and satellite TV (including some English channels). There is wifi internet access in the main lounge. There is also somewhere you can leave your luggage after checking out if your flight home is not till later in the day. The breakfast room is on the roof of the hotel, part enclosed, part open air balcony. One direction has a view over the Sea of Marmaris, the other a view of the Blue Mosque. Stunning! Good breakfast as well, with slightly more choice than most Turkish hotels. The staff were very helpful and friendly, and spoke good English. The hotel arranged for a taxi to collect me from the airport (free if you stay three nights or more; 20 euros otherwise).

Reviews.Title: “Some of the friendliest people I have ever met”
Reviews.Author: donbeshy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short break last weekend. A great hotel with more character than the international chains. Brilliant location close to the most important attractions, room was clean and comfortable with great views. The hotel owner, manager and staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. All in all, try it - you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem Next to Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraAnn
Reviews.Content: "Oh every hotel claims to be have a view of the Blue Mosque," said a friend from Istanbul. And, yes it is hard to miss the mosque from rooftops across the hilly, magical city. Yet, the Hotel Dersaadet has prime real estate in the same neighborhood of the Blue Mosque -- literally one and half blocks away -- plus views of the Bosphorus. This is what makes it a great, intimate hotel for seeing Istanbul as the major sites are literally right around the corner. Add to that the wonderful service, clean/basic rooms, breakfast on the rooftop and it is a real find at a good price. I will admit I was concerned to have a room on the same floor as the lobby but it was quiet, albeit quite tiny. I would definitely stay here again, just on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Staff and Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: artartist
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in Istanbul because of the great people at the front desk and in the terrace breakfast room. Each person made a special effort to be helpful and make our stay pleasurable and eficient. We were picked up at the port from our Cruise by an excellent driver and whisked away to our hotel. It was compimentary if you stayed more than 3 nights, We had arrived earlier than check in but Umick made our wait pleasurable in the beautiful terrace with a view of the Mamara Sea and the Blue Mosque. I was also able to check my e-mail free of charge. Our room was very cheerful in bright yellows and a lovely sea view. It was small but cozy and perfect for our needs. We were able to catch up on the latest news on the BBC channel. When we were ready to go sight seeing Umick gave us a map with excellent and easy directions and taught us how to say Thank you in Turkish by using the words "tea sugar a dream" That was just the beginning of a nice dialogue with him and Sunay the other gentleman that gave us excellent directions and suggestions. He would even go outside to make sure we understood what direction to go. Cemil upstairs in the Terrace dinning area was also kind and generous and would offer us tea and coffee when we came back from our excursions and always with a smile. We will definitly come back to this charming hotel when we travel to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: flashkash
Reviews.Content: Great location and a decent enough price (book with hotel directly through their website) Rooms were nice enough - a bit dusty, bed linen was a bit dirty Bathroom - again it was ok service - excellent. very friendly and helpful. Every guest is given a quick overview of the best places to visit by the hotel desk manager 1 or 2 which were not that well known. they also took care of any issues we had such as some dirty bed linen(wasnt us ) or remote control not working. They also made us breakfast earlier than normal on our departure date because of our very early the flights. breakfast is ok and had some interesting local delights. The upstairs bar is usually empty but the viewing deck gives a great view of the blue mosque. The location is just behind the blue mosque and there is a great shopping parade nearby. You will hear the ahzan (call to prayer) in the morning before sunrise but hey you shouldn't be staying in this area if this is going to bother Overall the hotel itself is decent but not spectacular for the price however it is the great customer service which I believe makes it worth recommending

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful personnel and cute hotel great location, excelent attentions”
Reviews.Author: rosannar
Reviews.Content: I would like to express my sincere thanks for the great attention we received during our recent stay at this hotel from all the personnel there, particularly from Sunay who took such a great care of us arranging all of our tours and visits and always willing to provide help, the rest of the employees were wonderful too, at the front desk, in the restaurant, etc. I even had problems to access my work emails and they were always willing to help me do my work even while being on vacation. I would like to acknowledge the great human beings they have as employees , hope they keep up the good work they do and may they reach great goals in the hotel industry. Great location and is adorable too My sincere regards Rosanna and Maximo guests from the 14 of november to the 17th 2006

Reviews.Title: “The Delicate Dersaadet”
Reviews.Author: jumboromania
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Dersaadet at the beginning of November. We prefered this location based on your review. And for us, a 38 years couple, was a very good choice. In three words Dersaadet is professional, warm and delicate. Professional and warm because of all staff, e-mail responses (from 10 minutes to one hour), prompt response at requests, room freshness and an excellent quality of the sleep. The size of the room (not so big) is understandable (the hotel is located in an old building from the oldest part of the city). But the real challenge for the owners was to transform this location in a ottoman style comfortable hotel. And they did it very well, paying attention to every detail and creating a so delicate hotel. The view from the second floor rooms, with Marmara sea view, is a good investiment. If you feel that you need more space, just go on the terrace (after 8.00-10.30 am breakfast is working as bar with a breathtaking view) or in the reception lobby. Or just go outside on the streets discovering the unique combination between the new and old buildings. The location is perfect for a deep understanding of the history and the spirit of Istanbul. Donâ€™t forget to take some sea travels: on Golden Horn, Marmara Sea, and Bosphorus Cruise (starting from Eminonu â€“ 3 tramway station from Sultanahmet station: only one cruise in the winter time with 10:35 am departure and arrival at 12.05 in Anadolu Kavagi â€“ close to the Black Sea â€“ 30 min climbing a hill walk through the Genovese old fortress â€“ amazing view; departure time at 15:00 from Anadolu Kavagi and arrival time 16:30 Eminonu). And a cruise to the Princeâ€™s Island (you can see two of the islands from the room window if you stay in a sea view room). The streets, the people, the ceramics and Iznik tiles, the Anatolian carpets and kilims, the caligraphy, the Byzantium churches and the Ottoman mosques, the museums and above all, the astonishing panorama views from different points will remain in our memory for a long time. Thank you Dersaadet and thank you tripadvisor members for your truly and helpfully reviews ! Gabriel Milos, jumboromania@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Shropshirehills
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel direct, based on location and good reviews and we were not disapponted. This is an excellent small family-run friendly hotel in a great location close to a lot of the key sites. Before we arrived we emailed several times and always got a prompt response back. On arrival we were met by the hotel's driver and quickly whisked to the hotel. We booked one of the corner suites which was spotless, well-equiped and had great views out to the Sea of Marmara. The staff are really exceptional and I mean all of them including management, reception, bar/catering and cleaners. Nothing is too much trouble and they are always courteous and also very Knowledgeable and friendly. We liked the neighbourhood as it is a fairly quiet residential area yet is not far from Hagia Sophia, Hipperdrome and Blue Mosque. You can also get the modern tram nearby which goes across the Golden Horn to the lively Taskim Square/Istiklal Caddesi area of Beyoglu.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at its Best”
Reviews.Author: tamtalb
Reviews.Content: Welcoming staff and comfortable, well-decorated rooms await guests at Dersaadet. Housekeeping is superb. We booked with this hotel because of the views from the terrace cafe and they did not disappoint. The wait staff are attentive and helpful. The free internet cafe in the lobby is just one of the extras that puts this hotel over the top in guest satisfaction. Most of the major attractions in Sultanamhet are within easy walk of the hotel, but if you require a taxi, the front desk staff will negotiate a good rate on your behalf. I will stay at Dersaadet again, and give it the highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Local Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AggieTech
Reviews.Content: Great local hotel in a wonderful location-5 minutes walking to Blue Mosque and 15 minutes to Grand Bazaar. Hotel was clean and nice-rooftop terrace to sit a sip a beverage and enjoy the city. Staff was very helpful, giving us a map and directions. Lots of restaurants nearby too. If you you're staying for a short time and want to be see as much as you can, I would recommend this hotel. It doesn't have all the amenities of the bigger hotels, but it's a really nice local hotel with some of the Istanbul flavor. Also, very safe surroundings-people were helpful and many spoke english.

Reviews.Title: “Your home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Reed&Shiho
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed the hotel for 4 nights. The hotel is located in the downtown, so, a car-wash shop nearby the hotel will make some noises. However, such a noise is not a problem at all. Our sea-view double room was just enough for two. A lovely breakfast, a variety of homemade breads, olives, cheese, preserves and spacious view from the terrace will make your day happy. We loved crispy bread with honey and yogurt with rose petal jam. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We were impressed with their hospitalty. The hotel is not a five-star hotel, but there is surely an atmosphere to make guests happy from morning to the night. We offer the hotel with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Stanislov
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews read on TripAdvisor, I booked this hotel for three days during the first week of October. We were previously staying at the Hilton where my friend was attending a conference. While Dersaadet is quite different than the Hilton, it did not disappoint. The best thing about the hotel is its location. Literally 5 minutes to the Hippodrome, Blue Mosque, etc. The staff are very friendly and helpful and do their best to make your stay enjoyable. The rooms are comfortable and have a certain atmosphere that you'd expect in a small hotel of this type: intimate and unique. Great having the hotel laptop at your disposal. The terrace on the roof was an added bonus. Great place to enjoy the views of the Blue Mosque and the Sea. Breakfasts are good enough to get your day going. Dersaadet is a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: chefmac
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three days at the end of September. We stayed in a double-room with a sea view. It was interesting to look out onto a mosque tower in front of ships entering the Bosphorus. I agree with the previous reviews that this a fine hotel. The room was a good size for two people and had all the necessities. If I am to be picky I think the sheets and towels should be replaced as they have a little wear and tear. Everything else was of good standard. Having breakfast up on the terrace each morning was brilliant. The food selection and quality was good, including some homeade pastries. In the evening it is a good spot for a few drinks before going out on the town. One evening it was pouring down rain so we drank wine and played backgammon for a couple of hours. The star of the hotel is the staff. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. They went out of their way to make sure we had an enjoyable stay. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: Vinelady
Reviews.Content: We booked a "Bosphorus view" room, which was worth the extra cost. While the room was not large, it was clean and nicely decorated using an Ottoman (European influenced) design. There was a large amoire as well as a writing desk. The bath was a bit small, but spotlessly clean and decorated with fine tilework and coordinated wallpaper. The rooftop terrace was great. One side looked over the Bosphorus, and the other had a view of the Blue Mosque. Breakfasts were lovely, with a wide selection of Turkish items (local baked goods, fresh melons, wonderful yogurt, tomatoes and cucumbers). As we found elsewhere in Turkey, the breakfast buffet also included sliced meats, hard boiled eggs, dried fruits, nuts, honey and several kinds of cheese. The front desk staff spoke very good English and made our stay special. They have good suggestions for restaurants, gave an overview of Istanbul and the Sultanahmet district when we checked in, and summoned taxis quickly. The Dersaadet is well located, within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Agia Sophia and other sights. Note - there is an elevator to all guest room floors, but you have to walk up a flight of stairs to the roof terrace. The only negative for us was the low wattage of light bulbs in the room, which made reading more difficult. This problem was common in other hotels in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: MLBNYC
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, fantastic in a number of ways. 1. Location. The hotel is located within walking distance of the major sites (Blue Mosque, Ayasofia, Cistern, Grand Bazaar). It also is within walking distance of the tram -- which provides transit to the Egyptian Spice Market, the Galata Bridge, the Tunel funicular, and the ferry terminals. We took a taxi only once during our week-long stay (on the first day, before we got our bearings). 2. Hospitality. The hotel staff is unfailingly cordial and helpful. They provided airport transportation, made restaurant reservations, mapped out directions, and answered questions about the city. 3. The Breakfast and Terrace. Istanbul is a city chock full of terraces, and we dined and drank at several rooftop restaurants during our stay, but we never failed to be wooed by the view from the Dersaadet. We found it even more inspiring than the view from the Four Seasons. The included breakfast is delicious and filling, and it is quite an experience to sit on the terrace at dusk and hear the call to prayer ring out across the city. 4. The Rooms. We stayed for eight nights. Our first seven nights were spent in the Sultan's Suite. Though this room is pricey, you may find it a worthwhile indulgence. The room is huge, with a beautiful sitting area, many windows over looking the Marmara Sea, great breezes, and plenty of space to store clothing. It also is relatively quiet. On our last night, the suite was booked by another couple, so we had to stay in a standard double room. Even having experienced a more luxurious room, it's hard to complain about the smaller, and significantly less expensive, standard room: it was well-decorated and clean, though it had less spectacular views and more street noise than our former digs. 5. Free internet access. We did not bring a computer (if you do, there is free wireless access), but we took advantage of the laptop in the lobby, which has complimentary internet access. It's a bit creaky, but it did the trick. All in all, a great experience. We loved Istanbul and especially loved the time we spent at the Dersaadet. --Meredith and David, New York, NY.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Days on the Horn”
Reviews.Author: TonyDickenson
Reviews.Content: From pick-up at the airport to the charm of the owner and staff on arrival and throughout our stay, the 4 days we spent here were a delight. We had a corner suite and the large multi-windowed peaceful room was great. My wife has princess/pea issues, but when she mentioned the bed was a little firm for her, the staff sorted this out immediately. The terrace for breakfast and sundowners is fabulous with views of the Blue Mosque and the sea. The help the staff give with recommendations and booking of restaurants, suggestions for visits with opening times etc was exemplary.Try the Sunset Bar and Grill at Levent and 360 near Taksim for a taste of modern Istanbul but otherwise try the more local places recommended by the staff - Balikci Sabhahatin and Develi were great. All in all, the charm and perfect location of this hotel together with the outstanding staff make the Dersaadet a perfect base for exploring this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkerJournalist
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the previous reviews...this is a wonderful hotel! Great location, service and rooms. I chose this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and I wasn't disappointed. The driver from the airport was friendly and the staff was ready and waiting to greet us and promptly bring the bags to the rooms. Always friendly, smiling and wanting to help, the staff went above and beyond. The rooms are clean, beds comfortable and the roof terrace is lovely. The only suggestions I had for the hotel (complaint is a strong word, it's not quite a complaint) were to add more variety, specifically a hot item or two to the breakfast menu. The spread is great, don't get me wrong, but it never really changed and a hot dish or two would be great. Especially because I think at $140-$180, and given the quality of the hotel, the breakfast should match. But again, the breakfast was tasty, and I'd stay there again even if I still can't get hot eggs :) We stayed in 3 different rooms---the Dersaadet Corner Suite, the Sea View double, and the Penthouse Suite. The owner upgraded us on the last night, and I heard him do the same for someone else, without even being asked. I really like that kind of service! The Penthouse suite is large and beautiful, Dersaadet Suite gorgeous as well, spacious---perfect for a couple and child (2 beds, one of which a twin) and my husband and I were perfectly happy in the Sea View double the first night. Yeah it's a little small, but comfy bed, clean, and a nice bathroom. (we liked all the bathrooms, no problems with toilets or showers like I had read in previous postings) Great location, just a short walk to all the sights and a very safe area. We look forward to returning to this hotel. It's a find, take it from me and all the other reviewers! Also a sidenote--I highly recommend the restaurant Litera, near Taksim Square. Have the concierge make you a reservation. It overlooks the city, (gorgeous open-air dining room on roof) is just a cab ride (or tram ride) away, and one of our Turkish friends brought us there. Amazing meal and the best view of Turkey--overlooking both the east and west sides. Fine cuisine, wine and definitely an "in the know" type place, foodies, well-heeled Turks.. Go there, you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: SorrelH
Reviews.Content: On arrival, I was somewhat worried when we drove into the narrow somewhat dismal little street. But appearances can be deceiving and on entering the hotel I was immediately charmed by its friendly staff and cosy interior. The room was not large but very tastefully decorated and with the most breathtaking views. My bed was comfortable and the room further spottlessly clean. Breakfast was great on the rooftop, with even nicer views. I stayed for a total of 7 nights and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was fantastic: just a stone throw away from the historical sites and I soon felt at home in the area, enjoying simple meals at cafes round the corner. Free internet access was available in the lobby and rooftop and in some rooms. Considering the price, location and comfort, this will certainly be my hotel of choice again when staying in Istanbul, for both business and pleasure. S. Hidding The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Briard
Reviews.Content: Wonderful room, excellent location 100 meters from Blue Mosque, walk to Topkapi. Delicious breakfast on rooftop with stunning views of harbor. Helpful staff guided us to special restaurants and top sights. Couldn't have had a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, attractive large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Carmela77
Reviews.Content: The Dersaadet is a very nice hotel with spacious and attractive rooms and friendly staff. My daughter and i stayed there for a week. I really picked it for the location, - it's close to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya, but on the non-touristy side. But I was very satisfied with the hotel and the service.

Reviews.Title: “There's no place like home”
Reviews.Author: Lesley M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on arriving in Turkey and just before we left. Both times staff were not only friendly they were courteous ,helpful and made you feel as though you were part of one big family. The rooms were tastefully decorated in ottoman style and you even get your own slippers!!Yellow ones (not ruby) I would definitely recommend you check this great little hotel out as its not only near to all the sights it must have one of the most friendly staff groups in turkey. Check it out for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Zigby
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights at the Dersaddet in the Sultan's Penthouse suite and had an extremely enjoyable stay. The room was very grand, Turkish style, and extremely comfortable. The only minor gripe about the room was the lack of bright lighting in the bathroom, and the bathroom was large enough to have a separate shower instead of over the tub. That aside, the staff were fantastic, friendly and very helpful. The rooftop terrace is great with views to the blue mosque and the sea of marmara. It was our first visit to Turkey and we would love to return and would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dersaadet”
Reviews.Author: Calvinhobbes
Reviews.Content: The charming, Ottoman-style Dersaadet Hotel in the Sultanahmet (old city) part of Istanbul was among the highlights of our recent trip to Europe. I'd been worried that our request to be met at the airport would go awry and we'd be left, exhausted, to find our own way into town, but no, a courteous young man from the hotel was waiting for us just as promised. He drove us into town in a little van with curtained windows and pointed out sights along the way. All the staff were equally pleasant and warm, and we felt very welcome. Our elegant room (hardwood floors, Turkish rugs, marble sink, polished woodwork) overlooked the Marmara Sea (I highly recommend asking for a sea view!) and was roomy and spacious, apparently unusual attributes in the Ottoman hotels. One of the best parts of the hotel was the roof garden, where we had breakfast each morning overlooking minarets and the sea. The spread was quite elaborate and quite delicious, from the feta and olives to the cherry juice and coffee, and kept us going till dinner. Late in the afternoons we returned to the hotel hot and sticky, showered, and went to the roof garden to relax over a raki, and sometimes after dinner over a brandy (someone staffs the little bar until midnight). The location of the Dersaadet was perfection as well. It was within easy walking distance of everything we wanted to see: the Blue Mosque, the Aya Sofia, the cistern, Topkapi Palace, the Hippodrome, the Grand Bazaar, the spice market. A note of caution: If you do need a cab, ask the Dersaadet staff to call one for you. You'll be happier with the experience than if you find your own. As you can see, this is a rave review. We want to return to Istanbul, if only to stay again at the Dersaadet.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous experience!”
Reviews.Author: Heiwahito
Reviews.Content: A very welcoming hotel with excellent, caring, professional staff and a location you can't beat. Very easy walking distance to all the major attractions and shopping. Internet access is ideal for those needing/wanting to stay in touch while traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great for families”
Reviews.Author: jjlji
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a wonderful stay at the Dersaadet Hotel. We have three young children (ages 10, 8, 4) and the staff was extremely welcoming and friendly. The location is excellent for walking to most sights. The rooms are large and comfortable. Stay in the Sultan's Suite if you can, it is enormous, posh and fun! The roof top cafe is one of the best parts of the hotel. We enjoyed tasty breakfasts there (the tomatoes in Turkey are the best we've had in a long time). But the best time to enjoy the deck is after a long day of sightseeing, enjoying an Efes beer and gazing at the Blue Mosque and the Marmaris! Turkey is a great country to visit with kids. Turkish people love children and you will be welcome with them everywhere. My four year old daughter was treated like a princess. The Dersaadet Hotel is an excellent choice for Istanbul, we would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “What a Location!”
Reviews.Author: bigredjohn
Reviews.Content: The location is stunning. You're two blocks from the Blue Mosque, and from the hotel breakfast room and bar on the rooftop you can see the mosque and the sea. You're within walking distance of the tram, key historic sites and restaurants. The Dersaadet is relatively small, old-fashioned, in a house remodeled to resemble an old Istanbul home. No pool. But it's located in a real, walkable Istanbul neighborhood with working class residences and shops, not a pure tourist neighborhood. The staff is helpful. Our corner suite was large and well-furnished, but with a cranky toilet and a horrible shower contraption like none I've ever seen before. The air conditioning didn't work very well, the in-room safe was balky, the key to the front door barely worked, and the breakfast was continental, not hot.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and breakfast terrace but small room.”
Reviews.Author: alkd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in THE perfect location. It's within walking distance to many sites and just a tram ride away from everything else. The staff in this hotel is exceptional...very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the beautiful rooftop terrace with views of the Marmara Sea. Breakfast here was a very nice way to start each day. The only complaint I have is that the room we got was very small. I'm sure there are some better rooms in the hotel, but our bathroom door couldn't even open completely because it would hit the toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed in Dersaadet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a terrible value. While it would be a great find for 60-70 USD I was paying 85 euros (because I read the great reviews) and was VERY disappointed. Things went from bad to worse when I told the owner I wanted to find another hotel and he insisted he was going to charge me a night in the room for canceling. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Loved & appreciated Dersaadet Hotel, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The personal attention and sincere help were outstanding. Excellent staff. Special mention for the owner, Mr. Duyar, and his superbly qualified assistant, Mr. Sunay. It was a delight to have Mr. Sunay's daily advice, as needed. He expertly guided us as we made the choice to visit Edirne. The veiw of the Bosporus was ever changing and very real. Delicious Turkish and Western breakfast on the rooftop terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic small hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On our recent 5 week trip in Turkey we stayed with Dersaadet twice and would rate it as the best of a good bunch of places we stayed the entire trip. Our ideal places to stay are small, friendly with plenty of character and this one fits that bill exactly. This is a small hotel so if you want big, smart swanky look elsewhere. But if you want a place that is neat as a pin, personal, filled with character and in a good location with really helpful staff that want to make sure you have a good time in Istanbul then this is the place for you. The hotel is more like a large bed and breakfast set in a beautifully restored Ottoman house. We found the entire staff treated us like one of the family, nothing was too much trouble and we loved our room with a view of the Marmara and the roof Terrace, with a close up view of the Blue Mosque and the Marmara, was the perfect place for breakfast and an evening drink. Internet access is free. Breakfast is really good with plenty of choices and everything fresh. If you stay at small pensions in Turkey you will find a lot of breakfasts are just tomatoes, cucumber, chees and bread. Some rooms are a little cramped so we recommend paying the extra for a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Second to none”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The minute we stepped through the door of the Dersaadet Hotel we knew we had made the right choice for our first visit to Istanbul. This is a charming little hotel. The staff were friendly & helpful, the rooms spotlessly clean,there was plenty of choice for breakfast which was taken on the terrace with views over the Sea of Marmare. We have no hesitationin recommending this hotel and will certainly stay there again on our next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Mars1118
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days in Istanbul at the beginning of June and it was incredible. We stayed at Dersaadet and it was great! The service is fabulous, the rooms clean, comfortable and good size (with the exeption of 202 - but I got over it after one nigiht.) The terrace roof was the best. We spent every evening after walking all around Sultanhamet on the rooftop. I loved being in that part of Istanbul; close to the Blue Mosque and all the other fascinating attractions. Plus, friendly and welcoming restaurants, shops and children who helped us find our way. Special thanks to Sunay, Umit and everyone at Dersaadet. You helped make our trip memorable.

Reviews.Title: “think bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sorinrock
Reviews.Content: First, Istanbul is one great experience: very romantic, exotic, and pretty. Its also a big city. However, staying at the Dersaadet Hotel removes the big city feeling. Its location is perfect, near the sites and in the old part of the city, with narrow streets and a feeling of the traditional rather than contemporary. The hotel is small and cozy, the staff very friendly and helpful. They will do whatever they can to make your stay a pleasant one. The view from the terrace on the top of the hotel is fantastic, with an amazing view of the Blue Mosque. The single rooms are very small. I stayed in a nice sized room with a double bed and a single bed. Very nice, comfy, like a room in someone's home.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located”
Reviews.Author: Salta
Reviews.Content: We spend 5 nigths at Deesardet for May 20th to 26th. We have a very good experience, very well located and friendly and very helpfull staff. Our experience regarding service could be summirized by this story: After departing to Bodrum my wife realized that she forgot a very nice dress at the hotel. She contacted Deniz, the manager/owner, and he without hesitate just found the dress and send it to us via fedex!!! More than we expected!! The rooms are decorated with a very nice turkish style. The standard rooms are very small, so we strongly recommend to get the superior ones. The management is very aware of its reviews at internet, therefore they do whatever is possible to them to make sure that you will have a great experience. Do not expect a fancy or modern boutique hotel, however it is a very cozy turkish decorated small hotel with a great service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Dersaadet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Dersaadet in Istanbul and were very happy with our choice. It is in the historic section of the city within walking distance to many of the interesting sites. The hotel itself is clean and attractive. The breakfasts were very good. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charm, elegance and courteous service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dersaadet Hotel on my first trip to Istanbul, this April. I had done research on the Internet before I left, and the name of the hotel came up repeatedly - all reviews were highly positive. First, they sent someone to pick me up from the airport (free of charge). That was a huge thing for a woman travelling alone and very tired. There was not one thing I asked the staff to help me with that they failed to do; they ordered cabs, made suggestions about walking around the city, gave me wake-up calls, stored my luiggage on the last day, and so forth. The view from the hotel terrace is wonderful, and nothing beats their delicious breakfast- all fresh produce and limitless amounts of it! I will be back there on my next trip and hope that I see some familiar faces amongst the lovely staff.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service, good location and room”
Reviews.Author: California1128
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a bunch of hotels in our recent Turkey trip, and the service here was by far the best, helping us in all manners of assistance. Our room was nice and we had a nice view of the Marmara Sea. Our room was a bit noisy, and we had to sleep with the windows closed and the AC on. The one downside of this hotel is the location is ok, but we also stayed at the Empress Zoe in Istanbul - and the Zoe neighborhood is nicer, more restaurants, etc. nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: will in sf
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice family run hotel in Sultanahmet. It is very close to Aya Sofya and the Blue Mosque. The service was exceptional: everyone in the hotel was friendly and genuinely interested that we had a good time in the hotel and in the city. One of my favorite memories of a two-week stay in Turkey is sitting in the Dersaadet's roof top bar, having a cold beer, and watching the sea gulls circling the minarets of the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Place”
Reviews.Author: OFVCAT
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Corner Suite from the 20th to the 25th May this year. The people were very friendly, polite and ready for a laugh. Every guest gets the orientation with the map of the tourist area and routes to the sites. We acted on their restaurant recommendations twice, and were delighted both times. One of the restaurants sent a taxi for us and the manager drove us home himself at 10.30 pm! To Dersaadet itself. The breakfast was wonderful up on the terrace with every cold dish possible and orange juice to die for. From the terrace there is a view of the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara with ships coming and going to order. Several times we returned to the terrace during the day. They cook a mean cheese omelette and it was just a great spot to gather your thoughts and relax. The owner, Deniz was often around and always had time for a chat. The Corner Suite was spacious, comfortable and clean. The TV had a variety of channels, including BBC1! A real bonus for us was the wireless Internet connection which we had running within 30 minutes of our arrival. Overall a magical hotel run by wonderful people.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Similar to an earlier reviewer we had spent two nights at the Hotel Nena (due to the Dersaadet being sold out) before switching to the Dersaadet. Although all the staff at every hotel we stayed at in Turkey were friendly and efficient, the Dersaadet staff adds an added dimension of sincerity and kindness that is really amazing. The hotel manager is delightful and assisted us personally with a reservation problem we had which he resolved to everyone's satisfaction. The free internet access on the laptop in the lounge area was a godsend and very convenient. The breakfast was superb and the view terrific as well. I must admit that initially I was a little surprised by the residential location which at first blush appears a little gritty. However, I was immediately put at ease by the hotel staff and the friendly neighbors. Unlike previous reviewers I didn't notice any unusual noisiness at any time of the day or night. In fact it was pretty quiet! Note: this is very near all the Sultanhamet sites.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place (...a bit noisy)”
Reviews.Author: travelinbetween
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights April 18 & 19, 2006. The staff are superb. Hotel is within walking distance of all the major tourist sights in Sultanahmet. The Sultan Suite is nice, but the hotel's web site made it appear the balcony looks onto the water when actually it looks onto the street. The staff really were superb. It is a bit noisy, but still a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just beautiful”
Reviews.Author: HelenaAthens
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Dersaadet. After having read all these amazing reviews, i was expecting a nice small hotel with a friendly environment. The hotel was actually better that we expected. From the moment we arrived at the airport, until the day we had to leave, we were provided with anything we could possibly asked for, by the amazing staff memebers of the hotel. They were all extremely kind, genuinely friendly, helpful and efficient. I must say this is very rare, and it is the biggest asset of this overall beautiful hotel. The room was spacious and tastefully decorated, and the bathroom was impecable in terms of hygiene. We stayed at the lobby level, and i must say the noise from the street can be a bit disturbing sometimes (especially in the morning), but it is not so bad, and certainly not enough to ruin the great atmosphere dersaadet offers. Having breakfast at the terrace was one of the best times of the day. The view up there over the Marmara Sea is just breathtaking. Overall, we just loved this hotel, and we would strongly recommend it to anyone that visits Istanbul. It is very rare to feel so good in a hotel in a foreign city. The people at Dersaadet can totally make this happen for you.

Reviews.Title: “mixed review”
Reviews.Author: akm104
Reviews.Content: just returned from a week in Istanbul. first night at Hotel Nena - small room but great location and staff. Next six nights at the Dersaadet. Great room (corner suite) with tiny bathroom. Less convenient location in a residential area with a lot of street noise - car wash outside the window, fighting dogs, and conversations that were not at all muffled by closiing the windows. However, the staff was helpful and kind and the place was very clean and well-kept.

Reviews.Title: “Not Only a Wonderful Place but the Staff is Par Excellence”
Reviews.Author: BIW
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a boutique hotel this is a fantastic one. For character it is unsurpassed. I don't like decor which hits you in the face but instead has an understated elegance to it. This one has it. Its detail is so complete that the wood grain found in the lobby is the same type and color found on the closet in your room! I even took a picture of the elevator as I thought it was beautiful! I cant compare room size with others in the area and, like most non-US hotels, expect it to be smaller. But it certainly was comfortable and not at all cramped. Breakfast on the roof consisted of homemade bread (fantastic), olives, granola and many other items i cant recall. But the best qualities of the hotel is the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. They all get an A+ from me. For example, when I told the desk person that I was planning to go to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia they asked me to come to them before I go for an orientation. Mind you this was not to recommend that I buy a tour from one of their friends or to go buy a carpet, etc. It was to tell me how much time I should expect to spend at each place, best way of getting there (a 5 minute walk), what to be on guard about, etc. It was a special service which I found very refreshing. Their extreme level of helpfulness, however, was reserved for another needed time. The most valuable service a hotel staff can provide for you is security, if and when it is needed. Luckily there arent many times (if ever) that you may need to call on their familiarity with the culture, or knowledge about certain situations to assist you. Unfortunately, however, I was a victim of a scam and turned to the hotel management and staff for their help. It required them to confront the criminal and to also contact, and get involved with, the police. They could not possiby have done a more professional job in defusing the situation and giving me a sense of security, well-being, and empathy. They were flawless in making me feel as comfortable as possible, and in defusing an escalating situation by making it clear to the criminal that he was not going to get what he wanted. There are other hotel staffs which I'm sure would have done the same. The problem, however, is that you don't know how a staff will react until there is already a situation. It is extremely reassuring to know that the people at the Dersaadet not only provide for your comfort, but also for your safety.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Retreat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Easter weekend and had a very memorable experience. The hotel is in a fabulous location for exploring the old city which alone saves you a good bit on taxi fares! Deniz has done an excellent job in making the hotel feel like a home away from home. The service was incredible and the staff was always willing to go out of their way to make our stay more enjoyable. The breakfast was also a treat. Although it was the basic fare, all items were extremely fresh (not always the case in Turkey)and presented well.
