The main highlight of our breakfasts, though, was watching the dolphins playing in the water. Amazing! If you are looking for a quiet repose in a very large city, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SJamele
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we only had one night at this fabulous hotel the evening before we flew home from Turkey. We wish we had many more! The staff was the friendliest we have ever encountered in a hotel, going out of their way to accomodate our needs and offering extra service we didn't even expect. The rooms are very clean, well decorated, and comfortable. Tasteful ammenities and free internet to check on flights and catch up with email. The rooftop cafe is the perfect spot to relax after a busy day of sightseeing with breathtaking ocean views and the Blue Mosque. We would highly recommend this hotel which is within walking distance of Istanbul's sights.

Reviews.Title: “A wondeful place in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dersaadet hotel for 5 nights and found the place and the staff outstanding! The room was nice and clean, braekfast was good and the views from the roof terrace were beautiful. We recommand staying at this hotel while visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “great place just like home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: location location and location. if you really want to feel the city, this is the place to stay. we loved it and when we go back we will again definetly stay there. All in all I would definetly recommend it. the staff was amazing and helpfull and the owner added that extra touch making one feel right at home. thankyou guys we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A truely charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Dersaadet hotel was listed under the intriguing heading of 'charming hotels' and it lived up to its reputation! On appearances alone, it earns its name. It is a tall wooden building in the ottoman style. The decor inside reflects the tradition of the country and the city. All of the rooms are decorated in traditional style. We had a great view of the sea; but what I loved most were the complimentary sliipers! The staff were extremely helpful, giving us advice on where to go, what to expect, how much to pay in the taxis... The Dersedaat was a haven in Istanbul, a beautiful but sometimes overwhelming city. I highly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: mwexplore
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff members are very helpful, accommodating, and charming. The hotel benefits from a great location, providing a convenient base from which to explore the old city. Internet access is complementary. The rooftop breakfast room offers panoramic views. The hearty breakfast includes some homemade items, as well as Turkish coffees and teas.

Reviews.Title: “Don't need to ask for more...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and a close friend of mine stayed in Hotel Dersaadet in February 2006. The hotel includes all the basic facilities you may need throughout your stay. We had no problems at all. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Dersaadet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent a lovely week in Istanbul at the Dersaadet Hotel. It's a small hotel (17 rooms) located in the historical district of Sultanahmet. The four of us shared one of the corner suites and had plenty of room with a view of the Sea of Marmara. The breakfast was great in their roof-top Terrace and since we were there in the winter (it snowed for a few days!), we had the space all to ourselves much of the time. The staff were very welcoming, experienced and had great suggestions for restaurants and things to do. The hotel was within walking distance (and with a three year old) of The Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, etc. We'd go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice in Sultanachmet”
Reviews.Author: jeffdoc
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Dersaadet Hotel for two nights. It was an excellent choice in the Sultanachmet (Old City) area of Istanbul. The hotel was conveniently located for touring the major historic sites but was just off the main tourist streets--making it quieter with a more relaxed feeling. The rooms were well decorated and equipped, clean and comfortable. My room had a sea view that was most enjoyable and worth the small additional charge. The Dersaadet staff was exceptional: I was met at the airport (though my plane was quite late), given helpful information about the city, restaurants were recommended and reserved and I was given help with use of the hotel computer (for e-mail). The top floor breakfast room was most enjoyable with great views of the Blue Mosque and Sea of Marmara. Breakfasts were ample and delicious. In all, I cannot think of a nicer small hotel in the old portion of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is wonderful, you can see the Blue Mosque from the windows and it is ideally situated for all of the major sights and most as within walking distance. You can also see the sea from the hotel - truly wonderful even on a cold winter morning. The rooms have been beautifully restored and are clean, tidy and well kept. Breakfast is very good and the staff exceptional. Everyone was helpful and looked to ensure we had the best time whilst we were there. You won't find a better hotel all round in Istanbul - I would recommend the hotel and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place In The World”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Dersaadet Hotel for one week during our visit to Istanbul. If you are looking to make all aspects of your trip perfect look no further. Elif, Deniz and Aziz including the rest of the staff made us feel like we were at home. I can not say enough good things about this special place. The rooms are very comfortable, the view is pure paradise and the breakfast is to die for. I still eat the same breakfast now at home. Elif is an Angel who made our stay heaven. In my reservation request I informaed her that my friend had a bad back and could not walk up alot of steps. Elif along with the maid gave us a special bed for my friend to rest on. It made all the difference in the world to my traveling companion. The front desk staff is always suggesting great places of interest for us to see. When Elif found out I had made plans to meet with a tour company for a higher than usual price she called around and found us a better deal saving us over 100 Euro per person. From the Hotel Manager to the maid you can not find better people to be with in Istanbul. I plan to go back with my family this year and the next.

Reviews.Title: “Lived Up to Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: schnauzerlady
Reviews.Content: We are great fans of TripAdvisor: we based our decision to book the Dersaadet on the opinions we read, and we were not disappointed. We asked the hotel to arrange for a pickup at the airport: they were there to greet us upon arrival. If you book directly through the hotel and stay for three or more nights, this service is complimentary. We were also greeted at the door of the hotel, and our luggage was taken immediately to our room, which was on the entry-level. We did not find the noise to be a problem -- thanks to TripAdvisor, we knew to take earplugs; we did not have what might be termed "a view," but I am sure we could have had we paid more. Our room was a bit on the small side, but it was absolutely spotless. We had specified non-smoking ... and we were a bit distressed at first to find an ash tray in the room; however, we did not note any tobacco smell. Our room had cable TV, free wifi access (there is also a computer with internet access in the lobby for guest use: it is my understanding that wifi extends to most, but not always all, rooms), in-room safe, and a pair of the cutest slippers --with the Dersaadet logo-- for each of us. One suggestion I might make is that terry robes be available: I know these have a tendency to "walk" but perhaps a check-out system could be implemented. The breakfast was adequate --cheeses, meats, tomatoes, cucumbers, excellent bread and roles, and tea or coffee. However, with the exception of the homebaked pastries, the fare did become a little repetitive after a few mornings. Please note, I am NOT suggesting a rich (and western) breakfast of eggs and bacon -- just a little more variety in what is served. I also was not a big fan of the "juice," which was really not much more than Koolade: fresh squeezed orange juice was available for an additional 2 Euros. The hotel's location is ideal -- an easy walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and the Arasta Bazaar (which in our opinion was far, far nicer than the Grand Bazaar); it is also only about seven blocks to the tram. There are several small restaurants quite close by, and we loved take out from Doy Doy. For wonderful fish try Balikci Sabahattin -- again, only a few blocks away. All in all, the Dersaadet offers good value and is an excellent choice for those who want to experience a bit of the "old" Istanbul --although don't get so caught up in the wonders of Sultanahmet that you don't cross the bridge and see the modern city-- while having the advantages of a well-run hotel with modern conveniences and an excellent (English speaking) staff.

Reviews.Title: “I chose the Dersaadat after much research...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to Istanbul. I chose the Dersaadat Hotel after much research because of the excellent reviews this place received from various Internet sources and travel guides. We were not disappointed. The staff was helpful and friendly and spoke very good English. The rooms were well decorated, clean and comfortable with a modern bathroom and good working shower. We were offered a free breakfast buffet every morning on the rooftop of the hotel that offered wonderful views of the city. The rooftop had both indoor and outdoor seating. Also, this hotel is located in the Sultanahmet district and is in great proximity to all of the major tourist attractions. I would not hesitate to stay at the Dersaadat Hotel again or to recommend it to others. - Mary C., La Crosse, WI, U.S.A.

Reviews.Title: “A Home - away from Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel from 29 Nov 05 - 04 Dec 05. The Hotel is centrally located near to most of the Historical Places. The surroundings give you a feel and hospitality Turkish People. The hotel is well furnished, typical Turkish style with a cafe at the roof top serving excellent Turkish Breakfast. The staff is efficient, very courteous and very helpful in advising and arranging visits and tours to various historical locations and city itself. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend to those who wants to feel and experience Turkish Culture.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on trip advisor. I read the reviews from other people who went to this place. Anything positive anyone had to say about this place was absolutely true. I just returned from a 5 night stay at the dersadaat. The service at this hotel was impeccable. I have stayed at 4 and 5 star hotels in the past; the service of the staff from the Dersaadat was far better than from those 4 and 5 star name brand hotels. Not only is the service great, the location of this hotel is outstanding. It is walking distance from all the major sites and is close enough to the city so that if you need to take a cab, your not spending more than 5 or 10 lira. We walked to all the historical sites, took a cruise accross the bosphorus, went by cab to some of the modern day sites and malls, and ended each day with an "at home feelign" at the dersadaat. ***HIGHLY RECOMMENDED*** Say "hi!" to Omit and Sunay if you go there! If you have any questions about the city, the hotel, things to do or have any questions or concerns, feel free to email me. NO SPAM PLEASE.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: Sarah 28
Reviews.Content: Great location and very helpful, friendly staff. Our (very small) first floor room had a slight view of the sea but a better one of the garage across the road. Ask for a room higher up. The bathroom was also microscopic and the heat of the water in the shower seemed to come and go. Breakfast on the terrace with the view of the Blue Mosque and the sea was a treat. Take ear plugs! What with fighting cats, barking dogs and calls to prayer starting at 5.50am, sleeping wasn't always easy, even with the windows tightly closed. If you want to buy rugs, would recommend looking around the many stores in Sultanahmet (the area local to the hotel) before braving the Grand Bazaar. We got some great deals (be prepared for a long-winded buying experience) and made a very special new friend with one of the rug traders. The Sultanahmet traders told us the Grand Bazaar was over-priced and the integrity of the traders there varied enormously. We believed them and had those beliefs confirmed when we did get to the Bazaar. A memorable trip (for all sorts of reasons) to a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Dersaadet”
Reviews.Author: trailfinder
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Istanbul was made even more enjoyable by staying in this wonderful hotel set in the heart of Sultanahmet. The hotel exudes warmth and character, the staff are all very friendly and are always willing and able to help with advice and information. The view from the cafe terrace is stunning across the Sea of Marmara and round to the Blue Mosque. Taking breakfast on the rooftop terrace is a real treat, you could so easily while away the day watching the comings and goings on the Sea of Marmara from the rooftop terrace. We would have no hesitation in using the Dersaadet on our next visit to Istanbul. We hope that many more visitors will book in to the Dersaadet and experience what we experienced. Nick and Lesley, Bristol, UK

Reviews.Title: “A small gem on the Istanbul crown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is the perfect place to stay when visiting Istanbul. Wright in the middle of the Sultanamet district with the blue mosque, Aya Sophia, Topkapi, ...nearby, but so quiet at night! The service is excellent! The staff is very friendly and helpful! We had a great time in Istanbul and Dersaadet!

Reviews.Title: “I don't write hotel reviews but...”
Reviews.Author: JHALondon_England
Reviews.Content: Once I'd ruled out that I couldn't afford to stay at the Four Seasons, the Dersaadet was my next best choice for character (photos available on site), location and because of the staff ratings of good friendly service. The hotel exceeded expectations set by various reviews. The staff were always friendly and helpful and I appreciated the advise provided on finding my way around Istanbul. The rooms were comfortable and airy and I loved having my breakfast on the roof terrace each morning. Highly recommended by me.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: DebV_10
Reviews.Content: Small boutique hotel in the best spot in the Sultanamet. Great service - the staff showed genuine concern and care. Exceelent rooms and they had a family size one. Highly recomended and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Staff!”
Reviews.Author: TedandJanie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dersaadet for 5 nights and loved it...close to all the major attractions, sited in an interesting residential area, wonderful staff, beautiful views of the sea and free wireless Internet. Our deepest appreciation to Deniz, Sunay, Efis and the rest of the staff for making us feel at home, arranging events, and giving us tips and general info, and making sure we were pleased - they really made our stay so enjoyable. The views from the cafe were a delight and coming back to enjoy a cool drink on the rooftop after a long day of walking was so nice. We recommend the Sultans Suite...great views, roomy, a balcony, and nice breeze with open windows at night. The one minor issue (we blew a light bulb) was taken care of quickly and with good cheer. So, if you go to this wonderful city, we wholeheartedly recommend the Dersaadet - one of the best hotels we have stayed in worldwide!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for a short break in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Sarka
Reviews.Content: We can only echo the positive reviews for the Dersaadet Hotel on this website. Exceptional value, friendly service, and ideal location. Can't wait for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small and basic but the view from the rooftop terrace and the care and attention of the staff more than makes up for the simple rooms. Internet access was available all the time at no charge. The breakfast was great and included home made goodies. The staff made us sandwiches for dinner when we arrived late and were hungry. The location is central and safe. The hotel picked us up at the airport and arranged our transfer to the ship. They worked very hard to make our stay a positive experience which it was.

Reviews.Title: “Dersaadet was marvelous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dersaadet has a great location - quiet yet totally 'in the stream' of life; a marvelous and friendly and helpful staff; wonderful facilities - including Internet - and very comfortable quarters. It's a small hotel with all the amenities one might want, a great view, and fantastic service.

HotelInfo.Name: Dersaadet Hotel Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Kucuk Ayasofya Cad. Kapiagasi Sokak No:5 | Sultanahmet ( Old City District), Istanbul 34400, Turkey
